review_body: Location is great, near the beach and a lot of stores. Hotel isn’t very modern but it still offered great amenities. Front desk was really helpful in answering our questions and even booked us a last minute ride to the airport. Hotel staff were very polite and when we needed more towels, the staff were quick to provide for us. Definitely recommend this place if you’re looking for a great location in Waikiki.

We came in on 3-13-20 for a Friday night stay before our week rental on the North SHore. The Ambassador Hotel is the best location for anything Waikiki. Open and airy, many room choices, great amenities. It is a beach hotel, not the Ritz Carlton but they don’t advertise that they are. I read the negative reviews before I booked and I know a lot of people are hard to please. We were to come back in on the 21st for 2 more nights before flying home. The clerks at the desk knew when we checked out we were coming back so they upgraded us for the second stay and we were not disappointed. This hotel is within walking distance of anything you want to do, the wal-mart, SAMs, ABC stores, local gift shops, red lobster, outback, post office, Tony Romas, Hard Rock. And of course right across the street from Waikiki beach. I’m going back.

Hotel did not have our reservation that I made through cancelon, their customer service never return our call! Don’t use it! It ruined our vacations! Cancelon is scam! Be Aware! Stay Away! Run away from it!

Picture on their website do not match up at all, dirt and rust stains in the bathroom and kitchen, no furniture on balcony, didn’t even have blankets on the bed. Our flight was canceled so we missed a night at the hotel they would not offer us a refund for the night we didn’t stay. I would not recommend this to anyone! Horrible

Lights flickered in the bathroom, carpet in bedroom was stained, beds were uncomfortable and tiny. The walk way was filthy and pictures on website was not the same room I booked. Will definitely not stay here again.

Great location in Waikiki, close to shopping and beach. Great old fashion hotel, room was awesome, just wish a full size fridge was in the kitchen. Will definitely stay again! If planning to stay in Waikiki, buy cheap lawn chairs and beach umbrella at wallmart, then donate when you leave, the price to rent on the beach is outrageous. If you decide to drive around the island take those chairs, great beaches to be found, where you can sit and watch the surf!The

アンバサダーホテルオブワイキキに初めて家族で泊まりました。ビーチ沿いではなく運河沿いなのでオーシャンビューは望めませんが利便性がとてもいいです。ホテルの前からバスも出るし、タクシーもすぐ来てくれます。部屋の設備がミニキッチン、冷蔵庫、アイロン、ドライヤー、化粧品、至れり尽くせりでした。経年感はありますが、十分なシティホテルです。チェックインは３時なので、午前中に着くとフロントに荷物をあずけます。化粧室への鍵もくれるので着替えもできました。給水気があって、すきなだけ水をくめるのもよかったです。コインランドリーもあります。両替機もついてました。家族4人でダブルベッドが２台でした。ベッドメイキングもきれいにしてくれました。A family of four stayed Ambassador Hotel of Waikiki for the first time. It was like staying at a condominium. The mini kitchen with dishes, cutlery, big refrigerator, iron, hair dryer, cosmetics. The front staff were helpful and friendly. Access to major sightseeing spots from the hotel is perfect. The checkin time is 3pm so if you arrive in the morning you need to leave your luggage at the front desk. They give you a card for the restroom if you want to change your cloths. Water server was helpful too. I enjoyed this hotel. I recommend it.

The price you see is not what you pay. You will be hit with a $30 amenity fee. So be wary. Also, no kidding, construction outside starts at 3:30 am. Same time the rooster starts. Don’t expect a good night sleep.This place is a little odd. It’s tired and scarce and kind has that Scarface bathroom scene vibe.

I live here on the island of Oahu and took a few days off from work and decided to have a staycation. What prompted me to choose the ambassador I will never know but I am glad that I did. Service and management is awesome hands down. The room I stayed in was just perfect and relaxing and I will return here again for my next staycation

I read a couple of reviews for Ambassador Hotel after my wife and I booked it, but before we went, and must say I am a quite annoyed by how negative people can be. The hotel may have seen better days, and could probably do with a little renovation, but in terms of value it is hard to beat. Great location, just a few minutes from the main shopping and dining area and to the beach; comfortable rooms; friendly staff; on-sight parking; free wifi; and at a lower rate than the neighboring hotels and resorts. No complaints, we very much enjoyed our stay.

We arrived at this hotel not because it was our 1st choice....Our stay had been cut short at our original hotel because of a booking error and after realizing The Ambassador had THE last 2 rooms available in Waikiki for Dec.27-Dec.30 we reluctantly booked this room at the tune of $824 for the 1st night and $924 per night for the next 2 nights plus $25 per night for amenities. This room normally goes for $151 per night and reminded me very much of a Motel 6....definitely NOT worth almost $1k per night. It would have been nice to know that the transportation service to the airport, which was offered to us at checkout, was only available with 24 hr notice not as soon checkout is complete and that it was $33 per person. More reasons NOT to book with this establishment in the future. I'm writing about this experience so that no one else has to endure these unprofessional inconveniences.I thanked them for letting us store our luggage though after checkout, until we needed to go to the airport. The photo attached is the actual bill (in case the story seems untrue to some).

The rooms are very dated and much in need of renovation. It is probably as it was when it was built decades ago: We had many problems with our bathroom which were never really fixed. They did offer some compensation however.The rooms are spacious and do have a full kitchen so good for families although the open verandahs outside the rooms would be terrifying with young children. It was completely over priced for what it was.

I was very impressed with the service I received by the staff They where courteous, attentive, assertive, thoughtful if my needs. I will return to the Ambassador Hotel The service is Fantastic, my compliments to the staffThank you

I was offered a PH room which is the best room in the hotel, I guess. How’re, all the balcony's doors are not able to be locked. One is missing part. The other two are broken. The hotel maintenance technician is very nice. He said there're is no way to lock it temporarily. Ali’s the shower was broken too. They finally moved me to a different room, a regular one instead. In the future I won't take the hotel's upgrade any more.

My family stayed here for 5 nights. Didn't have a choice to transfer to a different hotel as it's included in the holiday package I prepaid purchased with Jetstar. After a 10 hour flight form Sydney we went straight to the hotel to leave our luggage. When we came to the hotel the reception staff weren't welcoming, no Aloha, no good morning or even a welcome smile.I mentioned my name as a reference but the receptionist in a rude manner said it's too early to check in which we are aware of. So we went back in the afternoon another Filipino receptionist was there, we approached her and said Hi but there was no reaction on her face, no hello, no aloha & no smile at all. We were really stunned because they work in reception and they should be welcoming guest with a smile right? seriously what's wrong with their staff? We were lucky because the manager named Geffrey Aquino was there in reception, he was so friendly, this guy have a great customer service & really knows how to look after a guest. That's all we need, a welcoming face who treat guest with respect.Honestly these Filipino background (ladies) in reception should be provided a proper customer service training in reception. Another disappointment, this hotel is a two star hotel. We couldn't believe how outdated this hotel. The rooms they show in the website is totally different from what we had. The kitchen is too old, bathroom is disgusting. overall it needs a renovation. We felt the money we spent is not worth the stay. We didn't used the kitchen facility and the cutleries. Please feel free to see photos below. This is our third time in Waikiki and this is the first time we've encountered poor customer service & poor hotel condition.Never coming back to this hotel. ever.

The carpet in the aisles is in very bad conditions; from two elevators one no working.Two lamps no work in the room; The bed was tini and matress isn't good. The room need work in a lot areas. All the room look very old.

The low cost had add-ons, the base low price was $65 per night then add the resort fee of $35 of which I was okay with but then, $35 for parking was added unless I wanted to park elsewhere for free.On the room itself, I found that the towels and bedding were great, the mattresses are at the point of needing to be replaced and the room, including walls and floor are in dire need of a redo. The room had a definite odor that I did not like, also the sliding door to the balcony was non-functioning. Over all though, I would say that it was acceptable for the cost.

Hidden fees: they charge $25/ night for an amenity fee (bikes are old and you only get them for two hours and then $5/hr after, pool is tiny but nice view of palm trees, printers don't work, in room safe didn't work, no coffee in the morning, e.t.c).There were holes in the walls in our room. The carpets were stained everywhere in the hotel. The paint was coming off in chunks, giant patches in walls that weren't finished. Doors didn't close and lock completely or didn't work at all. Our balcony was unsafe to stand on and easily accessible by anyone walking near pool or adjoining rooms and the lock on balcony door didn't work so you can be easily robbed. Air conditioning barely worked cooling only a five foot square area. Shower was small and dirty and took forever to heat the water. Refrigerator, stove and kitchen sink were decent and clean though. Included dishes and pans in pantry were also clean. Linens and sheets appeared clean but we found an earring under the pillow (tooth fairy?). Our "city view" meant we could only see other room balconies and the smoker's below us. Our queen bed reservation turned into two twin beds and they wouldn't move us. We're not the type to complain so we just left. After including the added hidden fees from this hotel we moved to a much nicer hotel for the same amount. This place is a dump. Staff here are nice though.

First of all, the room was filthy. As soon as I entered I noticed a gum stuck under the lamp shade, then when I went into the bathroom i noticed the door was so warped that it would not close and to top it off the door hinges were broken as well. The parking on the other hand was good (Very Secure and Convenient) but overall my experience there was horrible.

The hotel was convenient and had a desk to order tours. The room was nice except the kitchen counter needed to be renovated. The rug leading to the room was not clean. The room was always clean except the shower.

Do not stay here. We fell for the cheaper prices and some of the good reviews and were so disappointed when we got there. The hotel was old, outdated, and the rooms were boarder line dirty. We wore our flip flops in the shower and checked out as soon as we got up the following morning. The only bright spot was we only had to stay here one night.

It's a simple hotel. We had a kitchenette which was nice. Everyday they would text to make sure we were ok and if we needed anything. They have three elevators, but they are slower than all get out. The cafe next door is very nice. We were minutes away from bus stops and 10 minutes walking distance to the beach.

We did a two day stop in Waikiki on our way too Kuiai and the Ambassador was recommended by a local friend. It wasn’t fancy but had everything we needed and was walking distance to the beach and all the restaurants and shopping, with bus stops nearby when we wanted to go further. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I left my camera charger in the room and they were lovely about sending it back to Maine for me. I just recommended it to my daughter who is on her way to her first Hawaii trip.

I arrived late in the night but I called and they were ok with it. I had a rental car and was charged 35 bucks which is different than what is on their website. I was set up in the back tower which does not have key card elevator control. I was next to the elevator but the good thing was I did not hear it. The room was in a state of disrepair. It needed work from top to bottom. There is no way this was a 3 star hotel; way too run down. I am a little upset with HOTWIRE saying it was. The staff was nice and helpful. The hotel was also surprisingly clean for its condition.

Booked was made and paid to Agoda online travel agent. The hotel room itself was a disappointment as the view was of rooftops at the back of the hotel rather than a street view that I had booked. I paid £160 for two nights. I did not like the facilities offered here and was also not able to stay for the second night as I had an early morning to catch which I explained to the hotel, but no refund was issued...so they had £60 for nothing. As the agent to whom I paid the money, Agoda should have processed the refund but stated that it was up to the hotel. I will not be using this hotel again.

If all the other hotels in Waikiki hadn't been booked solid we would have checked out as soon as we checked in!The hotel is a dump. To say it is run down is an understatement. As soon as we checked in we noticed that the laminate was peeling on the dresser, there was no coffee maker (there was a kettle but no tea/coffee/etc), no TV, and the room was stinking hot. My grown son went to check out the bathroom and came back with, "Ummm.. the shower floor looks like you'd get foot fungus from it. Maybe we should wear our flip flops when we shower...". The grout in the shower (no bathtub) was filthy, the wall behind the sink was peeling, as was around the moulding on the floors, no counter in the bathroom - just a sink (so nowhere to put your makeup, hair straightener, etc.). The air conditioner barely worked so it was impossible to sleep in the heat (with 30 degree weather outside). The 2nd night when we came back at about 11pm my key card wouldn't work so I went down to the lobby (from the 13th floor). They re-keyed the card so I went back up but it still didn't work, so back down to the lobby. On the 3rd visit to the lobby they sent the maintenance man up with me who brought this wire thing and opened the door with it then came in so that he could replace the key card sensor. Seemed to work after that but got the sense that this happened quite often.It was relatively close to Waikiki strip (10 min walk) so that was good, but the park across the street is pretty sketchy. On day 2 there was an incident right across the street with several police cars and officers. The night before we checked out (to move locations) I inquired at the front desk as to whether I could park my rental car in their hotel parking for ONE HOUR in the morning between when I picked up the rental car and when we checked out and they informed me that they would have to charge me the $40 USD daily parking fee (for parking there for an hour at 7:30am!). We ended up checking out before we got the car just so we could get out of there!On top of the room charges they charge a $25 USD per day (+ tax) RESORT FEE! Ha!There are several bikes available that you can take for 2 hours at a time, and a great little coffee shop/stand right beside the hotel, and those were the best things about our stay there! So glad we left and didn't spend our entire vacation at the Ambassador Hotel.

Not hygenic, splatter on the wall of previous guest on the bathroom walls.Terrible AC, dripping all over the place, filters not clean. Found roaches on my clothes, the secondary and sixth night I was there. As a result I had to cancel and move to the Holiday Inn. This hotel is old, outdated and needs a serious renovation.Mattress is so old, you can feel the springs!!Stay at your own peril!

The room was awful the airconditionair was splashing around and it was smelling bad amd no wlan and wifi it was not nice at all:( the place is alright but the room was really awful!!:( they are a little bit friendly but the room:(

I've been coming here for the last 10 years and they've just started remodeling the units. Would recommend to anyone to check this place out for a stay in Waikiki.Perfect location entering into Waikiki and to the Mall.

review_body: The Ambassador hotel in Waikiki is certainly not The Royal Hawaiian but it certainly is an exceptional Tourist hotel just away from the madness of the beachfront area. It's in a great location to restaurants and just a pleasant walk across the park to the beach. The staff are very good with a friendly personal attitude and the rates are very reasonable.

Pictures speak louder than words, good people bad hotel, while I was there i was asked how was my stay from 1-5 5 being excellent through phone text, my response was Remodel and cleaner rooms would be excellent, the walls are peeling off, the curtains are falling too. After that there was no reply or anything to make it better. Most or if not all the bad reviews are true, the difference is i took pictures Room 313 stayed from 23 to the 31 of July 2019

We stayed 8 nights and if we hadnt been in peak season we would have gone somewhere else.'Partial sea view' means you can barely open sliding door to lanai/balcony as wheels are broken, air con spits dirty water at you and there are no chairs on lanai once you get out there to enjoy view!!! Resort quality? ABSOLUTELY NOT! The kitchen smells like old pee, place is very tired and not cleaned well. Air conditioning is so noisy sleeping is hard. I appreciate it is an older hotel but I have experienced better air con in the backwoods of Samoa!Elevators broke down and we had to walk 16 flights of stairs for 3 days.We complained and they've couldn't even be bothered to email back with a response let alone apologise. Rip offs.

We had booked 1 night stay due to our Air BnB apartment not ready for early check in. The staff were rude. The room was so outdated and smelled of mould throughout. We opened all doors and turned on aircon but made no difference. The furniture in the room was disgusting and not inviting to sit on so we sat at the table. Air conditioner was extremely noisy. Will not be returning.

Shower looked like it had not been cleaned in weeks we were there for four days and they never had parking available Although the room service people are great even though only two or one of the elevators actually work

We usually stay at Hilton or Marriott properties and we knew that coming in. We thought we wouldn’t spend much time in room. The rooms are so outdated and dirty even though the housekeeping staff know service. There is very limited parking so the first night we had to park 7 blocks away and pay $40/night. At NO time did front staff say parking was first come, first serve. So finally got a card to park in hotel parking lot. Still charged for parking the nights we could park there. We wouldn’t recommend to friends or family even if it is low price. I’d say you get what you paid for but in this case you get over charged. Oh and when asked the staff of water ok to drink (since they give you water bottles/bags when you check in) the front desk staff said, “I wouldn’t!)

Just back from 2 weeks in the Ambassador Hotel in Waikiki the Location is fantastic the front desk staff are really lovely and really enjoyed the pool ,they have a laundry room and a gym which are fine the lifts are terrible there are 3 lifts only 2 were working then we were down to only 1 working so when your on a high floor it’s a nightmare waiting on the lift they did fix the 2nd lift after a couple of days .Now what I think is really strange you can only walk down to the 2nd floor then you have to take a lift because the alarms go off God help the people on the second floor that have to wait for a lift .The main problem was the room it was very outdated and not very clean there was Mold every where ,the ceiling in the shower was full of black mold and paint peeling everywhere there was sticky tape holding a bit of wall up ,the air conditioner was dreadful so so noisy and absolutely filthy and the buckets on the balcony collecting the water from it and most of the time wasn’t working properly,The maid took out the rubbish left clean towels and made the beds but in 2 weeks Didnt change the sheets or clean anywhere.Unfortunately we had our package holiday paid for so there was nothing I could do couldn’t afford to just leave and go to another hotel so on the first day I bought lots of cleaning products and air fresheners and gave the apartment a really good cleaning but the air vents and ceilings were just filthy ,another scary thing was one night there was an announcement on the intercom in all the guests rooms we had 2 in our room around 4am that everyone had to come outside the hotel using the stairs because there was a fire alarm or something we knew nothing about it till the next day and believe me I and a very light sleeper and heard no announcement Thank god it was a false alarm . SO at the end of it all I had an amazing holiday cause I stayed away from the hotel as much as I could,I would love to go back to Waikiki but definitely NOT to the Ambassador Hotel I would NOT NEVER EVER recommend this hotel as I said Location brilliant if they only knocked down the hotel and built a new one in its place .Sorry they take your credit card details for damages to the room my son said mum what more damage could we possibly do to the room

The place is tired and ready for upgrades, we got an upgrade with kitchen. A bit noisy location, but very central to everything. Service at the desk is 100% aloha and they have a daily training incl in the hotel price, HI FIT, tried it twice at the beach, very good training, maybe the highlight plus the service at the desk.Hotels in this area are expensive so maybe this hotel is considered a good value.

not a very nice hotel very old and not very clean. lifts very rarely work. paid the extra for an early check in but had to argue with the front desk about this even though we had paid. when we arrived in unit had a kitchen but not one knife fork spoon, no plates cups or kettle or toaster. feel very ripped off with the price and what the hotel actually delivers very disappointing. i would look for somewhere else

Paul the Director of Front Office gave us excellent service. He was super friendly, humble n professional. He helped us pick the room. The room was beautiful with the view, comfortable n spacious with full kitchen set. Very pleased with our stay at this hotel n definitely will come back again.

The staff were wonderful. We were on the eighteenth floor. The view was to die for. The room needs an update. The air - conditioner is noisy. We opted to have the door open for fresh air. Whilst having the door opened then the sirens of a night was a bit much.

Sorry, but long winded about suggesting not to stay here, better quality around Waikiki for similar pricingArrived to find hotel wanting another $186 usd ($279 aud) on top of our booking we made back in April this yearIt was apparently due to some internal service fees that had increased since we bookedWe said that we had no notification since we booked other than 3 emails wanting us to upgrade to "room with partial ocean views" for another $9.00 usd ($13.50 aud) per night (more on ocean views later), but nothing about any additional service charges, because we had booked a paid after further calm and rational discussions the hotel receptionist agreed to waiver the feeWe had arrived before the check in time however our room was ready and we could go and settle inWow!!! - we went to our room to find it dirty (hairs on kitchenette bench, toilet not clean and ed even the door handles felt gritty, dirty. The microwave had only one base foot on it so it wobbled and the turntable was on an angle)The room decor is well worn, chips out of benches, patches on walls, TV cabinet and storage draws stick and chips taken out of table tops, well worn decor. Just a very dirty and un-welcoming room.So after 15 minutes of contemplating on just what to do we rang reception to at least advise them upon the faulty microwave. After another 5 minutes we had a lady come and see what was wrong, she then called up the maintenance man, whilst waiting for the maintenance man we ask the lady if this is the common standard of the rooms here at the Ambassador? She was evasive in her answer so did not pursue this with her. Then the maintenance man arrived to our room and once shown the problem with the microwave, turned it on its side and literally broke the remain foot off the bottom of the microwave. This amazed us, as he did not unscrew this with a screw driver, he physically tore it off. And thought it would be ok now, we think the lady that called him was just as amazedSo now at this point we decided to go down to reception and discuss the microwave issue and the very poor condition/dirtyness of the room furtherWe started by asking is the room provided the general standard for the hotel, to our surprise the answer was "yes" with an explanation that the rooms have had NO upgrade for some years WOWAt the end of the conversation we where offered to have a loom at another 2 rooms that might better suit us.A little reluctant we said ok, first one was not to bad, cleaner, microwave, it had all 4 feet on the base of it , but the oven totally scratched, old and not comforting to useThe second room was clean, best of the 3, still old decor that needs updating sooner than laterAs we had been travelling for over 16 hours now we succumbed to this roomOne good thin, bed is comfortable and good hot running waterSummary - Dont bother to take them up on the partial ocean views EXTRA $ offer, as they are way to far from the beach, to see partial you will be on level 7 up to level 12 floor, and STILL only a partial view through build df ings and trees if you lean over the balcony, as the balconies are on the east and west side of the property and the beach is south- Don't expect anything flash, take it up with them if you are not happy with what your getting (better, cleaner premises with similar pricing across the road at the holiday inn), all to late for us, we have just put up with what we have got, but never again at the Ambassador Waikiki - if you do choose here, give yourself 5 minutes extra time to leave the premises as the lifts are painfully slow, strange with 3 lifts, but true, give yourself time, and if the doors open and it appears full squeeze in as it will take about 6 minutes before anotherlift will arriveWas thinking of a positive and give 2 star rating but just could not

My friend and I had booked this place as we tried lots of places and it was peak season and we were looking for somewhere to cook as well. It was clean, but we were put on 18th floor, which means you walk outside t get to and the air conditioning meant no sleep. We complained but they could not repair. The place is very run down all the way through with cheap linen. It does serve a purpose but not for us. In fairness when I rang manager and complained and said I wanted to leave after one night he was very understanding and came and helped us get out. He refunded our other nights we did not stay. Honestly if you really want cheap and to cook it would work but not for us

This trip started as a bad situation. The customer service was far beyond what was expected. They have been a big part in making the situation better. They have made casual conversation on almost a daily basis. They truly treat you like family.

My friend booked my room when I checked in showed them my booking number with Expedia.com it did not show on their check in listing, they just told me I don't have any reservation, I had to call expedia.com they called the hotel and spoke to them the shift manager on duty was there handling my reservation and he was not friendly at all no smile no nothing after he took my FSM Passport to verify. He is the one who spoke with Expedia.com and still he asked me to provide emails and confirmation after Expedia spoke with him very not friendly Manager, the same. Couple nights after checking in I have a lot of friends and family living in Honolulu, and I ha a lot of phone calls it so happen I was out one night and try to call my roommate the same manager according to him he is the manager, answered the phone I request to transfer my call to my room and he said you had like 4 phone calls within 30 minutes so I went back to the hotel, and confronted him and ask if there is a limit to phone calls to my room and he said you had more than 3 calls within 30 minutes so what I am paying for the room and I expect the best service. Very disappointed with the service especially a manager.

I am not a hard person, but this is the worst hotel I have ever been too. Thank GOD I booked for ONE night only. Rooms are not like in the pictures. I repeat, Rooms ARE NOT LIKE IN THE PICTURES. The walls are dirty, the balcony door was broken and we could hear the wind all night long. The bathroom was so dirty that we didn’t take any shower. The beds were 0 confortable and hard as a rock. You could sleep on the floor and it’s the exact same thing. The AC was making so much noise, we had to shout in order to hear each other. The fans in the walls are full of dust (you’ll want to puke) and they make a constant noise all night long. Every room's door was slamming and it scared us every time it was happening. They have 3 OLD elevators and 2 of them did not work and the whole hotel was relying on 1 elevator (which means it was always full of people and literally no oxygen to breath inside the elevator). The whole hotel smells old.. same with the room. At least the staff is nice but I’m sure it’s only because they feel bad for everyone booking there. Anyways, I would never recommend this hotel. Pay an extra 20$ and get yourself something better. If you go there, you’ll hate your whole trip to Hawaii.

The pictures make this to look a lot better than in real life! Rooms were clean & tidy & kitchenette was useful. Needs a revamp, bathroom very tight, no vanity or shelves. Shower not very nice for a hotel. Aircon did work which was great. Elevators very slow so have extra time if you need to wait for these! Water fill station (fill your own bottles) near reception. Wifi seems to be fine. Daily charge added on to price per room so take this into account. We would stay somewhere different next time

I am absolutely shocked at the quality of room and service. If you want a good nights sleep - do not book here. Air conditioner so loud that we are not even going to be able to use it during the night. The bed and pillows are that worn that I can’t even get comfortable. Shower is very old and you do not feel nice using it. I wish I could upload a video of the sound coming from the air conditioner- terrible.

Stayed here and the rooms were large, lounge, dining, kitchen and balconies, but the bathroom was small and basic with only a shower. Close to everything and the staff were great. Everything you need without the expensive price!

It’s a great location, and you can pay to add in parking. Downside is that the hotel has changed owners in recent years and there has been a VERY significant lack of investment in the property. Only 2 of the 3 lifts work and those 2 lifts cannot provide the appropriate service for the guest occupancy. You are always waiting for a lift. I asked if there was a plan to upgrade and they said soon although had no idea when that was. The rooms are clean although they are very outdated. The air con is noisy.The balconies could be made more useful by adding a chair or a table ...But, I suppose it’s about price point and it has a super location and has a Coffee bean tear leaf outside the reception and Eggs n Things is 5 minute walk away.

Booked this hotel our last leg of the trip. It was priced great clean, and had friendly hotel Staff. The manager Ariel was very informative and had a great sense of humor. The free two hour bike rental was a plus.

Two words- Third World. In fact my son's student flat is better equipped, cleaner and more up to date than this place. We booked The Ambassador as it supposedly had fully equipped kitchens- I wanted to be able to prepare the bulk of our meals as my daughter has some health issues. Lets just say, two butter knives, a single pot and fry pan, do not a kitchen make. And it was filthy and dated from around the 70's. The room, though spacious, was dingy, smelly and sparse. The "balcony" was a bleak, beige concrete rectangle with no furniture - just a leaking air con unit. I can only assume there is no furniture provided to prevent people from jumping off to end it all - it is so depressing there. The bathroom had peeling paint on the ceiling, the tiles were on the floor of the shower were disgusting and the sealant was mouldy. The hot water took about 5 minutes to come through, and then only once the handle was turned as far to the left as possible. Right from the start, the check in staff were rude unhelpful and downright passive/aggressive. The poor maintenance staff were kept busy trying to fix things (including the lifts, which were either not working or frighteningly slow and unstable). The final straw was after three days, I went to the laundry to discover that only ONE washing machine was working for the entire hotel, and the outside shower at the pool (which was concerningly murky) was also out of order. I went down and complained, and the staff member straight away offered my money back. She did not even try to offer any solutions. That says it all, as far as I am concerned. Even though it was after 3pm and I had already paid for the room that night, I decided to cut my losses and walk 5 meters across the road to the delightful hotel next door, where we throughly enjoyed the rest of our holiday. Photos are seriously photoshopped- this place is a dump and should be shut down.

Pack backpacking gear and forget any “superficial or welcoming” experiences. This is the biggest lie compared to the online pictures. The deadbolt on the door doesn’t work and the bathroom door has no latch. This hotel charges extra for everything. It provides the worst customer service experience besides Kerri at the front desk. Don’t be fooled by the pictures of the “patio seating” because there are no chairs on the balcony that couldn’t fit a kitchen chair. The paint is peeing off of the cabinets and there is an odd smell of wet carpet. It feels like we are staying in a hostel for more per night than an Outrigger hotel. They changed our reservation days without any consent and sent an email the “day of our new check in” without any other form of notice. The room advertised double beds (as available) but wasn’t able to accommodate them, so we ended up with a full and a twin. When asking for a rollaway so family members don’t have to sweat on each other under the 1980s AC unit, we were asked to pay $30 per person and $30!rollaway bed. After speaking to four other staff members, only Kerri at the front desk was kind, accommodating and understanding. I would recommend staying here with an open mind and open eyes.

When we entered our room at the Ambassador we were shocked at what poor condition the room was in. The first thing we noticed was the old stained vinyl couch. Carpet lifting. Graffiti on the walls that still showed up after a failed attempt to remove. Splits in the timber etc etc etc The photo shown had 2 chairs on the balcony. This is false. Our room reminded me of the apartment building from the movie 9 Mile and was more worthy of public housing. We definitely did not feel safe here. It was that bad I immediately got on the telephone and booked alternate accommodation. We couldn't get out of there fast enough. It is also a long walk to the beach and well away from the main shopping area. When we booked out I was informed that they plan of carrying out a $20 Million renovation. This obviously tells you that the building needs it.I have attached photos

The Hotel is certainly showing it’s age but for the price I was happy with it. The staff there were friendly and helpful. The room was certainly large enough. The bed was comfortable and a decent size Flat Screen tv. The shower was fine and the Air conditioner worked fine but being old it was noisy not that it bothered us. The room had full size fridge, Microwave and Oven. The location of the hotel to Waikiki Beach and Al Mona Mall was easy close walking distance approx 1km away.

The pictures on the website are nothing like you get there. the Hotel is old and beat upthe living room has no couch, two twins bed, there is only one Tv. in the living room,the kitchen is poorly theres no soap no scrub. the drapes are rip. this looks like a nightlyMotel. customer service is not good. they charge for everything. my first time in hawaii and it was the worst Hotel. i feel bad for my Kids. I wanted them to make them feel good.

Excellent views and room size just no tea or coffee facilities in the room. Apart from that highly recommend. Easy walking distance to all ammenities easy walk to the beach and shopping malls close to all buses

So there are some good aspects of the Ambassador but in my opinion, there are more bad.PROSGood locationfriendly acommodating staffcheap for HonoluluWhalers Cove and Coffee Bean Coffee bar in same entrance courtyardNice pool (although they allow smoking in the smoking area)Full size refrigeratorCoin Laundry facility CONSAir conditioning unit right above beds is noisy but you have to run it or it gets too hot. Would be a problem for a light sleeperWhen something gets detached or broken, they don't spackle and repaint. There were 2 screws just sticking out of the wall where something wall mounted was removed.Particle board cabinets are dinged and batteredBathroom tile looks gross and heavily stained. I wore flip flops when I showeredHallway carpets heavily stained in placesWalls in bathroom need a through wiping downWhen I got in the shower there were two dark hairs stuck to the wall. Cleaning has to be pretty relaxed.And the worst is that they have a bug problem. I saw a cockroach in my room which I captured in a plastic shopping bag and threw off the balcony. I thought "well, it's a tropical location, I just won't think about it too much." Then the next night there were these small brown flying bugs. They filled the bathroom (at least 40 of them), shed their wings and then started walking around. It was 11:30 at night when I got back so I killed them and went to sleep. Then the next night, they reappeared and this time I went downstairs at 9 pm and asked for the room change. The staff was super nice about the room change but this killed it for me. I won't be back and cannot recommend this place. In this case you get what you pay for.

The staff at the Ambassador did an INCREDIBLE job of making us feel welcome, holding our luggage early before checkout, and EVEN gave us a surprise upgrade that really made our experience worthwhile and would make us recommend the Ambassador to any future travelers.

When we arrived they advised us that amenities as well as parking was not included. We ended up spending 20.00 for free WiFi. We were also charged 25.00 per day for the parking. We questioned the parking since we were being charged for amenities and were told it would be included. We were charged at the end of our stay for both. This hotel is in a convenient location but there are NO frills here. We had a coffee pot but no coffee. We did get a small cup of coffee at the coffee bean right out side the hotel lobby. If you are looking for basic this is your place. We were looking forward to sitting out the balcony and watching the water but what we got was no chairs and the hum of the wall AC unit. Not what we expected. Pictures are misleading.

Location is good as close to restaurants and shops as well as transportation. Otherwise the charged me extra on my stay even though checking in I told I didn’t owe anything and when complaining they just kept back tracking and so was stuck forkin out another $245 AUD. Wifi was crap as it kept dropping out or would take a while to reconnect. The breakfast you pay extra for isn’t worth the much new as it consists of bacon, eggs, rice with coffee or juice. Rooms need updating as chairs had holes in some, the shower floor was uneven and toilet was quite low. The lift took forever and we stayed on the 3rd floor and stairs were only for emergency. Housekeeping did not replace toilet paper so we had to constantly ask for more. I suggest staying somewhere else. Would never stay here again.

I love this hotel. The view from the balcony is amazing, in my opinion, and I love the courtyard in front of the hotel where you can get coffee and drink it at the cafe tables. It reminds me of Italy, especially with the lovely park across the street. There is also a grocery store here that is open until midnight and is perfect for a last-minute pizza. The room I stayed in had a great kitchen area, with utensils and a stove-top oven. Housekeeping will take care of your dishes, too. The Ambassador also has a two-hour free bike rental available, so my husband and I rode them one morning to the beach at Fort Derussy. We had time to walk down the pier there and then bike through Waikiki to Kaimana beach and the War Memorial Natatorium, and swim. We also had time to catch our breath at the picnic tables and finish our coffees. We stopped by the Mahatma Gandhi statue and finished our trip back to the hotel by biking on the Ala Wai Canal (I did, my husband chose to remain on the road). The bikes also come with baskets as well as their own locks so you can secure your bike whenever you stop. Check your bike before you head out, as you don't want to be unprepared. It had been so long since I had ridden a bike that we did a few practice laps in the parking lot before we rode out. Returning the bikes was easy and hassle-free. The staff here are so lovely and easy to work with. There is a metal door to the lobby in front of the bike racks that is open for most of the day. Its also near the outside smoking area.The pool is on the third floor and is lovely. You can get pool towels from the housekeeping office. There is also a smoking area near the pool. I have a thing for hotel TV and their cable setup is pretty good. I've watched TV at a hotel before (on the mainland, which refers to the mainland U.S.) and was like, "what the hell am I watching?" as it was a very disassociated program and in short, trippy. I have no complaints about the wi-fi. The shower amenities are nice, the bathroom spacious, and the closet space is huge. The room itself was decent, clean, and well-lit, and the beds were very comfortable. There were plenty of pillows, too. We stayed here for a week and definitely plan on coming back in the future.

The Ritz-Carlton it isn't, so leave that at the door. We came to Oahu during our sons spring break and on a budget. When we saw the price for the Ambassador Waikiki, we jumped on it.The hotel is situated a few blocks from the ocean and relatively close to shopping and all the attractions. Transportation is really easy since the bus stop is right in front of the hotel. Upon arrival, the staff was very nice and helpful. We checked into our room and although average, it needed a facelift. The room was also very dated and small. The room would have probably been okay if it were myself and my husband but since we're traveling with two grown teenage kids, it would have worked for us.I went downstairs and express my needs to the front desk. They are able to move us into a suite which was much better, but also very dated. All in all, this hotel gave us a place to hang your coat, a decent night sleep, and a small kitchen to boot.If you're on a budget, and need a place to rest and don't care about all the extras, this place is for you. Sure it doesn't have a massage room or 15 swimming pools, but the staff is friendly and really tries to make your stay great. Will definitely be back next year.

Horrible customer service and beware of their expensive parking lot.First of all we booked this hotel via travelocity with king size bed and free breakfast. However, when we get inside the room we found out that they gave us two queen beds, so we went and ask how come we dont have the king size bed that we booked. The receptionist said that we have to pay extra since, we were tired we just let it go. Moreover, the heavy set receptionist guy was unfriendly and unwilling to answer my questions. P.S $25 parking fee a dayThe room was very unpleasant, I will not recommend this place to stay for vacation or celebration. This place more like for halloween set-up or if you want to ruin your vacation this place is for you.

This place is a dump, if you happen to think it's a good idea to spend extra money to get a kitchen in your room I would highly recommend against it, there was somehow both rust and mould on the fridge, the chipboard cupboards are more chip than board due to their age and it felt like the stains were all that was holding them together, large paint chips missing on every wall in the room even though somehow the walls never seem to be cleaned (attached is a photo of what could be a poo smear on the wall), the carpet was filthy and tattered, some of the light fittings just flat out did not work, the ceiling in the bathroom is no higher than 7 feet tall and the hand rail seems to have been held together by what appeared to be a band-aid, the air conditioner was not only loud but ineffective although if you're into noise you'll also enjoy the fact that the sliding doors don't seem to close all the way so you can sleep the night away listening to the soothing sounds of every possible noise from the outside world and also enjoy the creepy whistling sound provided by that same door whenever a light breeze is blowing. The best and most overwhelming part of the room has to be the smell that punches you in the nostrils as you enter the room and doesn't seem to clear even with the door all the way open.

+Very central, you can walk everywhere in a short time (10 min to waikiki beach). The room is spacious. Coin laundry available, printer available, free wifi (great speeds).-You have to pay a 20$ per day for amenities, a thing that is just stupid. They charge you money for things that should be included in the price. Its a way to decrease the room rate but when you arrive have no option but pay that absurd fee.

Old, run down. Would pay more for something nicee and cleaner. AC unit had the electrical outlet burnt black. The shower was kinda gross, too. I suggest spending a little more to be in something that doesn't feel so dirty.

Location of the hotel is prime. It has an abc store just below it. We three friends stayed for 1week in the 3bed room appartement. It was a really spacious appartement. The kitchen facilities were superb. We cooked our meals without facing any problems. The balcony was huge and the best place to spend time. The bathroom was also big enough. They had all required amenities. The closets had ample space as well. The beds were also quite comfortable. Communication was also good. I would definitely recommend it.

i found bedbugs the 6th or 7th day i stayed there. i was told that i wasn't going to get charged for my stay, it was already paid before i went there. and so far they've only "refunded" the deposit.i've sent some emails and texted them on facebook and asked about it. but they never replied. they relocated to me to another hotel, and I'm thankful for that.but i think it's unacceptable, that they just ignoring my messages after this incident.

When booking this hotel, the listing displayed many accommodation features such as a pool and free wifi.Unfortunately, when you get to the hotel you have to pay $20 extra each day for these “amenities”. Such a joke.How can they advertise free wifi and then charge for it? How can they advertise the hotel has a pool and then expect you to pay for it?Take this into consideration when booking as based on this added cost we could have afforded a much nicer hotel with the total money we spent here.Oh also, this hotel has photos of balconies with chairs. Our group had 4 different rooms with balconies and none of them had chairs - you couldn’t even enjoy the view and balcony unless you wanted to sit on the dirty concrete. Not ideal.

When we checked in at 11pm that Monday evening, it was Argie at the front desk. We mentioned that we were past guests, and could he check to see if we could be on a higher floor as in the past. He diligently cross-check the available rooms, but because of our unusual length of stay, there was none then without a move in between. He said to check again in one or two days. With that, we thought what we got will have to do. Next evening, after a full day out, we got back about 9:30pm and we thought it wouldn't hurt to check if there's a room change. Well, Tres M was at the desk, and he apparently had all the paperwork for us to switch rooms. Argie had pursued the request during his night shift for us. Another day, Jeff A was at the desk, who we remembered helping us in the past. These gentlemen and the other ladies at the front counter are all very friendly, cheerful and helpful. When we asked for a coffee machine with no immediate hurry, it was delivered within a few minutes after we got inside our door. The hotel's location is great for us, easy to walk to many areas. Bus stops are outside the lobby door or a block or two away for all directions.The room is clean and our housekeeper, Helen does a fine job. The hotel rate for this season (ours has kitchenette) is good. We would gladly return again for our stay in Honolulu.

I booked a room at the Ambassador Hotel Waikiki for three days and 2 nights. The deal was great. The amount I spent for 2 nights, some hotels charged the same amount per day. The hotel was clean, we were given reusable water bottles, the room was just like my Groupon voucher stated. There was an outdoor pool, gym and laundry room on premises. Our room had three twin size beds, with a microwave and refrigerator. Some rooms offered a full kitchen. We were on the third floor and had a balcony that had a beautiful view of the sunrise each morning. I’m sure the views were better on the higher levels. The hotel was on the Waikiki strip, close to restaurants, shopping stores, beach and places to go sightseeing. In the morning I went downstairs to Whalers General Store for coffee and breakfast.

Watch out when you stay at this hotel. I stayed at this hotel on January 12th-13th.They charged me twice with different cards because one of my card 'declined' according to the front desk clerk. My bank account then showed pending so we used different card instead since we need somewhere to stay for a night. When i checked my bank account after i came back, both of our cards been cgarged so i called the hotel and all they keep saying is that only thing they charged is from one of our cards. EVEN THOUGH i have my card statement and my fiance's card statement showing that its been processed for the payment. I called them twice alrdy and they are still not giving me an answer to this issue.

Based from $ rate per day we paid, the accommodations, the state of sanitation and housekeeping of the property, its locations and or quality of service - the front desk and customer service, the housekeepers, as well its ease and accessibility of parking- all met our expectations. We would like to thank all the staff- from front desk, the hardworking and nicest housekeeping and maintenance team for doing and providing an ALOHA services to all their guest.Thank you all Ambassador team!Mel from San Jose California

Okay so first, the room was very very dirty. The floor was wet on the side of the bed under the moldy A/C, the shower was broken but those problems me and my friend didn’t talk about it to the manager because the manager was very impolite herself. When I checked in, for some reasons I’ve had problems with my credit card because I am from Canada and even tho I was gonna pay the room cash, they needed a credit card for security. But the main manager, Keala, thought I was willing to steal the room and not pay (because I was speaking french with my bank) she was very impolite and disrespectful maybe because she was racist or judging but that was very innaproproate. Then when I finally solved the problem with my bank, she didn’t appologise for how disrespectful she had been and handed me the key without saying anything like “thank you have a nice stay” not even an appology. So I am going to report her and this place is nasty.

Recently back from hawaii .family holiday. we were told that the Ambassador is a good hotel when we booked.I got the shock of my life when we arrived. i couldn't believe that a place like this still exists. its not suitable for human's. sorry but the dog's kettle is a lot better.The website photos need to be updated. i think they were taken when this place was build.The furniture in the rooms all broken and old . i was too scared to take our clothes out of our bags and use the draws, The smell in the room makes you vomit. not to mention the air conditioner that is so loud and leeks water everywhere. it was impossible to sleep while the air conditioner was on.Blinds have wholes all over them.Move on to the kitchen. the stove was at least 60 years old. rust all over the stove , fridge and microwave,the kitchen cupboards smelly and all doors don't close. coffee kettle smells like urine.all the doors have chipping all over them. The bathroom is another story. the closet where you suppose to put your clothes in is in the bathroom. The shower is so old i was really scared to take a shower. not to mention that a husband and wife were put in a room with three single beds in it really. The shower head is like 100 years old. so heavy.This is very unsafe place,it should not be allowed to advertise for a holiday in hawaii of all places.It simply ruined our holiday.Please do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.Not to mention that when i complained to staff at front desk they were so unhelpful and rude. i even wrote an e mail to the head manager and never got a replyThis is false advertising to show people something on the hotel's website and to see something else when you arrive.I honestly think the hotel should offer money back because its not worth what we paid for,

I stayed at this hotel during Christmas in Hawaii with some of my class mates. We needed a vacation getaway after finishing up a new semester. The night manager Ricky was very friendly! This was our first time in Hawaii, and we asked where he would recommend to eat, and visit. Ricky immediately recommended some popular areas for tourists and other areas where not many tourist go! He was very knowledgeable of the island! I enjoyed the hikes, restaurants and attractions he recommended my classmates and I! The room was okay, it is kinda old but the for price you pay it is really worth it. We weren't in the rooms all day. We would leave early and come back at night. I noticed our shower drain was draining very slowly, we called the front desk and Ricky answered, he apologized about the problem and sent up Manny to repair. Very friendly people. I would stay at this hotel again. Mahalo~

While the room itself could do with some upgrades, we couldn’t fault the staff at all. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. It is in a good central location. There is a water fill station within the hotel, and they even gave us free soft water bottles at check in (although we already had our own with us). Our room was spacious, and well set up although dated and could do with some updating (painting, especially to the bathroom), it was perfect for what we needed (a central base to return to rest after a day full of exploring). We would stay here again without hesitating as the staff ensured we had an enjoyable stay.

Not only where the pictures on the website Not up to date off the full hotel, we were promised two queen size beds and a full kitchen when booked and arrived to be told they only have two double beds. And empty cupboards. As soon as we walked into the room we were hit with a disgusting musk smell, the kitchenette only had two bowls and a plate and you can’t place anything in the cupboards because the smell is so musky it ruins your food. The walls are peeling and things are corroded with rust. The ceiling in our bathroom was drooping and began to drop black chunks of what I’m assuming is mold all over the floor. The shower heads have no pressure or water coming out because they are so covered with hard water. The dressers and broken and falling apart. The cleaning staff woke my entire family up 5 times at 8 am. Even though we had a do not disturb sign on. The internet is terrible. And we had to phone in for it to be reset about 3 times, which cost me money out of my own pocket as I had to be on the phone for over 25 min to get it sorted out. I feel swindled out of my vacation and I don’t feel like this hotel is worth the hassle and the money my family spent

This pocket friendly hotel situated in the most happening locality of Honolulu, Waikiki, is just around seven-minute-walk from the beach. You may have a bath towel from the hotel for free which you return when back from the beach. Does not have a restaurent in the hotel but there are plenty within short distance. Bus stop is just outside the main door. Friendly and efficient staff. It has a swimming pool, a jim, loundary facility and a kitchen in the room.

This my fourth stay here this year and each time was good. It is close to Waikiki beach about three blocks. I go to website and get best deals here. It is moderate price with most hotels charging close 2.5 to 3 times what you pay to sleep here. No restaurant on site but couple of blocks and you are in restaurant heaven and lots of shopping. Jeff, the manager at front desk, always takes care of any questions you have. I have photos of some stays and view.

The main plus is that you can get up and have the breakfast you want in your own room, pronto, rather than trudge from one breakfast place to another to be asked to wait 30+ minutes for a table ....(The supermarket by the bus stop downstairs sells everything.) Food tastes also better without tip pumping remarks like 'how may I serve you, my lady ...) The staff were super helpful, the beds comfortable and the location ideal. We should treasure this place before it gets knocked down and replaced by some impersonal monstrosity without personal funk.

First off this motel is a complete scam. They charge you the amenity fee as soon as you arrive which they do not tell you about. This fee is a total scam as well, we should not be paying a fee for this dirty resort. Im not even sure what it goes toward, the wifi barley works (not even in all areas) the hotel is very run down. rooms smell of mold, old kitchens, loud air conditioning. We took out the bikes that they offer for "free". They did not tell us that after 2 hours they begin to charge. We took out the bikes for a bit but didnt see the rush in returning the keys, so we gave them back later. The next day, without even telling me a thing, this fraudulent hotel charges my card 200$. If i didnt check my card statements I would have never known. I feel like as a professional business they should notify you of any charges. But anyways when I tried to get some of my money back and explained to the staff we were never told that bikes cost money, they just said you should have read the fine print on the form that they make you sign when u get the bikes. I understand that but i definitely think they should notify you. so many things wrong with this business they honestly need a renovation and they can afford it since they scam their guests. when we got our room cleaned, they didnt provide new towels, they just folded up the dirty ones. Also the overnight male manager is so rude and unhelpful. If you have any problems I suggest you wait and talk to the day staff. The maintenance staff are so sweet and kind tho. I feel bad that they have to work under these horrific conditions. This is more of a motel setting rather than a hotel. It looks nothing like the photos, it is way more run down.

Stayed here good and very well. Hotel is good and luxury including ambiences at Ambassador. Everything and overall are excellent. Food for Indian people is okay. Service is good. Staff is helpful especially Fon

Staff was very nice and knowledgeable about good places to visit and transportation. My room had a strange order and my shower drain had no cover just a hole in the floor. I guess the website pictures are of a room I was not offered.

Well the worst bed in all our travels in 45 years and 9 months as an older couple we voted that the accommodation for the cost was not what it prided it self on ,old and tired We just love coming coming back to a comfortable bed after a day outdoors

The hotel is run down, which is okay - what is not okay is the effort put into maintaining this place, the photos are certainly photo shopped. layered paint over mould, buckets to hold dripping water from the air conditioning, dripping taps, soiled pillows. Expect to pay $20 per day for ‘extra amenities’ including Internet, access to the swimming pool and laundry which should be included. I’ll give credit to the cleaners who do a good job with what they have. Location is good, nice cafe nearby. If you want ‘budget’ you got it.

The Ambassador hotel came though for us when our original accommodations fell through. The building and rooms may be dated, but it does have charm and the rooms are clean. Maid service is prompt and very friendly, it's clear they take pride in their work. The location is one of the most convenient in Waikiki. This is a budget accommodation, and certainly not a five star resort, however it gets five stars in this review for how they've carved their much needed niche in clean, convenient, friendly budget accommodations in the heart of Waikiki.

When checking in Kathy was rude. It’s clear she hates her job or just tourists in general.. not sure which one, maybe both. She wasn’t helpful and was very dismissive. She even walked away at one point when I walked up to the counter - I suppose she didn’t want to help me so she acted like she was busy by going to the back and coming out once someone else had assisted me. The location was fairly decent and that’s the only positive thing I’ll say about this hotel. The photos are not at all what it looks like these days. Definitely old and run down, looks more like a motel. I agreed with the person who said don’t ruin your stay in Hawaii by staying here, but if you do avoid Kathy. She’ll make matters much worse and start you off on the ring foot for the people there!

Don't ruin your vacation to Hawaii by staying here. There are so many things wrong with this place, from the noisy, ancient barely working air conditioners units, to the peeling paint and plaster to the falling apart curtains to the bait and switch tactics. Ignore any photos provided by the hotel. They must be 20 years old. No patio furniture. No refillable "eco" bottles as promised. A $20 resort fee to cover things that are standard at all others hotels. No coffee makers in the kitchen. Expect to hear very loud street noise all night long.

I booked the three bed city view room but the front desk ended up giving us one king, one single. Front desk people were very rude and unaccommodating to us when I asked for the room we booked. Front desk was no help and seemed like they absolutely hated their job. I tried to get a parking pass for a friend since we were all going out that night but the front desk tried to charge me additional for the room since it was only a double occupancy- He didn't stay with us, nor had any plans to.Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere!

Was told wet wouldn't have Abby extra fees after what we paid online. But was forced to pay amenties' fee for stuff we never used (wifi, bicycle, gym etc.). Rip off, will never stay again. Wouldn't even let us use the bicycles after we checked out even though we paid for amenity and got none.

We are returning visitors to Hawaii and stay at the Ambassador Hotel. We find this facility to be safe, clean and budget minded. One of the Check-In Personnel, Emelyn, greet us with a welcoming smile and warm pleasantries as an introduction to the Aloha Spirit. This Hotel is ideal for us as it's a pivot point to indulge into the Island Magic. If you are here to visit your Hotel; you might want to consider something else.

Thank goodness we were only staying for one night. The place is very old and in need of a total renovation. It was nothing like the pictures indicated on the internet. The air conditioner was extremely noisy and we were not sure it was actually working anyway. We were supposed to get 3 single beds but were given a single and a king single. The light in the bedroom did not work and it felt so dirty we did not want to use anything.

The air conditioner wall unit was dripping into small trashcan on the outside porch which overflowed onto porch in a short period of time. Bathroom was very depressing with a blinking ceiling light. Checked out after one night. The front door stuck hard and looked like someone had chipped away at it along the edges of the wall with a knife or something.

Everything at the hotel was great for me and my mom, but I wanted to give a special shout to Keala. My mom missed her flight home, and we were trying, unsuccessfully, to book her onto the shuttle I had a reservation for early the next morning. We tried calling, but no luck - it was too late. We decided to check if the desk had any advice. Keala immediately took charge and found a way to contact the company despite the late hour (not sure if we missed the number or if she just happened to know it) and, after a few minutes, everything was sorted out perfectly. It was a big relief, especially after a day filled with delays and missed flights. Thank you, Keala!

Stayed for just 2 nights - thank goodness - couldn't have handled more! Friendly staff which is the only saving grace for this hotel. Unfortunately the staff alone don't make the stay a success. Our room was a huge disappointment. No balcony furniture at all on balcony that was constantly wet from leaking air conditioner on balcony above. Holes in the curtains. Balcony door that didn't open properly. Housekeeping came up and rather than fix it, they showed us how to press in a certain spot to make it slide..... not sure about this in an emergency! Bathroom was frightening. No drain cover in ancient shower, water didn't drain out - you had to turn the shower off and let it drain a bit, then continue your shower in order for it not to overflow. Didn't want to use shower in bare feet. Safe in bathroom/closet didn't appear to be attached to anything - just pick it up and go. Definitely don't recommend this hotel.

Quite depressing rooms, old decor, dirty bathrooms...not much to say except it’s cheap and in a good location. They also sting you for a $20 resort fee to pay for WIfi but you have no choice to not pay it.

I was with my family, and the hotel itself was pretty with a view. It was clean and many people said bad reviews but honestly it was false. This is a good hotel to stay for a couple of days. The only issue was housecleaning would come but charge and the shower head was broken. If you don't want to be charged, put down Do Not Disturb.

This hotel has a really nice aroma and the rooms were very tidy. The front desk staff were very professional and friendly. Special thanks to Mhila (hopefully I did not mess her name up to bad) She went out of her way to provide exceptional housekeeping services. We had one minor issue while we were there, our bath tub was clogged. Mhila ensured someone came expeditiously to fix our issue. Later in the afternoon,she returned to verify that our issue had been resolved. She made our stay so much more comfortable and enjoyable. Overall, I am very pleased with her and my experience at this hotel.

I would like to say thank you to Helen from housekeeping for keeping our room tidy all the time, she does her job really well compared to others I would say only because I can compare it everyday. She deserves to be rewarded for being a hardworking employee. Emelyn from the front desk was great and very well accommodating to our family, she let us do an early check in just to please my 2 year old from an early flight. She’s very much helpful I love my stay in this hotel. The staff and customer service were great, even if the room is kinda out dated but it’s perfect for a family with great views of the sea and the city!

The bathroom wasn't very clean and the aircon was pretty bad, it was loud and didn't really do anything. Its enough if you aren't looking at spending alot of time in the room. Staff were friendly always. Place just needs some paint otherwise allgood. We probably won't stay again when returning to hawaii

Hotel pictures look nothing like what the hotel actually looks like. Breakfast is shocking. You get vouchers to the cafe downstairs. All you get is rice, scrambled eggs and 3 small rashes of bacon, tea/coffee/Orange juice or water to drink. The room air conditioning is so load and you can hear the draft thru the entire room. Internet keeps dropping all the time. Couldn't connect our laptops the entire 10 nights we were there. Only one phone and device could be connected at the same time. Reported the internet issue and it was never fixed. Traffic outside was so noisy you could here it on the 18th floor. Lifts are slow and take forever to use them. The staff was polite and nice and that's the only positive from this hotel. Do yourself a favour, book elsewhere. Hotel needs major improvement for the price you pay. We paid 3 thousand dollars for a horrible experience. Worse hotel we've stayed in and we have stayed in a lot of hotel. Definitely NEVER staying there again

I wasn’t sure if it’s comfortable or not but it was affordable price and I choose. My room was at 19.floor.Amazing view. Rooms are large very clean. they have patio with table&chair. Refrigerator microwave tv and many channels. I enjoyed very much.

I had to get a last minute hotel and this place came through. I had no idea that during the summer months every friday Honolulu has fireworks on the beach. We were given a beach side room with fireworks directly in full view. Thanks again Ambassador.

I honestly don’t know how this hotel has managed to even get 3 stars. Myself and a friend booked this hotel the same day we planned to stay, and it was our first hotel experience in Hawaii. The first thing we were told by hotel staff when we asked to check in at the counter was ‘We are fully booked so I don’t know how you can have a booking’, without even checking the system or asking for a name. Our experience with staff was very rude and abrupt, and we felt there was an unwillingness to help. The hotel room itself was awful. The room STUNK and was so dark with lamps that barely gave any light. The room badly needed repainting and the shower was gross with a shower head that barely worked. The beds didn’t even have a proper duvet/doona cover - just a couple of blankets. The hidden fees were also a joke, we were charged a ‘resort fee’ and made to also pay a $100 deposit. I have no issue paying such fees, but it’s rather insulting to have to fork out money for a hotel which is no way near considered a resort, and is totally sub-par to any other hotel we have ever stayed. Definitely won’t be staying here again or recommending!

I loved my stay at the Ambassador Hotel. The location was ideal for me. The hotel is clean, the staff is excellent and it is across the street from where the green and pink trolley lines stop. It's also very close to where the Friday night fireworks are presented on the beach.

This Hotel may not be the fanciest on the block but the Staff and their TEAM members sure knows how to have their GUEST to keep coming back!!! Service from the front desk (Tres) to the housekeeping (Aurora), maintenance (Manny) , and the manager (Monica) we're by far the BEST SERVICE I EVER experience from any Hotel I stayed at....this hotel should be rated a 10+.

We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was amazingly friendly & helpful! We arrived 7 hrs before check in time & they were able to hold our bags for us until check in time which was really helpful! They also held our bags for us after we checked out which was also amazing since our flight was 8 hrs after check out time. They may not be the fanciest hotel in Waikiki but it is very clean & having a staff with great customer service is very important to me. This hotel is also in a great location!! I highly recommend this hotel!!

Location to all stores, restaurants and activities at beach was excellent. I would rate as a upper middle class Hotel convenetly located to every thing by walking distance with out feeling you just bought & paid for the relistate you slept at. Good clean value and safe location Rebooking for October and November

This place is a trip. The room was clean but the light fell off the ceiling in the night. There was a filtered water machine broken. The pool looked like a health hazard. You can do better if you take the time to look around

Terrible hotel! My son woke up with hundreds of bites ALL over his body! The manager cane in and said no it wasn’t bedbugs but rather an allergic reaction to soap?! I was so made! They waved the parking but refused to make anything else right! I am telling everyone to stay away from this hotel since the management is terrible and rooms are a filth! Disgusting!!!

The room is terrible. Missing paint on every walls of the room. Need sandals to take a shower, moles on the floor. Bathroom door doesn’t close. Really humid and dark room. Took this hotel because of the parking. Parking full, need to wake up at 6:00 to call the office for a place next morning.

OMG, where to begin...first of all, we are a military family and housing informed us that we wouldn’t be able to move in to our home for a month...the Ambassador Hotel went over and above what ANY hotel in the area was willing to do and the staff was absolutely UNBELIEVABLE!!!...the manager was so kind and accommodating for our family to the point of personal disbelief...I cannot say enough about the staff...the hotel isn’t the newest, fanciest, or have a ton of amenities, but the personal feel and incredible service from ALL of the staff (even the housekeeping and maintenance personnel) will make you forget all of that superficial stuff...I would definitely recommend them to anyone who likes a more personal and caring experience
