Kailua, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Our stay here this week has been quite pleasant. Not a five star hotel but very comfortable and very convenient to pretty much everything! There is no restaurant within the hotel but there is a Coffee Bean shop and a Whalers (ABC) corner store right outside, as with most other hotels in the area. The Ambassador hotel is also right on a major bus line and within walking distance to the beach and many other restaurants, shops and points of interest. There is a nice pool area, fitness room, business center and laundry facility wit three washers and three dryers. There is a $20 per day resort fee which isn’t bad in comparison to other hotels. Our partial ocean view room on the 15th floor is great! For the price and convenience, I’d stay here again.

Rooms were kept clean, employees were friendly and accommodated our needs. Parking was extremely close, right outside the main entrance. The hotel was walking distance from the beach and International market place.

Argie and Irene couldn’t have made out stay any better but I especially thank Argie for making out situation work and putting my daughter priority. I understand this is not the fanciest hotel, but there customer service is on point. overall cleanliness was good and housekeeping and front desk was very responsive!Thank you !

This was so funny, allthough from Europe, we have had a lot of roadtrips through 24 of the states, and often, in the "middle of nowhere" we have stayed in motel rooms just like this. And, for 30 or 40 dollars a night, that was a great way of experiencing the "american way" in those old ikonic roadside motels. Noisy old ac, worn carpets, the old motel smell, really bad shower, minimalistic bathroom, and so on, for 30 bucks that was actually very okay.This week, we had a trip down memory Lane, at the Ambassador.. This is the Exact same rooms ! The only difference is that you cant park the car outside your door.And ... the price of course... I guess its really not the hotels fault, this is the insane price level in Waikiki. Even so, I simply cant get used to paying 5 or 6 times the value for a motel room. And therefore my rating..The beds were actually quite good, sleep quality is ok when / if you get used to the noisy ac.. The balcony.. I'm not quite sure what it is there for: it have no furniture, not even a chair, its all wet from the ac water drain.. and it is not even allowed to smoke out there. TV channels okay, bathroom minimalistic, etc."Resort fee" is added, parking is extra, put some tax on top of that and you are looking at close to 200 dollars for a 30 dollar motel room. Enjoy ;) (On top of that they really need a "deposit" wow..)(we left Waikiki the next day)

We chose to stay at 3 different accommodations whilst in the island of Oahu. The Ambassador was the 'cheaper' alternative and we booked it because it had a kitchenette. The staff were lovely and accommodating but the room that we stayed in was quite run down and old. The shower blocked and took almost an hour to unblock before the next person could shower; the air conditioner was quite noisy and the walls were stained/dirty.

Nothing compareed to the pictures!! They had false advertisement!!! This hotel in not even a ONE star, it should be ZERO...smells horrible the doors all broken..the only one thing that was perfect was the stove, but maybe because nobody uses it..

We stayed for my friends wedding party in Waikiki. The location is great! The self parking is very easy and spacious( don’t see that much in Waikiki, which is grate!) Staffs at the front desk is very friendly with smile . Kerrie helped us with questions around the area which was really helpful! The place is clean and comfortable for the price we paid. Will stay again!!!

Positive——- really good location, less than 10mins walk to waikiki beach, shopping, restaurants and there are lots of mini supermarkets nearby. Good views if you get good rooms up.Negative ——This is hotel is really old and it shows as soon as you enter the lobby. The hotel charges 125 usd for amenities . And they also take a deposit incase you break anything which is ok and understandable. The only problem is that everything in the room is on the verge of breaking. The slid doors, the furniture, fridge door etc. so u have to be very carrful. The lifts stops before they actually stop and when the door opens u can actually see it coming to the level. Pretty scary. If you are in late pregnacy, those lifts can actually mak you go to labour. They make a drop like the ones airplanes sometimes make mid air.

Not what I expected from a 'resort' in downtown waikiki. The 500 sq ft bungalow for a B&B was better. This room in this place smelt musty, the a/c was not cooling, the shower did not drain, and there were empty shampoo bottles in the medicine cabinet. Pool closes early as well. Great location though for the strip.

To take the time from my honeymoon in Hawaii to write a review should speak volumes about this hotel. We decided to do a camping tour of Hawaii, but after 3 nights in the wilderness needed some refuge and a hot shower. When we walked in to the room my wife and I immediately felt we'd rather stay in the tent. When I made the booking it was advertised at $115 a night, and ended up at over $180 after taxes, $25 parking per day and $20 amenity charges. The room, from the photos I've added, was horrible. There was mould and dust in the elevators, carpets had mould on them, they stunk, the air condition was loud and mouldy and rusted, the walls where flaking from salts and moisture, the furniture was damaged and paint was peeling off it, and had not been updated since the hotel was originally built, probably. It looks like a converted apartment block. When I complained of the condition of our room (532) and said that it looked nothing like the photos online, they showed me a model room (1409) which was used for the online photos. It was the same atrocious state. The shower was moulded and there was a salt and rust buildup on the faucets, and the plug holes where black. Light switches were yellow with age and looked scetchy. I have never before walked out of a hotel, but I felt I was being taken for a fool. For $100 more I have stayed at the Limassol four seasons. For $100 more I have stayed at the Doha W. For $100 less I have stayed at the Hilton Phuket Arcadia. For the same price I have stayed at the B Resort in Orlando. I can not justify this place. If you want to be taken for a fool go ahead and stay here. We preferred a tent, port a potty, and cold showers to this place.

I stayed at this hotel and found the staff and house keeping very helpful and friendly. Room was a outdated but clean. It served its purpose although not a 5 star hotel it was fine .Would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and I would stay there again.

The hotel room we got is nothing like the pictures on the internet. We have a balcony but no chairs or table (we were told that chairs are only on full ocean view rooms!!!!), the curtain is torn, the room has not been painted in years and all the fit out is at least 30 years old - perhaps some of it 40 or more. Staff are pleasant and helpful but the room is a total disappointment. The layout of the room is poor, bathroom facilities inadequate and dated - no splash backs in bathroom or kitchen so paint peeling from the walls in all spaces. No outdoor pool either. Would definitely not come back here again. Very poor value for money and now that I am here would definitely have chosen another hotal.

Made our first day in Hawaii a terrible experience. Nowhere do they state on their site that you will be paying 25 dollars a day for parking, nowhere do they state that you will be paying 20 dollars a day for "amenities" which are things like watching TV and the basic things that should be included in the thousands of dollars you spend to stay there. The pictures they show you of the rooms are a farce. They are 1/3 the size of what they show and our third bed was a couch pullout bed. Shower was broken and had to be fixed twice and there were ants in the kitchen. You have a balcony with a view of hotel doors, if your curtains are open, anyone can see inside. You can't even smoke on the balcony or it's a 250 dollar fine. The staff obviously know this place is a scam. Every traveler we saw checking in had the same look as we did of utter disappointment and confusion to where all these extra charges were coming from and why nothing looked as advertised. And the staff have nothing to offer besides a 5 dollar reduction on parking each day and that's only if you bug them about it. So you basically have the choice of going to a better hotel which is anywhere, or sticking with what you purchased after the long trip to get there when your exhausted and just want to settle in. I can't believe they get away with it. Most of the patrons there looked to be from Japan and were probably just happy to be in Hawaii. To anyone with standards... go somewhere else and if your stuck at this hotel, plan on being out of it as much as possible.

We stayed here for 5 nights. City/Sea views were awesome (13 Floor). Staff are courteous and helpful and always polite and give you a smile. Our room was very outdated. Supposed to be self catering - had full fridge/freezer, stove, electric jug and Toaster. Only enough plates/glasses for 2 - no extra's. NO tea and coffee sachets etc to make your own. Stove seemed dangerous to use as could see wires underneath the element!! Bathroom very dated and not very clean due to very old tiles in both shower and floor. 10min walk to beach and at the quieter end of town, but still very noisey. Balcony in each room. Overall a nice place... but basic and time for rooms to be brought up to date.

review_body: I was sadly disappointed with this hotel. I payed extra for a "partial ocean view" and the window in my room was looking in the opposite direction of the ocean towards a bunch of buildings. When I complained about this to the front desk they explained that the "partial ocean view" is from the front door. There are no windows in the room facing that direction. It's just a catwalk to get to your room. I can't believe they charge extra for a small view of the ocean when you leave your room. In addition to this, I payed for a King bed and got two fulls. Other major issues: *The shower was very dirty. *The chairs had cigarette burns in them (this is a non-smoking room). *The entire room was outdated.*There was a strange musty smell.*The front door didn't shut completely from the outside - I had to use my room key to wiggle the handle in order to get the door to shut.*They charge an extra "convenience fee" plus extra for parking.I will not stay at Ambassador Hotel again.

Great location and friendly staff Basic room dated decor but clean sheets and tidy room big balcony and bonus they that a smoking area ( not many places to smoke in Waikiki)Decent sized pool ,air con works (very loud and have to turn it off at night) internet was a strong signal but slow at times.Price was fantastic for a week! Would return happily if your looking for a cheap holiday

I stayed here a little over a week and this is my third time in Honolulu. I have never been in a hotel room as outdated and dirty as this. The hotel walls were a few different colors due to hole patching. Didn’t even bother painting the room the same color. The curtains all had holes, prob the same curtains from the first time they opened in the 80s. The floor was sticky and was on dire need of a deep clean. The bathroom was horrid. Another deep clean would be nice there too. It always reeked of mildew and mold because there was no ventilation. I felt like I was back at a college dorm bathroom. The shower head was filthy with mildew and had to wear flip flops in the shower because fungus infection would be inevitable. Every time the bathroom door closes the latch that was on the ceiling would fall out revealing a disgusting dirty non working ventilation system. The kitchen was a nice add on but also very outdated. The only thing I enjoyed was that it had a full refrigerator because it kept our water and food fresh. The main door also was a problem since the deadbolt would always stick out preventing the door to close behind us. We would have to either badge back in or physically always turn the deadbolt back. Everyday after a day out I would dread coming back to the hotel. I highly do not recommend anyone to stay here. There are so many visitors out of the country so it’s pretty busy which means that they are making money, but I’m not sure where it all goes because everything needs work.

On my first trip to Hawaii from Minnesota. Our family really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel definitely needs some updates, but we were very impressed by the service experience. We would recommend it for the low price, and location.

What a disappointment.The website is pretty great marketing scheme. Works. But never again nor would ever recommend this place as a mother of a young woman stationed in the Army here came her first time to see her. I. Will be back to see her but will not be here. The staff friendly but embarrassed and knew exactly what I was referring too. It’s called lying

Had been in the Hotel Biz for over 27 years, before retiring from the 5 Star Beverly Hills Hotel.. I started my career in Waikiki in the ‘80’s and through the’90s at the Outrigger Hotels..And have stayed in many Hotels throughout the years, on vacations according to the “best” deal I could get in a 3-4 star hotel...I can tell you that The Ambassador Hotel is not a 3 star property. It is maybe a 1 star, and that would be generous... This hotel is filthy dirty, The bed pillows and linens stink, the shower has mildew, and I think the furniture dates back to when I started my career in the ‘80’s , if not earlier...Oh, and the staff.. uhh.. terrible. From check-in to check-out, and all in between, the staff has a don’t care attitude, including the Management. The pictures on the website, of the rooms, were probably taken in the ‘80s because the current state of the rooms are unrecognizable to the pictures.To the Manager who is responding to all of these terrible reviews here, with “we will contact you personally regarding your concerns “, don’t bother... It does not seem like you are doing anything to make the hotel or the staff better, as these hundreds of bad reviews go back years, for all the same problems... My regret? Believing in pictures and star rating without looking at the reviews...This IS the WORST hotel I have ever stayed...

This hotel is in major need of an update/overhaul. Once I got over the disappointment of my first impression, I realized that it was clean and it was basically only a place to sleep for us as we explored Oahu. It served its purpose but could be SO much better. It is an old hotel and the location is good. The bathroom is large because there is a full size closet there with mirrored sliding doors but has only a small shower with plastic curtain, commode and small sink. No shelf area to put your essentials. There is no coffee or tea in the rooms or lobby. You are sent next door to buy what you need. We had no furniture on the balcony. They need to discontinue their daily 'Amenities Charge' of $20 until they actually have something better to offer their guests.

This hotels location is ok. However the hotel has no mealsPay an amenities fee yet no tea and coffee in the room but have cups and hot water jug no free water in room just tap water but can go down stairs to get filtered water in collapsible water bottle. Pay for porters to pick up luggage yet no one touched our bags. Front desk put us in a room with three single beds even though we asked for a double bed. We could get a double bed if we paid more money. Our air conditioner leaked outside and that might no worry many however so did the other 15+ above us which subsequently meant when we looked outside we thought it was raining. Sometimes couldn’t stay outside because u got wetElevators kept missing our floor and had to take the elevator going up then come down when I passed on the information to the front desk I was informed that it has been happening for sometime. I said why hasn’t it been fixed? They just looked at me. Last two days had to ask them to make up our room and on the last day they just said you are going early in the morning do u need it cleaned I said yes so we went to dinner at 7pm and they said it would be done when we got back! It was doneSome front desk staff were not helpful and bordered on rudeFor what we paid it was disgraceful never will I go to that hotel and I will think twice on that chain also

This is an old hotel but in a good location - pricing was fair - we were so lucky as we were allocated a pent house suite on tp floor with magnificent views over Waikiki beach. Hope were handy and within easy walk. Taxis readily available.

Convenient location but kitchen is old, carpet sticky, and didn't look like picture. No patio furniture on balcony. Also was not informed of $20 daily resort fee. Staff was nice and maids did a good job.

Terrible left after one night. Dirty rooms, old kitchens with minimum facilities unclean in desperate need of upgrading. Lovely staff but more like a 2 star motor lodge than a hotel. There are much nice places to stay

This place looked nothing like the brochure that I saw, it also does not have a games room which is mentioned in it. The room itself that I had was in desperate need of renovations, it was not of the cleanest standard and the shower head you have to hold it to shower as it doesnt sit up on its own, Whilst it was quiet in the evenings there was building works close to this hotel so very noisy in the mornings at 6am.Also there is a kettle and cups to make a drink but no cutlery/tea spoons and no tea coffee. I went to reception to ask for a spoon and lets be honest the customer service at this place was absolutely appalling it was like pulling teeth to get a spoon to use. Also on check in I made sure that I paid for the previous night knowing that my flight would land at 6am so I could check in straight away and the fumbling around to find a room for me was ridiculous as they knew in advance I had paid for the previous night, I'm pretty sure they gave my room out to someone and gave me the worst room for the week. (when greed takes over I guess)The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the main shopping area which was ok. Tony Romas restaurant is 2 blocks away (good ribs and mashed potato to be had there so I can recommend them for dinner or lunch) I personally would not stay at this hotel again, main reasons being the level of cleanliness and the customer service. You can find somewhere closer to the centre of waikiki its worth paying a bit more. Also if you do stay here bring ear plugs to sleep with.

The hotel is well located an almost all the staff is very nice. Just one maintenince guy was very rude. Its sad that one person can ruin the work and image of all the very nice staff. Hope the hotel do something.

When I booked my stay they didn’t mention that the default was two twin beds so when I got there they charged me more money for a king bed which is what I originally requested. Then the rooms were very uncomfortable, green and grimmy. The bed felt like it was just a box spring. The bathroom shower was disgusting and everything was so old. It smells like old mold in the rooms. Was very disappointed we ended up leaving an hour after arrival. 10/10 would not recommend.

We had reserved a large room a while before check in day but when we got to check in they said they had given our room away?? I was confused because they told us and confirmed that it would be available and ready for us but they instead downgraded us to a very small room for a few bucks off. The small room costed only 20 bucks less than the original room and it was not a very good deal. Manager on the phone told us to "take the room or leave" and I thought that was very rude. Don't think I will be coming back to this hotel - hope everything changes for the better for its future customers.

I stayed in room 330. The hotel is in a great location but that's really it. The room needs to be renovated. I paid $310 for 2 nights. I will definitely pay the extra $50 to stay at other hotels the next time. I have stayed at Alamoana hotel, Ohana waikiki east by outriger and Sheraton waikiki and waikiki gate way hotel. I'd say for cleanliness and hotel rooms conditions I'd chose Alamoana first. Spend the extra $50 and get yourself a decent place to sleep in.

From Check in to Check out, I love this hotel and everytime me and my friends want to have a girls night out especially being a local, this hotel has a great price for the number of beds needed. The only thing was when I booked the picture had shown three beds but when we C/I we got two, still not a huge issue but a little misleading DEFINATELY will stay here again.

My third time to stay at this hotel and it has not changed one bit. Cleanliness is tops and the staff are friendly and accommodating. I was able to have the break I was craving. Location is perfect and very convenient.

It was a wonderful room. There was a clean feeling and the view was also the best. There was a time when there was only one wind that could be heard, it was noisy.Shower and amenities were very satisfied. Staff's correspondence was also good. I still want to use it.

Overall the Ambassador Hotel is decent as a budget hotel. It is old and in dire need of upgrades, but if all you need is a place to sleep and shower you're okay. I booked a city view. My "city view" turned out to be the backside of a hotel tower and a noisy laneway full of garbage cans. If you walked to the end of the outdoor balcony and craned your neck you could glimpse the city. The one time I opened the sliding glass door to go outside it came off its tracks and I had to call maintenance. The bathroom rail fell off when I touched it. I can only imagine how a person requiring it to sit and stand could have been hurt! Rust stains all down the side of the tub. My husband was at the same place, different floor and room 3 weeks prior to me. His first room had water coming out the light fixture in the bathroom, so they moved him to another room. But we both agree on this: the staff are courteous and friendly, the rooms are kept very clean, and the hotel is a good central position for the city. The kitchenette is great, well appointed.

Lovely friendly staff in this hotel which had a great position not far from the beach and eateries in Waikiki, bonus of a kitchen in rooms if u wished to cook also two large beds and TV although we had no furniture in our balcony which I found strange but overall a great hotel x

At check in, we found out that we were placed in a double instead of the three twins we had requested. They said they couldn't change it. We had a daily fee of $20 for amenities (which are not worth it). The hotel is nothing as pictured. The rooms are very old and run down. Our a/c unit only worked half the time. It was literally busted on the front and had a full 5 gal. bucket of water overflowing onto our balcony. We had several roaches (yes, it is Hawaii, so I am not too surprised). Our door would not shut on it's own so we had to be extra careful each time we left the room. The safe wouldn't work at all, even after they came and "fixed" it. The elevator was having issues and we waited 5-15 minutes to get on just to go up and down from the second floor! We asked about stairs and said they couldn't be used due to an alarm. The staff was very nice. The location is very convenient if you don't want to be right on the beach or right in the shopping district. Cheeseburger Waikiki is very close and The Coffee and Tea Leaf is at the entrance to the hotel. Those are excellent. If someone put some money into this hotel it could be flipped into a very nice place to stay. The rooms are a great size and the full sized fridge is awesome!

Understanding what a budget hotel is, we were fully aware of what we were getting ourselves into. We stayed 6-days (location & in-room kitchen). Reading reviews from various sites, its evident many people have had problems here. We decided any bugs would force us to leave the hotel immediately. I'm happy to say we didn't experience any adverse aspects regarding our stay. We went into it with an open mind. We were on the 4th floor. The rooms next to ours were undergoing renovation. I assume ours had already been renovated. Decent and satisfactory room for the money. We got lucky with a $98/nt rate at the end of January. We checked in after 8pm and we were glad we did. The guy who checked us in was very courteous (forgot his name). Most other times we traversed the lobby it was packed! Literally packed with tour groups and long lines for the elevator. While in the elevator we did encounter stories of other guests who were unsatisfied. It all depends on your room. We had a city view balcony. I can see how some people would complain about the noise of the city. Guess what, you're in a city! City noise is expected! Cleaning staff was very attentive. Although we had the "Do not Disturb" on the door, they were very prompt when we requested towels, etc. Overall decent stay although we probably would not stay here again unless we're able to obtain a rate below $100.

The location of the hotel is excellent. Just a short walk (5min) to the main street of Waikiki. the hotel itself is dated but it is clean and serves its purpose of a place to sleep in a comfortable bed. The rooms have air conditioning. There are local experts in the foyer/reception who can give advice on local activities etc. The rooms are serviced daily. If you're looking for something basic then this hotel is fine. There is no restaurant, there is a pool. There is a water station. The coffee shop next to the hotel is not good. service is rude and the coffee is awful. The store next to the hotel is ok. Some staff are nice others are rude.

We stayed here over New Years. Was recommended by travel agent. What a dump. They charge you $20 a day to use the internet and swimming pool (which is average). Front desk staff are rude. Hotel is in disrepair. They don’t even give you washing up liquid or enough plates for each room occupant. Really noisy too. The air conditioner sounds like you are sleeping under a train. Housekeeping staff are really good Do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere!!!!!!!!

We booked this room, and given the price and reviews, were expecting a low budget but hopefully quality hotel.First, the good. The location was prime. With a 17th floor room, our private patio was stunning offering 180 degree mountain and ocean views. The cleaning staff was so friendly and always had a smile.And then the rest. The hotel was definitely outdated and needed a lot of painting. But again, we were up for low budget on this trip. That is until we came home the first evening and found at least 20 house roaches all around the sink and crawling on the counters. They scattered within seconds of us turning on the lights. We called the front desk hoping for either a room change or at least some heavy extermination but instead got a maintenance person with an almost empty can of Raid. The roaches weren't limited to the kitchen as we each found one in our dressers and, the final straw, one walked across my husband's chest as he was lying in bed. To rub salt in the wound, the manager wanted to charge us for staying that first night arguing that "if it was so bad, why didn't you leave" (maybe because it was 11 pm and this family of four had no where to go during a booked Christmas holiday week). We ended up checking out the very next morning.I do not recommend staying at this hotel until they exterminate the entire building.

The whole hotel should be renovated, the carpets had stains, the room was unclean, bathroom had rust, the faucets were leaking and the walls had bad looking patches from dampness.A fraud attempt, shouldn't be a 3 star hotel by any means, pictures don't match reality. Would never visit again!

We booked a room for New Year's Eve here since our family was across the street at the Holiday Inn Express and they were booked. The photos online looked pretty good. Unfortunately our room looked nothing like those photos. The lobby and pool area looked somewhat renovated, but from the elevator to the halls to our room, you can definitely tell this hotel is old and needs a desperate update. Our room had old appliances, old bathroom fixtures, and old furniture. Our bathroom door didn't close properly. Our view was of the other tower. The price we were charged included a lot of taxes and fees, including an "amenity charge" of $20/day. Though I'm sure the nightly rate was more for New Year's Eve, all of the taxes and fees pushes the cost to much more than advertised on their website. There are plenty of hotels in the area that give you more for the price we paid. On a positive note, the staff we encountered were all helpful and pleasant. The room size was larger than some of the other hotels in the Waikiki area. The television/cable worked well and we were given free refillable water bottles. The pool looked pleasant, but we didn't have time to use it. Overall though, I would only recommend if you need to stay for one night and don't plan on staying in the room much.

Decent stay, good location, but their front desk officers are NOT friendly at all. We had a concern about our bill and their credit card charges (it was confusing!) and the person who explained raised her voice. They’re not very informative either

We booked this hotel based on the pictures and it was a last minute trip. When we arrived they "upgraded" us at no charge for a partial beach view room since our city view sold out. How nice right, wrong. The room is filthy and run down. Here are a few pictures. We went to look at the pool at 6:44 pm and our key cards wouldn't work. I called and they informed us the maintence team probably closed it since it closes at 7. The neighbors at the hotel across the street are still enjoying their pool at 7:41 pm. I addressed all concerns with the manager on duty, Isabel, and she informed me that housekeeping is closed so she will address all concerns in the morning. We travel a bit and I've never experienced such a lack of customer service and poor amenities. We will not stay here again. Pay the extra money and stay elsewhere. I am so disapointed! This is my first trip to Hawaii.

I am surprised that this hotel charges guest with a hidden "Resort-Amenity Fee" of $20/day. The amenities include wireless internet access and an empty water bag for guest to fill in water on the 2nd floor. This is equivalent to forcing guests to pay internet access. The hotel also substitutes bottled water with a water bag to save money and yet this cost-cutting approach is claimed as an amenity item.More importantly, I am very disappointed with the speed of internet. The speed was way below adequate level (below 1 MB/Sec for about 50% time I wanted to use it). It was impossible to use internet. Almost all hotels I stayed provide complementary internet access at about 2 to 5MB/sec. The irony is that the hotel claims it provides "Cutting Edge" Wireless Internet Access as a main (fee-paying) amenity item. This is totally unfair to guests. It forces guests to pay a service that is essentially non-existent.The most disappointing part is the attitude of the hotel manager. When I reported to the manager that the internet was not working properly, he responded by claiming that I did not know how to use internet. I had to show him that the speed of internet is very low. Then, he blamed the problem on too many users, as if this is an expected condition for the hotel. As mentioned, the hotel is charging customers for internet access as a paid service. My recommendation is not to use this hotel. You will be disappointed by a number of unpleasant surprises.

Looked at the pictures on the net and they look good.Upon entering the Hotel, it starts to look a little worn down, The staff are helpful and accommodating, We had booked a 3 bedroom room overlooking the city.the room we received did not overlook the city and the shower and toilet where all in oneso only 1 person could use that area at a time.if they had been separate then shower and toilet could be used by 1 people at the same time.this was a issue in the morning and at night when getting ready to go out.The rooms require painting and updating of furniture and amenities, they are worn and the paint is peeling.the pool area also needs some updating

We returned to the Ambassador Hotel for the Honolulu Marathon after a positive experience in 2016. I initially researched many properties in Honolulu & chose the Ambassador primarily because of the kitchen. We prefer to prepare our own meals convenient to our schedules & dietary needs.  The property is convenient: the reliable "The Bus" has stops in front of the hotel for easy transportation to most places on the island. Kuhio and Kalakaua avenues are parallel: Kalakaua is a 'main drag' for shopping & a short walk from the hotel (corner of Kuhio and Namahana). Front Desk Staff: business-like and knowledgeable, especially in assisting with directions. 2 Expedia concierges in the lobby can book all types of excursions.Maintenance: We arrived after dark; the bulb in the pole lamp was burned out; I took it to the front desk and within minutes, a maintenance worker replaced it. Rooms: clean and basic with needed comforts. Kitchenette included a great refrigerator/freezer; microwave; stove and basic cooking supplies: frying pan; kettle; spatula; slotted spoon; & 'two of everything': cups, plates, silverware.' Dishcloth & towel provided but no dishwashing liquid. Two sets of large drawers so you can unpack for longer stays. Good TV. Internet was fine. We took advantage of the free local calls to call The Bus for times and directions. We took The Bus to the Food Pantry on Kuhio but other nearby stores are available for food including the Whalers General Store on site; an ABC store is a half block away. Be prepared: Food prices are high. ($.59-$.99 a PIECE for bananas; eggs: $5.99 a dozen; milk: $7.99 a gallon.). We used the in-room safe which was easy to set up.Generous bath amenities are provided; towels: fresh & absorbent. Shower only, no tub; good water pressure & temperature. Lighting could be improved. There is one pole lamp and one wall lamp on the bedside table which was bright enough to read by. but another lamp is needed. I am not a fan of fluorescent lighting (bathroom and kitchen area). Housekeeping: good; our dishes were done one day when I didn't take time to do them. It was hard to predict when the rooms were cleaned, however. We were there for a week; we left in the morning for long periods of time to return to an unserviced room. I went to the 2nd floor Housekeeping office to exchange towels with no problem. On another occasion, I exchanged towels from the housekeeper who was still on our floor with no problem or questions asked. There is a trash chute at the end of each floor.I did laundry twice during our week stay. There are 3 washers and 4 dryers on the second floor. Price is $2.00 to wash and $.50 for 15 minutes drying time. Both a change machine and laundry supply vending machine are available. We loved the balcony and looked forward to eating outside using the ironing board as our 'dining room table' (covered with a bath towel.) The rooms ending in '01' have wraparound balconies.The property could use some color; everything is beige. The Ambassador serves us well. We will probably return to Honolulu in 2018; if so, we will book again.

The rooms are very dated and need to be remodeled. The staff is very nice and friendly. The location is good. For the price the room should be more updated and modern. The down town Honolulu area is very nice with lots of great shopping and fun entertainment.

After a 10 hour flight from Sydney we had the worst experience and misfortune to deal with Cathy at the front desk. We had a party of 7 and had booked 2 rooms through a travel agent. When we arived we were told that there was 2 rooms with 3 single beds in each one ( clearly does not add up to 7 people). Cathy did not want to help us in ANY way apart from telling us we had to call the travel agent in Australia to sort it out, or alternatively pay more money to get what we had booked. No attempt was made to solve this for us until we demanded to speak to a manager. I didnt get the managers name but he sorted us with what we had paid for and wanted. He was great but the service orignally from the front line staff was atrocious. This continued throughout the week with another lady chastising us for being late for our shuttle despite us being 5 mins EARLY!. We also asked for an extra hour for checkout, as well as some directions for a bus and both times the counter staff couldnt care less about helping us. The rooms were cleaned irregularly and fresh towels needed to be requested. This hotel ( apart from the manager) ruined the start of our USA holiday and unless this hotel can hire staff who actaully care about their paying customers then they deserve noone to ever stay there..worst service I have experienced on a holiday. They were absolutely appalling at their job and should look for alternative employment because they are in the wrong field..may I suggest somewhere that doesnt involve speaking to people!!

Location is good as the bus stop is just in front of the lobby. The decent sized rooms with good balcony access are superb. 2 x Double bed room for 4 is good enough. Hotel has own swimming pool and free 2 hours bike is great for us. Only thing that need to improve is the bathroom, the water unable to flow down smoothly.

While there may be rooms like the ones pictured on their website beware that there are also rooms that are in extremely poor shape, see pictures that were taken in the room we were assigned. The bathroom in particular was pretty disgusting. I have stayed in budget hotels in the past but nothing this bad. The driver that picked us up to go the airport told us he rarely picks anyone up at this hotel. His rating of the hotel was a 1. I gave it a 2 because at least when we complained at the front desk the young lady was sympathetic and offered us a different room. It was better but still not like the ones pictured on the web. Thankfully they weren't full.

My brother, sister and l had a, 3 single bed, room. Worked out great for us. The room was clean and beds comfortable. Sorry to say, we did see several bugs in the bathroom. The staff was very nice and we sure did use the Concierge, a lot. All 3 of them were very accommodating. I do wish that the hours, for the pool to be open, were changed. I think that closing at 7:00 pm is way to early. There were other guests that felt the same way.

The title says it all. As for the room, I had to use my shoulder to open and close the door, both it and the bathroom door were well out of alignment. There were numerous cracks and bubbling paint. It looked as though the room has been flooded. I believe the rooms in the adjacent wing had been renovated. The bed was good.

The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable, decent sized rooms with good balcony access. The ability to check out towels for beach use was appreciated. A larger gym facility would have been nice as the gym seemed to fill up quickly due to the small space.

Good value for the reasonable price. Helpful staff. I wish the pool hours were different. It was 10am to 7pm. I wouid prefer 7a or 8a to 10p. Good location. Comfortable place with the basics. I went with this hotel because of the great rate. By choosing the "use it or lose it" option I didn't have to pay the resort fee. The rooms were comfy with a mictro and frig. Also enjoyed the lanai.

Great price for such a conveniently located and very nice hotel! Professional personnel, big rooms, some with kitchenettes, dinnerware and silverware. We were satisfied with all aspects of this hotel.

Very convenient and parking was good. The daily room cleaning was timely done. The cart allowed us to move luggage was great. The kitchen allowed us to prepare food The elevators were fast. The fitness center was good with ear phones and towels. All good.

Older hotel but very clean and tidy, staff were very friendly polite and helpful, nice place to stay. Good location close to everything. Within walking distance to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants.

We stayed here for 8 nights and enjoyed the Hotel's location and amenities. Only a 15 minute stroll to Waikiki beach and even closer to a number of restaurants and high end shops. The bus stop outside took you to the major shopping centre in Honolulu called Ala Moana Centre. The rooms are comfortable and the kitchenette and bathrooms are clean and suitable. The pool is lovely and the staff are friendly and polite. The hotel also has a tour desk where you can book bus trips and other sight seeing activities. There is also a mini supermarket and coffee shop next door.

We visited Hawaii in September. We were on the island of Oahu. We came earlier than expected and we stayed at this hotel with family and friends for one night. We all had separate rooms. The positives of this hotel is the staff. The staff is friendly and helpful. The price for the room is reasonable for Waikiki. The hotel is located at the beginning of the strip. The hotel is a short 15 minute walk to the beach. The hotel has a clean unheated pool. The negatives of the hotel are the following. The parking is not free and a hassle. We were charged at first 20$ for parking. The rooms are dated. They are dated for the 1970’s. The AC unit is a add on to all the rooms. Ours was not working correctly and they waved the parking fee for the inconvenience. The rooms have a full kitchen with dated appliances. The hotel is large with only two elevators. The elevators are slow. The hotel is an open design. That basically means that there is no protection from the weather except in the lobby and your room. The towels look and feel like they were made in the 1970s. The same goes for the entire bathroom. Water pressure is just adequate. The beds are adequate as well. This hotel is great for a very short stay , definitely not a week.

near all the designer stores and lots of action for night owls; Stayed here 4 nights and found the convenience of the bus very good, right outside the hotel. Negative point-had to touch the room card to the lift button before you could call it, wifii played up somewhat, could not use Whatspp to call overseas as the connection was dodgy, and didnt stay the last night at the hotel but paid for it, as my flight was at 7am next day and I couldn't chance missing my flight. Hotel could have stored luggage but didnt offer this facility. In fact, when I checked out for one day to Kauai and wanted to take hand luggage for a day there, I had to store my larger suitcase with them as I would return. They said they would charge $5 for holding it but when I said I would return for the last two days they said they would then discount that charge. When I returned from Kauai, they had stored my suitcase away in a room with many other bags and had to be retrieved from the back of it all. With regards to advice on how to get to the airport for an early morning flight, Hotel desk staff suggested I take a cab for $40, as shuttle they could order wouldnt start till 6am, too late for check in, and that the bus would not allow me on board with my large suitcase. They were wrong. I got to the airport on the pre-paid bus fare I had and spent the night at the airport. Sometimes you must trust your instincts.

This was our first time in Hawaii and we were not staying long, we were catching a Cruise Ship the following evening, and that is perhaps why the staff were just polite. We were aware that we could not access our rooms until 3pm but as we arrived at the Hotel at 8.30am we thought they may make an effort to get us in a bit sooner but it was not to be. We checked our bags in then went to look for a bit of breakfast, our intention then was to go to Pearl Harbour but we found out that you have to be booked early or you will miss out. We booked for the following morning and then went wandering. We hopped on a bus to a large shopping centre and spent quite a few hours there. We got back to the hotel about 1.30pm and asked if there was any chance we could get into our rooms but I've already given you the answer to that. At no time did any staff member ask us anything about where we were from, where we we going, offer any suggestions of where to get a meal (the Ambassador has no restaurant), or suggest anywhere to go to eat up the time we had to go until we could get into our rooms. At 2.45pm I asked again and was told we could access our rooms, nobody approached us, I had to ask, the staff member also noted that ours were the last rooms to be cleaned, I found that a little odd as we had arrived 6 hours before. As others have mentioned the rooms are large and ours had a full sized refrigerator and stove/oven in the kitchen but weirdly for a place that has no Restaurant, no coffee or tea making facility.That is a first in any Hotel or even Motel we have stayed in. There was a balcony with a bit of a view which would have been nice to take in but there were no chairs out there and as we had now been awake for 36 hours, did not feel like standing. We were up early the next day and off to Pearl Harbour. We returned and upon checking out we were charged a $20 service fee which apparently covers such things as having our bags taken to our room etc, as we had to do that ourselves and bring them down again I assume the $20 covered the explanation of why we were being charged $20.  While never rude I have never met Hotel staff more disinterested in guests, perhaps it's because we were only staying a night or maybe they are just over tourists?

We were fortunate enough to receive an upgrade to a room with a kitchenette. It was a bit bigger and on the 17th floor which was nice. Parking was $20 bucks a night which is fairly standard but well worth it if you have a car. There is a corner store adjacent to the hotel which has all you might need. Beds were comfortable and the housekeeper did a great job cleaning the room.

This hotel requires some work, lots of room in our room with a small kitchen but no coffee,tea or case stands provided although there was room for, no breakfasts on premises but bed was good although had to sleep with a fairly noisy aircon, can just see some water from balcony, easy enough walk to main Waikiki shopping area and beach, has a good pool area and an onsite ATM with a $4.00 fee, staff friendly. Bathroom had not much room to place toiletries in an accessible area, other facilities were a bit dated

We booked into Ambassador knowing it was a 3 Star Hotel. As it was a short visit we thought the location would meet our needs for attendance at family wedding - somewhere to sleep!First and foremost I have to say if we were judging on cleanliness then 5/5 would be ripping them off. The place was spotless!The location worked against us unfortunately. We come from a quiet location with no traffic noise overnight. The hotel was exposed to lots of traffic, sirens, fight noises and worst of all a barrage of commercial dumpsters being emptied at 5am. We paid for 5 nights and vacated after 1.This was no fault of the hotel! It related purely to our own lifestyle. We could not survive another 4 nights of no sleep. The hotel is definitely getting on in years. The furniture is chipped and shabby but as I mentioned, extremely clean. 2 double beds were ok comfort wise. The kitchen would have been useful for a family stay. Very basic. We did have ocean views off the balcony but no furniture on the balcony.

We stayed for a week in Sept 2017 had 2 rooms on the 16th floor. On arrival the front of line staff was lovely and efficient getting our group sorted quickly. Amenity fee is a bit ridiculous as you cannot swim after 7pm around the time people are returning from shopping etc and also the same with bike hire closing at 6pm the perfect time for an evening cycle. Our rooms were not flash and were very dated our stove/oven did not work but because we had 2 rooms we used the stove in the other room, the beds were clean and tidy but the air con was quite loud. Coffee shop and mini supermarket next door, and a office by reception to book tours etc. Overall stay was fine if your not to fussy.

This motel is NOT what you expect for the money you pay. Although the beds were made with clean sheets, they seemed to be single size on a double. We thought the beds were meant to be queen size. The towels were quite small. No tea and coffee facilities, but there was a kettle which I plugged in as I had purchased items from the shop on the street. The power point doesn't have an on/off switch, so when I unplugged the kettle, sparks flew. The kitchen is outdated but the fridge kept things cold. The air conditioner was loud and even after turning it off, it kept running. I was going to unplug it but the power point was exposed. The vent in the bathroom was so clogged I can only assume it had NEVER been cleaned. We were charged an amenities fee for what, I didn't even use the pool. We did have a nice view from the balcony even though it had no furniture and had to drag the dining chairs out there.

The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. There is no coffeemaker in the room because downstairs there is a CoffeeBean restaurant and also a little store for bread, milk chips etc. The pool area was nice and clean. It is easy to walk downtown for restaurants and shopping and it is very close to the beach. The hotel is ok. If you are on upper floor you will have less noise from outside.From Canada

The room was clean and tidy the rest was not up to the 3 star No coffee makerno balcony chairs or table no dish wash liquid extra fees on top of the booked price payed up front  WORST OF ALL THE BEDS ROCK HARDCompared to the Grove or the waikiki central

The Ambassador is in the main shopping district of Honolulu. I call it historic because I have seen it used as a location for television shows. The amenities are excellent and it near many fine restaurants and shops. They do not have their own restaurant, however. My room was very comfortable and the place was well maintained.

I'll start with the positives: the amenities at the hotel are pretty good, considering I was working while I was there the business center was really good. The staff is super friendly and the hotel is generally in a good location for exploring.The downside of the hotel is that it's a little older and the rooms are a bit run down. I wouldn't walk without shoes and the A/C didn't' seem to work very well.

We only stayed one night as this hotel after our 7 day cruise around the islands. The hotel receptionist on duty was helpful in getting our room ready by 12 noon. We had a twin room with kitchen. Bathroom was quite large. We couldn't leave the air con on at night as the motor was too loud to sleep.

The location is not bad. The receptionists were friendly but I was forced to wait for so long. The guest rooms are less than average and maybe poor motel quality. The air conditioner was very noisy and water leaked. the shower room was equipped with poor curtain and water easily leaked. If you expect to stay at a cheap motel, this can be one of the choices. But I don't recommend this hotel if you expect family services.

This is a very old appearing facility. The drains don't work properly and had to be cleaned almost daily in the shower. The rooms were clean and the cost I believe was an average of $130/$140 per night over a 14 day stay which isn't bad. It was nice to have a full kitchen to cut down on having to eat out 3 times a day. The beds were nothing special. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless plugged drains, chipped walls and paint, standard comfort isn't that important.

My husband, my mother in law and myself were there July 2017. As soon as I walked in I knew that what we paid for was not what we were getting. The elevator is in poor condition. Now, to the room... the walls are pilling because of humidity, the shower does not drain well so I had to shower standing on a little pool of water. :( We talked to one of the employees who gave us a very bad attitude when I told him that the pictures on the website don't match the reality. The general manager was nice enough to wave the parking cost and give us another room, we went to see it and it was exactly the same as the one we were at. We ended up moving to a different hotel after one night. Bad, really bad for what you pay for. You can go right across the street to the Holiday Inn Express, way nicer and they include breakfast. The Ambassador doesn't even have coffee in the kitchens or water, or anything!! If you are reading this, don't book there. There is plenty of options in Waikiki... Honolulu area! Don't go to the Ambassador.

We stayed here on July 17 until July 19, 2017.Check-in process was friendly. I think her name was Emilyn - she was friendly, polite and welcoming.The swimming pool is like a small back-yard pool. If you're just wanting a simple swim - then it's good for you. However, it is only open from 10AM TO 7PM, not very convenient for the summer holidays and the fact that many people/families are out and about/shopping during this time. The pool is on level three - so don't expect roof-top views or anything.The gym, is very simple - hand-towels available, and about 3 workout machines.It is on level two -the same level as the guest laundry and housekeeping.I called reception to ask for towels for the swimming pool, she said I had to go to "level two" and pick it up from housekeeping. When I went there, no one was there, but there was a maintenance man who seemed to be just coming from the housekeeping direction, he was quite unfriendly - no smile, looked annoyed and when I asked him where I get the towels from and if it is housekeeping (this is on Monday 17 July) he rudely responded "housekeeping - when I didn't hear him properly I said "pardon" he seemed more annoyed and said "housekeeping"!, I went back to double-check that no-body was definitely there, and there wasn't ..so I went to leave after hanging around for nearly 10 minutes, just as I was reaching the lift to leave, another man in uniform was coming towards me. So I asked him and he nodded his head back towards housekeeping, he wasn't that friendly either, but then a lady came and thank goodness she was friendly! She gave me a piece of paper to sign with my room number and then gave me pool towels. I left with a feeling of relief and disbelief - haha! Anyway, I just thought maybe these guys were having a "bad day" - who knows! The next day, I called housekeeping to ask for replacement pool towels and the lady said, sorry you have to come and get it from housekeeping. (When we first checked in we only had two bath towels in the room, even though four guests were registered, so I called reception to ask for two more towels to be sent up to our room at which they arranged efficiently - so I just assumed I could do the same with the swimming pool towels). On the day of check out, I received a knock at the door from a housekeeping maid, it was 1030 am and our check-out time wasn't until 12pm. The maid asked me if we were checking out, when I told her yes - she looked impatient as though I should have already checked out. I was already expecting her to knock and was prepared to ask for four replacement bath towels and when I did, she abruptly responded "don't you have towels?" when I replied that we used them last night when we showered before bed and they are still really wet, she looked at her her colleague and spoke in Filipino and reluctantly gave me only two towels (whilst still looking at her colleague) - even though I asked for four. I gave up, took the towels and couldn't be bothered. Two of us just "dried" ourselves with wet towels.The hotel room is very older style, old hotel. The fridge had an off-smelling smell (like old fish). We had two double beds in the room, air con was great. We had a balcony. No table and chairs. It had a microwave. The location is near Hard Rock Café, about a 12-15 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Has a coffee shop below, when we asked for our croissant to be "toasted" they microwaved it. There is a mini-supermarket below the hotel as well. Parking is first-in-first serve and cost us $26 per 24hrs. I noticed there were ashtrays on the tables in the swimming pool area as well. Not quite sure if smoking was permitted or not or if it was a non-smoking/smoking designated hotel... just noticed the ashtrays - that's all.Our overall experience was nice, we had some friendly and attentive staff, 'grumpy' staff, and 'stone-faced' staff... overall we had a nice time and we got a good last-minute rate and the stay was still practical, only I wish the pool wasn't opened and closed for such a short time - especially during summer break.

Arrived in Honolulu at 10:30PM, and on a business trip to Molokai the next day for a 8AM flight. A very short stay for $150, and then to arrive at hotel to be charged a "resort amenity fee" for a place that isn't even a resort. I told them I was staying for just hours, and won't be using the "resort's" many fabulous pools and water slides and poolbar grottos (just kidding...they have none of that. Well, the pool dies close at 7PM, but I never saw it anywhere) and they advertise in a flyer the desk gives you that the fee includes "Cutting edge wifi" which is BS because all hotel wifi's are the same unless youre stupid enough to buy higher speeds above the comp wifi found in most hotels. Anyway,the elevator was dated and scary...and I got to my room which reminded me of a cell block. Disgusting bathroom. And a view of...they alley down below and the building next door. I could hear traffic, but I couldn't see anything resembling a view at night of Waikiki. Spend a few extra bucks and buy into a hotel with better facilities.

We recently stayed at the Ambassador with my wife's parents. We had dirty sheets and and ants and her parents had roaches in the bathroom. The staff was slow to offer even an apology and accused us of being dirty and leaving food out. We didn't eat or bring food to the rooms. This possibly the worst hotel in Hawaii I've been to after years of visiting the islands.

Good location, good front desk staff. The place is really tired, Needs new paint and carpet. Be careful with the free bikes, the one I used was way past its expiration date. Also be aware that prices in Hawaii are really high. There is a kitchen in most rooms but it just takes up space and was on no value to us.

The Ambassador Hotel is a little out of the way; it's a roughly a 10 minute walk to the beach and about a 20 minute walk or longer to Kapiolani Park and the Honolulu Zoo. Service was mediocre, but our room was clean. The pool is small and we couldn't find any pool or beach towels so we had to buy some. The gym is also very small and basic. The kitchen in our room was really great, with a fridge, stove, microwave, sink, etc. And there is a station with free filtered water near the lobby that is very convenient. Parking at the hotel was pretty expensive- $26/night, and there is no valet. There was also a $20/night resort fee that was an extra charge.

We had a night here as the holiday inn express was booked out for the last night of our holiday and this was across the road. A stark change from one to the other except the price which was very similar. The room was old and dated, looked like it hadn't been renovated since the 1970's. The room was clean to the cleaning staffs credit, the beds felt cheap, there was paint peeling off doors and cupboards and we had big moths annoying us at night. Good for people that are not fussy and on a budget though I would rather pay a little more to get a lot more. When we checked out at 4.45 am there were plumbers working in the ceiling above the front fixing what may have been water leaks, nice.

We stayed here recently when we had to make a last minute trip to Honolulu for family reasons. The staff was friendly and attentive, but the room was a disaster. I actually took pictures because I didn't think anyone would believe me. The bathroom door was coming apart (literally), the wall paint was peeling, the carpet was worn to the underlayment on the edges, and the grout in the bathroom was discolored (black) in many areas. The tile on the bathroom floor was coming up as well.This is an OLD property. In addition to the room rate, you pay a $20/day "resort fee" for amenities typically provided for free in a 3 star facility. Think twice before booking here. If you do end up here, stay away from room 522.

You get what you pay for... Poor customer service. No service with "Aloha" ...Defensive staff...The hotel room, facilities and structure aint no 5 star accommodation... that is to be expected due to the age of the building... HOWEVER with the amount of hotel guests and guests to Waikiki both traveling and In-State you would think they would be "Ambassadors of Hawai`i and Aloha"? NOPE!Problem... #1 Management's lack of customer service and service with Aloha... this lack trickled down to the shift leaders and receptionist. They spoke to us irregularly from the point of check in.Management and staff LACK proper service with aloha...1. Come and take my class at KCC, I offer my services and would gladly teach you "service with Aloha".2. Ask the Native Hawaiian Hospitality Association for help. They have training classes all the time.3. Ask the Hawai`i Tourism Authority for assistance as well.

The hotel is cheaper than the ones in Waikiki but it's also not fancy. If you just need a place to sleep then this isnt a bad choice. It has a general store and a coffee stand out in front. There's a microwave, full refrigerator, plates, utensils and stove but it's old and the shower stall is small so if you're a plus size you would have a hard time. It does have AC and parking in their lot is $25.

I spent two weeks in Hawaii (one week on Oahu and one week on Kauai). We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon. I was promised a beach view room and they messed that up. However they did give me a nice suite room to make up for it. It had a huge living room, a nice kitchen, and decent bathroom. Overall the staff was nice and professional and it was a short walk from Waikiki Beach. On the other hand, the hotel was very old and extremely crowded. The elevator seemed like it was on its last legs as well. It's a decent place to stay at for one night but do not plan your honeymoon around this hotel. Then again, you might just want to avoid Waikiki altogether. Too many tourists and too much traffic.

Not bad in total, if you think the cost performance is your priority matter. Facilities are old and the number of the room with the partial ocean view is limited. You need 10-minute-walk to the beach. However, the hotle has 3 laundry machines and the nice coffee shop opens from 7:00 to 17:00. There are two ABC stores near the hotel and the Whalers is just 5-meter distance. Most of the hotel staff are friendly (well, some are not).Please choose the room with the kitchenette. Food Pantrys and Coco Cove are in the walking distance.

Older buildings in Hawaii are being demolished because they are past their use by date. The Ambassador is way overdue for this. We were told it is clean, comfortable and central. Not quite the whole story. Air Conditioner could not be used because of the noise and a plug of what looked like dust/dirt flew out when we turned it on. Lifts were so slow we thought we might get trapped in them. Some people asked to be moved because of the construction noise from other sites and it isn't central to anything.The worst of the place was the staff. Totally unhelpful, especially when we enquired where we would be picked up for our tour. Booked through a travel agent before we left home, they told us to contact them for our pick up location. The best part of the stay was when we left. DON'T listen to your travel agent about this place...they must be getting a commission to book you in here, or they don't like you. This photo of the side of the fridge tells the story. Shabby!

Do not be fooled by the pictures as we were. We were not expecting luxury but functionality as we were just spending one short night before flying to a different island. Arriving at the hotel at 11:00pm and leaving at 7:00 a.m. We booked two queen beds for 2 adults and 2 children. When we arrived our room had 3 single beds. When we inquired about this they reported they can not guarantee the beds that are requested. So essentially 1 person did not have a place to sleep. We were told there were absolutely no other options. After pointing out to the staff how ludicrous this was they told us to wait up in our room and they would find something else for us. Somehow the penthouse opened up! Again do not be fooled by "penthouse". It was just a larger version of the same run -down version of the single bed room. As we were trying to problem solve, at the front desk, a group of young people walked through with one of their pals draped across the shoulders of another looking half passed out while another friend held a barf bag for this individual to puke in -Disgusting. There was no parking available to us so we had to park on the street and have our vehicle moved by 7:00 a.m. If this was my only accommodation option I would not visit this island!

Well-located budget hotel that earns 3 stars for its staff, service and comfortable beds. Yet it falls short because the bathrooms simply need renovations to regain the cleanliness I expect for a solid score. It has potential and seems to be trying but has to make some capital investments to earn a stronger recommendation from me.

We spent three nights here. POSITIVES: friendly helpful staff, easy parking, 1/4 to 1/2 mile from Beach and Duke's Restaurant, okay beds.NEGATIVES: without AC running could smell mold, no space in bathroom to put anything down, shower really small and shower head dirty, AC vents dirty, $25 per day parkingI booked this for myself and husband plus addition room for friends. Embarrassed

I booked this hotel online from Australia directly to the hotel where we were charged for the 'resort' fee at the time of booking and then again when we arrived and despite sorting this with the front desk before leaving i know discover they have charged me again I have sent 3 emails to the hotel and not one response Very disappointing as i know have to spend more time and money to call them to try and sort the issue.Be wary that this does not happen to you as it did to a number of customers whilst we were there

My husband and I stayed in one of the rooms on 11th floor. We were very happy to have a nice view from the patio and the cozy guest room. It is an old hotel building and not like a super-clean or state-of-the art stuff around. However, it is close to Ala Moana shopping center and takes 10-15min to downtown on foot. Besides,Julia,who cleaned our room every day was so much helpful even though we made a little mess in the kitchen. She is a very hardworking lady and gave us a big smile whenever we saw her in the hallway. Staff members at the front desk were also very kind,friendly and helpful. When we realized that the window to the patio in our room was jammed and told a staff member about it,she sent someone right away and had him fixed it. We also would like to thank another lady staff at the front desk who checked the name of our maid for us.We stayed at Trump and felt everything was extremely expensive so we wanted to stay somewhere cheaper this time. If you look for somewhere casual and cheaper,I definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed here the whole time while visiting Honolulu. Close to Pearl Harbor and lots of shopping downtown in Waikiki. Perfect location for all the action, BUT the room was so out dated. Its was my husband, myself and our daughter and the room consisted of 3 single (bunk) beds. They were so uncomfortable we didn't sleep good for 3 nights. The shower was so small my husband could hardly fit. The room had a tiny frig and nothing else. I would no stay here with a family because there is no room for everyone. If your on a budget and just need a place to crash for the night then this is your hotel. This hotel didn't offer any coffee, breakfast or anything. I travel a lot and the price I paid for this room ....the hotel should have been more than a 2 star rating. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

Hotel is older. Our room was simple but had a large fridge, kitchen area. Laundry and gym with free weights on 2nd floor. Lots of parking for your rental car, for extra charge. If you want a nice hotel with ambiance for a couples getaway, look elsewhere. If you are on a trip with your buddies and need convenience, great location at a decent price then go with this one. Wifi was also surprisingly fast.

Although the hotel is little outdated it still has some great qualities. To start, when you check in everyone in your party gets a refillable water bottle and there is a filling station on the first floor. Also located on the first floor are restrooms, a game room and the business center. They have coin operated laundry on site and a gym. Most of our rooms had kitchenettes and full size fridges. You can get dish soap from housekeeping. We had a large group (99 people). The staff was pleasant and helpful. They also have a pool which the kids did enjoy. Most of the restaurants we wanted to go to we could walk to in around 30 minutes. I felt like we were pretty centrally located. Close to public transportation and you can also use Uber or Lyft.

We had a group of over 100. Most of them were high school age. The hotel accommodated us without too many problems. The bathroom could use a good scrub and repainting. The shower head had to be tightened up by us to work correctly. There was an alarm that shook us awake at 5 am on our first morning. Sirens, recording blasting "there is an emergency please exit the building do not use elevators or take suitcases". Apparently a trash shoot fire?? Who knows because there was only a maintenance man walking around the parking lot. Everyone else seemed confused and unaware. Couple of blocks off the beach. No breakfast. But there is a small store on the corner and a snack bar type place. Parking is available for $28 per night. Do NOT take taxis parked next to motel. Ask them to call one for you. I learned that the hard way. Free bikes for 2 hours a day until 6 pm was a nice perk. Pool looked fun but never had time. It's what I would call budget in Waikiki.

We enjoyed everything about the ambassador hotel and resort. You could go out back and go snorkeling and several other activities on the property. Great swimming pool my family and have drinks by the pool all-around good time.

I recently stayed 4 nights at the Ambassador Hotel in Waikiki. The staff was outstanding (a 4+), but the room was a different story. the room was clean, but the condition was very poor, not just dated. The kitchenette appliances were rusty, the walls had chips in the plaster and were repainted with a color that did not match the rest of the wall. The paint on the front door was peeling, and the furniture was chipped and broken. All in All I would not call this place a hotel, it was more like a old highway motel. On top of it they charge $20 a night resort fee. This place has no business calling itself a resort.If you are on a budget and have very low expectations then this is a place for you. The location is good, very close to high end shopping, good food, and a ten minute walk to the beach.

Great choice for budget hotel in Ohau. I make the reservation for 1 triple room from booking.com with 3,800 bht/night (3 beds). Hotel price in Hawaii are quite high so this is the best chioce I got at that time.I'm quite happy with my 4 nights stay here. The room is not bad.They provide free water.Good wifi all areas. Swimming pool and gym at the 3rd floor.The ground floor of the hotel has coffee shop, mini mart and ABC store in another bloc.From the hotel you can walk to Eggs 'n Things Flagship at Saratoga Road and this road is connect tothe center of shopping street in Honolulu. This hotel is not near the beach but it is quite convenient, you can use bus or trolly (extra pay) to go to the beach if you want.

I booked a short vacation package via Priceline.com to Honolulu with a hotel stay at the Ambassador hotel, Waikiki. I had enjoyed a previous stay at the hotel last year in a suite and decided to return. However, botched my hotel reservation and unbeknownst to me, I arrived at 11:30pm at the Ambassador hotel (during spring break) without a hotel reservation and all hotel rooms at Ambassador hotel were booked.Immediately, the night front desk manager, Monika, took charge of the disastrous event and without me knowing went to the back office to try to resolve Priceline's error. This is the reason why I had returned to the Ambassador hotel. It has excellent customer service. After 45 minutes of me and the front desk talking to Priceline, I was booked into another nearby hotel.Monika directed me to a comfortable location in the lobby to make phone calls and even called a cab to deliver me safely to my new destination. As a solo female traveler, I was treated like family by all at front desk. At the time, I was tired, sleepy and upset after a 5 1/2 hour flight that was delayed. Monika quickly and politely handled and resolved the issue quickly for which I am eternally grateful. Oh, and I might add, she did all this while wearing a foot brace. Ambassador, please duplicate MONIKA!!!!! Her care, concern and ability to anticipate my needs was soooooooo appreciated!!!!! I wish I could have hopped over the desk to give her a hug for helping me. There's nothing like being stranded after midnight only to find a caring person. I will return to the Ambassador hotel just to thank her again!!!! Ambassador clone Monika!!!!!! She is an invaluable asset to your team.

My room was spacious and clean and all the gadgets and appliances (the room had a kitchenette) worked. The mattress was much softer than I like but not lumpy. Nice location too. There was no radio in the room, nor was there a music station on the cable TV, but with mostly dependable WiFi it was easy to connect with an online radio station. The hotel attracts guests, like me, with its low prices and then makes up for this by assessing a daily "use of amenities charge" of US$20. With a nice list of amenities you might think you’ll get your money’s worth but I didn’t. The Fitness Center is small (no surprise here), the bicycles for guest use are subject to a strict daily limit of 2 hours ($5 per hour over), and the unlimited Hawaiian drinking water is filtered tap water coming from 3 dispensers located next to the lobby that apparently have not been changed in a long time. The flow of water from the 2 functioning taps came out slow and tasted like pipes. I discovered that hotel staff instead get their water from the dispenser in the fitness center which I am sure has a fresher filter based on the better taste and faster flow. Would I go back? Dunno… But, the location is convenient and I did make great use of my daily allotment of bike time (appointments, shopping, etc.).

HISの激安ホテルプランで宿泊。ホノルルは何回も来ていますが、今回が初めての宿泊です。＜部屋＞13階のトリプルルームに宿泊。ベッドが３つあり、広さもよかったですが、汚かった。まず入ってすぐに明かりをつけたらゴキブリ！ゴキブリとそのゆかいな仲間たちです。まずは駆除しました。風呂場にもゴキブリを駆除した後（壁に足だけがのこっていた・・・。）もあり、本当に気持ちが悪かったです。風呂場は換気が悪いのでかなり湿気ているのにクローゼットが風呂場にあって不思議でした。新しいトイレットペーパー（紙で包まれている）を開けたらゴキブリが入っていました。ので外に速攻捨てました。冷房の音は本当にうるさくてつけて寝れません。4月だったので、窓を少し開けて寝ました。もちろん網戸がないので虫がまた入ってくるのを覚悟で。換気扇？が部屋にもあり、うるさくて寝れません。そこにほかの方もかいてありましたが、タオルや紙を置いて寝ました。もちろん安いホテルなので、コーヒーやお茶はおいてありませんが、湯沸かし器はありました。冷蔵庫もあり。コップもガラスのものがありましたが、気持ちが悪く使いませんでした。＜WIFI>無料でパスワードをくれますが、パスワードいれなくても使えました。＜洗濯機＞ここの洗濯機は比較的安かった。5ドル以内で洗濯から乾燥までできました。＜駐車場＞25ドルです。しかし、満車だから別のパブリックパーキングを利用してくれといわれました。アイランドコロニーか、ワイキキゲートウェイの向かいにあるパブリックパーキングです。出し入れできませんが、12時間以上で25ドル程度です。＜客層とエレベーター＞エレベーターは本当にぼろかった。いったん止まりそうになったりして怖かった。客層も悪い。パーティーをしている若者がたくさんいます。誰かベランダからバケツで水をこぼし、車にかけるいたずらをしていました。もちろん車には人が乗っています。口論になっていました。夜、夕食から戻ると、ホテルの前にパトカーが停まっていてホテルスタッフと話していました。なにかあったみたいです。セキュリティ上、問題がありそう。＜従業員＞本当に失礼な従業員がいます。Cathyという人です。彼女は明らかに観光客を小ばかにしているし、英語ができない客には一方的に無礼な態度をとります。まぁホノルルだし、観光客はどんな態度をとってもいくらでも来るし、構わないんだと思います(笑)日本人の方の評価を見るといいみたいですが、私にはどこがいいのかさっぱりわかりませんでした。もう二度と安くても利用はしません。I was staying here for 2 nights and it was horrible. Once I opened the door, Room 1311, there were some roach. It was disgusting. Also the staff named Cathy was very rude enough to discriminate Chinese customer saying "NO CHINESE NO CHINESE!" when the Chinese customer was asking her in Chinese. Well I do not expect her to understand Chinese but I guess she should not reply "No Chinese!" well I am not Chinese but I felt offended. She was quite rude to me as well.This hotel is very reasonable price for Honolulu, therefore the customer service does not have to be perfect or "standard". I know that. I will definitely not come back to this hotel. Thanks for reading.

I arrived on April 4,2017 and checked into my room this is not a four-star hotel but it is clean the, bed is comfortable,staff is great it is in the middle of everything walking distance to everything you have the bus you can get on it, $35 for a four day pass you can get on and off as many times as you want within the four day. They do have a kitchen with a full-size refrigerator, stove with an oven, microwave laundry is on the second floor they do have a pool on the second floor and a gym. You are also close to the biggest mall on the island and you also have the international mall which is within walking distance. All the high-end stores that you like is here. There are restaurants everywhere prices are not bad depending on what you want to eat.
