review_body: I've stayed at the Ambassador more than once. The first few times I stayed, the rooms were clean and the customer service was outstanding. But this last stay is beyond any words that can describe the experience I had. Simply put, I will find another place next time. I'm sure my list of business doesn't affect them at all. But being a local descent to Hawai'i, that hospitality was not all about the Aloha that we practice.

The room was clean, in decent condition and quite comfortable. The view was to the garage of the hotel next door. The service we got wasn't exactly friendly. Not far from rude to be honest. The location of the hotel is rather convenient but quite far from the beach. That wasn't an issue for us. There are great views from the upper floors.

The two of us stayed from Feb 5th. to the 11th. Our room was on the 17th. floor and had a nice view of the ocean. The open hallway just outside our room offered great views of the mountains and ocean as well. All staff we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. It would be nice if the pool deck was non-smoking like the rest of the hotel. The price was reasonable for Waikiki and the room we had was basic but bright and clean. The on-duty managers, front desk staff, housekeeping, and maintenance crew were all very welcoming and pleasant. The location was great, just far away enough from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but close enough to easily walk to it. Just across the street is a park with a winding pathway to the beach. A 5 to 10 minute walk landed us on a nice stretch of beach that was not nearly as crowded as the main beach area of Waikiki. From there you can rent kayaks, beach chairs, and other things if you choose. There is a bus stop just out front of the hotel which was convenient for going to the shopping center and other places. We highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great location and are looking forward to going back again next year.

We stayed here is 2013 and LOVED it. It is not a fancy resort hotel, its more like an old school motel but its SUPER clean and walking distance to all of the main attractions and trollies. We loved it. We especially loved the hand held shower head because we could easily clean sand off of our feet. The hotel had full size kitchen and balcony so it really felt like a studio apartment for the week we were there. It was very safe and quiet as well. Would definitely stay there again.

The hotel is priced well in comparison to the local market. Many of the rooms that I have been given, could use a refresh. Often takes a while to air the room once you arrive. Staff are consistently excellent and extremely helpful. From my perspective, I was offered a less than satisfactory room, the hall carpet was a murky colour of dirty and the door had to be physically slammed to shut it (hard to leave quietly in the morning). The TV suffered from intermittent problems, I called the front desk, an engineer came and left, the problem still occurring. I discovered the problem was a faulty power bar and bypassed it. I have referred other guests to the hotel, and stayed a number of times - yet, do not feel that any effort went into respecting this. Given that the price difference for neighbouring properties is not that much more. I suspect that i will be trying other locations - perhaps ones that respect returning guests.

I booked this hotel for my sister and I when we were visiting and I was nervous at first. I had never been to Hawaii before and just through word of mouth found out that in Honolulu it is common to pay for parking everywhere you go. The location is not to far from downtown Waikiki just make sure you ware tennis shoes to walk the beach and shops. Rooms were the basics and I believe I got what I paid for. Staff was friendly and helpful with all our questions and the parking fee is worth it. The reason I gave this a 4 out of 5 is because of the bathroom. The shower was in desperate need of repair as the grout was chipped away throughout the whole shower. It just gave it an unclean feeling. We had a city view option with our room and it was great for look out we ended up leaving our blinds open when we were in the room because of the view available.

It is slightly dated but it was fine, very noisy in the wind on the higher floors. Lifts did sometimes take ages. No bar or restaurant was a big disappointment $20 per day amenities fees is a bit of a joke really for most people this is just for wifi

I agree with everyone else that this hotel is "vintage" or "rugged." Haha... And it's definitely not the nicest hotel I've stayed in; however, it was clean, which is my most important requirement. It was also budget-friendly as I'm still a student. And my room had a killer view!!!! Additionally, the staff, especially Amanda, the manager, was exceptionally kind and helpful. I appreciated the filtered water being offered in the lobby and the business center, but didn't love the very short pool hours (10am-7pm) and the tiny counter top in the bathroom that made it difficult to get ready in the morning. Other than that, no complaints. :)

Staff are great - absolutely no issue with them! Ripper view from the 18th floor despite being so far back from ocean. This was a nice surprise! Facilities need to be updated, we had two room and fridges were old and rusty, cupboards didn't close properly etc. It looks like they are renovating the hotel one room at a time, they were working quite early in the morning which woke us up ~8am.

I booked this through Priceline, which advertises it as a three-star. I didn't know the name of the hotel before paying, which is basically their business model. Big mistake on my part. I'm not picky. I've stayed in plenty of two-star hotels, and they've been fine. Motel 6, Super 8, etc. They're not the nicest, but The Ambassador ranks below them. What you'll find is a run-down, deteriorating property. Cinder block walls, chipped paint on the cabinets and severe water damage in the bathroom--a rusty light switch and linoleum that's falling apart. Don't expect a parking spot. Yes, parking is at a premium in Waikiki, and you'll pay for it no matter where you stay, but this property does not have enough spaces for its guests. I stayed three nights, and they always said "We are completely sold out."So, they direct you to a neighboring hotel, which is about a 15 minute walk--not fun in the rain. They also say it'll cost you $20, which is untrue. It's $20 for the guests of that hotel, not guests of the Ambassador. When I asked the parking attendant, he said "Yeah, they always tell people that." Granted, it's only a $5 difference, but it's the principle of being lied to by your hotel. Oh, and I couldn't even call the Ambassador ahead of time to ask if there were any spaces available. All I got was a busy signal, for three days straight. The hotel desk told me it was a "problem with the Hawaii phones," but every other business didn't seem to have any issues. If this was ranked as a two-star hotel, I might've not been too surprised, but it's not. I complained to Priceline, they said they base their ratings on those put out by other websites, and it's definitely three-star.It's not.

This is the 2nd time I've stayed at this hotel, the first being nine years ago. I booked the hotel primarily for its location and the price as I was in Honolulu to attend a conference. I was not disappointed. The Ambassador is not a 5 Star resort that opens straight onto the beach front and offering a million things to do, see, eat or buy. The decor has seen better days and there is clear signs wear and tear in the rooms. However the Ambassador is clean and comfortable and considering its location - great value for money. The pool is clean with comfortable seats, tables and parasols. There is also a business centre, small gym and laundry room. The staff were very friendly and ready to help with the few requests / information that I asked of them. My room was a kitchenette on the 18th floor and was perfectly fine for my needs. There was no table or seat on the balcony but that was no real hardship. The only small problem I encountered was being awoken by the cleaner at 8:15 am. I hadn't hung my 'do no disturb' sign outside, but I did think 8:15am was still a little early to be asked. The free wifi was very good and I ran three devices simultaneously without any problem whatsoever. Those hotel is located at the bottom of the main Waikiki strip, so 15-20 min walk will get you pretty much where most of the shops or restaurants in Waikiki are. The Ala Moana shopping Centre is about a 1km walk from the hotel, but there are also numerous busses that can take you there. There was also a tour guide desk in the lobby to assist with bookings to various locations around the Hawaiian Islands. I would have be hesitation in staying at the Ambassador Hotel again. My advice is think about what you want from your hotel, if you want a straightforward, friendly, clean place then you won't go far wrong with the Ambassador.

We arrived in Honolulu early morning and were able to get an early check in and a car park for our 15 seater van. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Free water bottles and access to water machine. Rooms a bit dated but clean and great location, close to main shopping on Kalakaua Ave. lots of eating places a short walk away. Dairy right next to front reception and coffee place. Kitchenette in all 3 rooms we booked. Balcony with each room as well. This Hotel was well priced for our group of 11 people. Free wifi was great!

Great friendly staff. That's all I have for a positive. And I feel sorry for the brave face they have to put on.It really is a run-down place, and we spent one night and left. See attached photos.Management: spend some money. Your staff are the only thing keeping you afloat. The hotel should be condemned in its current state. Disgraceful.

It's not what expected, although the employees were very nice the room was pretty average. The kitchen cupboards smelt and the taps were just bad. Also had to go to the lobby anytime we wanted filtered water, that's why they gave us plastic bottles to fill up. There were also extra charges to for use of amenities such as the gym, pool, laundry. Some of which we didn't even use. In total $125 extra which should be included in the overall price of the hotel.

We are just about to leave this hotel after a 16 night stay. It was our first time to Hawaii and I fully researched all the hotels around Waikiki before booking the Ambassador. Yes, as previous reviews have stated, it is an older hotel and some of the paint is peeling and the air conditioners are definitely noisy (but they work really well and you do get used to them). We definitely had a few glitches: extra bed requested wasn't great and we requested an additional mattress that was more supportive; we didn't have enough plates and cutlery for all of us in our kitchenette; our toilet blocked 4 times and we had a change of fridge twice. Having said all of that, all of these issues were handled with expediency and apologies for any inconvenience (which was really minimal). This demonstrates how amazing the staff are here - absolutely nothing is too much trouble and their helpfulness knows no boundaries. Our particular favourite is Chue who is the Director of front of house. This guy went above and beyond by helping with routes for places we wanted to visit, researching Christmas Day restaurants that would be open and researching gluten free eateries for me, to name just a few. Coming back to the hotel and being greeted by him made it feel like home for the duration of our stay :-) so if you want a hotel at a reasonable price, within walking distance to the main strip of Waikiki, where the rooms have a kitchenette (which is really helpful with Waikiki prices to help keep costs down) and the beds are clean and comfortable AND you get free (great) wifi (a definite hit with the kids!) then the Ambassador is definitely worth a stay! Also the amenity fees that a few people have mentioned are standard in every other Hawaiian Hotel - I know because I checked before booking!

Stay here 2 nights for work, couldn't sleep that well because the aircon is so loud. Looks closer to the beach than it actually is. The 'Facilities Taxes' are ridiculous. When you pay for the room you should get everything.

Do not go here. The staff are friendly and nice but it is in a gross neighborhood and the hotel is absolutely disgusting. Had to change rooms because the first one was so bad. We got there at almost midnight after a long day of travelling and changing rooms was not something we wanted to do. Smelled terrible, all the furniture is decrepit, cracks in the brick prison-esque walls. Looked down the hallway and felt like i was in a prison. Plus a surprise $20 a night recreation fee and they hold $100 of your money for security damages. They give you refillable water bottles when you check in to fill at a station in the lobby because i guess the water in the hotel isn't safe to drink. Wifi was slow at night but picked up in the morning. Connection is spotty depending where you are. Resort fee but no breakfast. Trust me when i tell you do not stay here if you are used to anything better than living in squalor. Just read the reviews and go elsewhere. Wish i took more pictures to show more. Don't trust their website. Terrible experience would not recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy. Should be reported for fraudulent advertising.

I stay at the Ambassador every time I go to O'ahu (anywhere from 4 - 10 times a year). It is reasonably priced, clean, convenient, and the staff is top notch. The only problem I have with the hotel is that parking is limited and if there is no parking available, it is a hassle to park on the street or at a nearby hotel. Other than that, this place is the best!

Upon checking into the hotel, i requested if it's possible to swithch one of my rooms to a suite if it was available due to my elderly parents needing to be accompany by my sister to assist and look after them. The receptionist (Emelyn) withou hesitation got right on it and work diligently to find an available suite for me! She not only found me a suite, but she also gave us a "valet parking" stall that was right in the front of the front door to the hotel so that my elderly parents did not have to walk far to get to our vehicle. She also gave my parents a beach view for their enjoyment. What a blessings she was not only to myself, but to my parents. I explained all of this to my parents after checking into our rooms, and they were in tears and saying; "Thank god there are still good people in the world still"! God bless that lady's (Emelyn) soul for her good heart! So thank you to your hotel and especially to Emelyn for all she did to accomodate our stay! God bless your establishement and may it keep on prospering in helping people! To God be the glory. We will always return to the Ambassador Hotel for our future visits to the State of Hawaii.

Love the location friendly accommodating only issue was the security of the doors in the room... lock has issues and air conditioning had a few issues but that got fixed right away so it was comfortable.

This hotel has been neglected and my suspicion is the owner only cares about ripping off customers whilst giving little in return. Cons$20 a night rip off resort fee. This bogus charge is just used to bump up room rates. It's a flat out con. Maintenance is appalling. My front door needed enormous effort just to open. Then the shower drain was blocked so I showered in ankle deep water. Then the hotel's electrical wiring caused a fire alarm which in turn caused a complete evacuation of the hotel at 10:00 pm at night. Fire trucks, police the whole circus. ProsThe location is fair. Not great but it's a $7 Uber fare to Waikiki Beach. A fish rots from the head down and this hotel views its clients as Dollar signs not valued guests. They take no pride in their hotel or their management. It's just a real estate cash cow for them.

We had a city view room w/ kitchen, room was perfect fit for our family.. Amenities they offer are excellent! Short walk to Waikiki beach.. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful.. Cheap for location too..

If you intend buying a lot of grocery food whilst on holiday , suggest you walk to Walmart (20 mins) as this is a lot cheaper than the Food Pantry (10 min) or ABC stores (1 min). The near new updated kitchen in our room was very workable and saved money .....we ate out every second night !

We were very surprised of the affordability of the rooms for 5 people. The staff was very pleasant, and friendly to work with. They did a great job in finding us a great room and bringing us a baby crib. Great parking and location to Waikiki.

Like that hotel is away from the congestion of Waikiki and Hotel Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Our sons enjoyed the view and the convenience of preparing their vegan meals instead of dining at restaurants. Thank You.

The room was great and the workers gave us good service but my problem was the iternet access. I couldnt work as fast as i wanted because the internet was to slow. I had to work with my laptop every day.

The Ambassador Hotel Waikiki is an older aged hotel with so many great benefits. There is a Full Kitchen with dining ware, cooking equipment and ample cabinet space. We enjoy choosing this hotel as one of our staycation favorites because of the affordable rates and "at home" feel. The staff at check in was very friendly and accommodating. Some of the amenities listed were not available. The air conditioner drains into a 5 gallon bucket and was filled to the top. Otherwise, we were extremely satisfied with our choice of the Ambassador Hotel as our 33rd Anniversary staycation hotel. There were a variety of dining and entertainment locations within walking distance which made for a very nice, romantic stroll.

I initially I was checked into a room that had some carpet odors and after advising the front desk, they were very helpful in re-issuing another room for me without any hassle. The second room issued to be was perfect.

review_body: We liked Ambassador Hotel, because it had large apartments with clean and functional facilities. The room were clean albeit basic and in need of renovation. Kitchen was functional and clean. All the utensils were spotless.Nice TV which was recently installed.Location is excellent...bus stop outside the hotel which takes you to central Honolulu, but if you walk the back streets you will be there in 20/25 mins. Waikiki beach is 10 mins walk away.Only a couple of negatives: The Wifi which is free had to be refreshed all the time which became frustrating.The additional money for the resort fee.....which we did not use was somewhat hard to swallow, especially on a budget. However, this is USA ....I am not use to this in Europe. I think we should be charged for what we use....it seems an unfair and unjust cost!

The staff was friendly and accommodating. Many of the other guests were Japanese and very polite which further enhanced the experience (now I want to visit Japan and other countries in Pacific area !). The room was good but not over done. Everything worked well and the a/c though a little noisy provided good service. Having a small kitchen area was very nice and worked well -- fridge, range, sink etc. Dont ask for balcony (upgrade), there is no outside furnishings such as a chair and the hotel's site situation gives views of mostly other concrete hotels and businesses. Plus the noise --- despite usual city noise, the room was very quiet when the balcony door was closed and even later in the night when the balcony door was open. The hotel is conveniently located -- immediately outside is a kiosk that serves convenient, quick and good food for breakfast and lunch and in between. The service is fast and young people running the business are polite and energetic. Good choices of drinks and coffee -- Kona coffee and very reasonable prices for everything. Also at the corner, next to the kiosk is a convenience store and another convenience store around the corner . Prices are quite reasonable, not the high prices I expected. The convenience stores close about midnight and the kiosk about 6pm. About 100 plus feet away from the hotel and across the street is a large park (approximately a city block plus size). You can walk thru the park to get to the beaches and strip of upgrade hotels i.e. the Hilton, the military Hale Kai, etc. So the Ambassador Hotel is a short walk to the beach areas, seemingly most beaches are behind the hotel areas. I only went to beach once and had friends at the Hale Koa so used that beach area. The hotel is also close to the shopping areas, only a few blocks away -- and close to the Trump Hotel (yep, there is one there too). Also, tour buses pick up is at a close by hotel (across the street around the corner, 1 minute walk !). The hotel's parking area seemed too small to accommodate large tour buses but airport pick-up and deliveries were seemingly often. Navigating through the hotel areas to get to the beaches should not be a problem but could be a challenge. (Ask a young surfer or hotel employee for a public entrance to the beach areas). Sorry, am not much of a beach person anymore.The hotel staff is there to serve you 24/7 and they were very helpful. So the Ambassador has good location, conveniences, friendly staff and clean rooms with all the comforts/amenities and give attention to security. I would certainly stay there again !

My parents stayed ambassador hotel waikiki recently and their service was unprofessional & unacceptable !! Front desk agent wasn't friendly at all and no hospitality. It was my parents anniversary and I clearly stated they are celebrating wedding anniversary on their reservation. however, of course no one at the hotel mentioned anything. It seems like this lady agent was just there to earn time for her pay check and nothing else. Every time I called hotel to connect me to their room, phone keep ringing and dropped every single time. So I called main reservationists and this was even worst!!!! The lady Therese had an attitude problem like she told me "you should call the hotel directly because they are not answering my call. They don't answer, so I can't do anything." And didn't even try to help me. Also spoke with supervisor Mira and she could only told me "I'm sorry ma'am . You should email the hotel to connect to your parents". I, myself work for hospitality business and we all learned customer service is very important and key for success. Try to put yourself as a customer and take care as you wNt people to treat you. I'm VERY disappointed by these multiple incidence and shame to work as a same hospitality business in hawaii. I'll never recommended any of my friends and family member to stay Ambassador hotel Waikiki in the future ever!!!!!! If you are thinking about booking this hotel because if the price, don't do it. It's really what you pay us what you get.

After reading others reviews on this hotel I was so worried it would be dirty and old.. Well I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived! My room was very clean and tidy. The room is basic, but it's very comfortable. The hotel also just installed new televisions in all the rooms so that was a bonus! The air con worked very well too! The hotel is in a great spot, it's within a short walking distance from all the main attractions and restaurants in Waikiki. The only thing I would say to be wary of was an extra $20 per night in gratuities we were surprised with upon check in, and parking is $23 per night. That being said I would definitely book this hotel again.

The hotel was good. The staff were friendly, everything was clean and everything worked. Didn't have any major issues. The only downsides being a slow lift and ordinary shower heads. Hotel was in a good location, about 5 - 10 min walk to beach

2 of us staying in the room we payed extra to get upgrade our room, we got into the room and it was very outdated with the furnishings.a lot of paint peeling on the walls of the bedroom and bathroom.Shower was the worst pressure and we had to hold the shower head up in order to shower.Great views from the balcony and free 2 hour hire of the bikes the hotel provides, only 1 incident when the bikes handlebars went very loose and i had to hold them up went str8 back to the hotel and the guy on the front desk fixed them str8 away and we were back on our way exploring this beautiful city. Staff were extremely helpful and were only too happy to have a chat and let you know of some must see sights

Well located for just about all activities and the pool was very refreshing. Very economical with kitchenettes available. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Discounts available the closer to arrival time.

As prior reviews have stated, the room we had, looked nothing like the photos on the website. Nowhere near! BUT - we were mistakenly put on the 5th floor which is not what we paid for. We were upgraded to a room with a partial ocean view on the 7th floor. The hotel manager also sent us 2 boxes of chocolates and an apology letter because of their mistake. And it was much appreciated!We spent 1 night in that room as the hotel was booked out but we upgraded the next day and spent the next 15 days there. The rooms are very basic but were very clean and we noticed that the beds were new and so the matresses were very comfortable. Which is what you need after a long day of sight-seeing. And our room was cleaned everyday! They also did our dishes!.We hardly spent any time in the rooms during the day and only slept and showered there. We also slept in the lounge and left all the doors opened at night. It was amazing! We never needed the aircon at all. We also utilised the pool as my daughter loves the water so we also used the hotel beach towels! The free wifi was also a plus as we could keep in touch with family back home. There is a store right outside the hotel door and also a place to get coffee and breakfast bagels. There are great restaurants close by as well! The outside noise did not bother us at all. All the staff that we came into contact with were amazing! I would highly recommend this hotel. I also need to mention that the mountain view and the partial ocean view from our room was just stunning. Will book room 713 again!

After I booked my room I came across negative reviews about this hotel. Some of reviews mentioned cockroaches, bed bugs, uncomfortable beds, rude hotel staff, but my experience was nothing of the sort.My check-in went smooth and quick. My room was big, clean, bug free, and relatively quiet. My bed was comfortable, and I always had clean towels. The hotel staff were super friendly and warm, and upon checking out, the staff was more than happy to show me where to catch the bus to the airport. They supplied free parking for my scooter, and there was a coffee shop downstairs that was pretty handy. I have nothing but respect for islanders who work at Waikiki hotels having to put up with rude, demanding tourists. I couldn't have been happier with my stay at The Ambassador. Mahalo!

The Ambassador Hotel Waikiki is a wonderful place to stay. The view is fantastic and you are surrounded with so many things to do. The staff here is wonderful and very helpful and friendly. My room is awesome, I have a kitchen in the room and a fantastic view from the balcony.

For a few $ more a day, find a reputable hotel. Beware of the misleading photographs and descriptions on their website. There is no parking, evident of the faded sign that their lot is full. They'll send you down a block for $24 a day (more if you want to come and go). The rooms are dated, dirty, and disgusting. I cannot stress it enough, DO NOT STAY HERE!

Stayed here for 6 nights, attended a conference in the convention center. Hotel itself is old but mostly well maintained. We had a room with 2 bedrooms, and the couch in the main room turned into two more, plus a kitchen area. Nice view from the balcony, we had a room on the 9th floor. Possibly could have done with being a bit cleaner but on the whole it was alright. The air conditioners were very noisy, so we ended up just turning them off and sleeping with the sliding doors onto the balcony open. We had no hot water for one of the days we were there, but cleaning staff were friendly and attentive and on the whole the room was really nice and spacious, maybe just in need of a revamp, or a lick of paint. The hotel itself is in a great spot, 15 minutes walk from the middle of Waikiki, less than 10 to the Convention center in the other direction. Completely serviceable but don't book there expecting luxury.

My fiancé and I spent 9 nights at this hotel and the pictures on the website are very misleading. We got the partial kitchen ocean view, and the kitchen was disgusting. There was rust all over the refrigerator, the stove looked very dated and we were too scared to use the utensils. The shower in the bathroom was absolutely horrific. It was so dirty that we used shower shoes going into it, coming to find out the water doesn't drain properly and it would be so clogged it would be up to our ankles. On top of the hotel being very dirty, we booked the hotel with a king bed and got two double beds, and there was no parking. We had to park way down the street every night and it was $24.00 a night. So in addition to the pricy hotel (considering what you're paying for), we paid an extra $216.00 that we did not know we had to spend. I would not stay here again and I would discourage anyone else trying to stay here. It was a very disappointing first impression on Hawaii.

If this is your first and maybe only trip to Hawaii, you do not want to start out by your first impressions of this hotel. It's like a bad Motel 6. The rooms smelled musty to me. It is nothing like it looks on their website. The elevator shakes so bad you think it's going to die. The business center printer doesn't work and the beds are hard. We stayed there two weeks ago and would have moved to another hotel except there was a convention in town and not one room left within 25 miles. The only redeeming factor of this hotel is their staff. They are all very friendly and helpful. It's about a 20 minute walk to Waikiki beach. It does however have a bus stop by the front door and a coffee shop which is helpful, since this hotel doesn't offer you any breakfast of any sort.

I booked this hotel through Hawaiian Airlines thought I paid for everything be ready this hotel has hidden fees that will not be a part of Hawaiian Airlines and Hawaiian Airlines will not reimburse you back so bad on them! okay where to start the hotel room smells like musty the walls were cracked and Staind the shower was leaking the beds were so stiff they hurt my back and when they run out of parking because their parking lot is so small they won't help you park anywhere else so save some more money to pay for offsite parking worst experience ever Hawaiian Airlines you owe me on this one and I wish I could give them no stars because that's what they deserve!

My hubby and I spent 7 nights at Ambassador and have absolutely nothing to complain about it.Every time we go to Hawaii we really enjoy walk around and spend our days at the beach or shopping. For this reason we just need a nice bed and an average comfort. There's no luxury but you get what you pay. In my opinion it's an excellent hotel if you don't need a resort structure .The hotel offers bike for rent (2h free. If you need more time you pay $5/h).I would definitely recommend .

It was our first time in Hawaii and ambassador met our expectations. The room was a decent size and spacious. It does have a kitchenette, which we reluctantly used as it was not as clean as we would like. However, there are that many choices to eat in Hawaii we really didn't need the kitchen. The location is ok. It's a good 15 mins walk to the beach, but ambassador ticks all the marks if you want to go shopping in the luxury row as it is only 2 blocks down the road. Our stay was comfortable and we were happy with the service.

Yes this hotel has a very convenient location as it is close to the beach as well as many shopping areas and restaurants, but this is not enough to balance out the negative things. I had originally booked online with this hotel and had booked for 3 twin beds, but when we got to our hotel that evening, they had given us a room with 2 twin beds. This was one of the reasons why I had booked with this hotel because they had the option for 3 twin beds which not very many hotels had, but even though I had paid for it in advance, I still did not get what I originally booked for. When we went down to address this issue, they said they were fully booked and were not able to give us a different room and instead they would bring up a portable pull out bed.The hotel itself looks NOTHING like the beautiful pictures on the website. Everything looks very old and outdated, and the room and washroom itself looked pretty grimy. The air conditioning was broken in our room and we had to sleep in the heat that night. My brother had gone to complain the next day and they said they would send someone to come and fix it, but no one did. We complained a second time and not until our last night there did the air conditioning get fixed. The staff was accommodating with our questions for places to eat and even called a cab for us the morning we left for the airport. Based on our experience at this hotel, we will definitely not be coming back here.

Most people don't go to hawaii for the hotel accomodations. This was perfect for what we needed. If your goal is to spend a lot of time in the room on your vacation, this may not be for you.It is an older hotel that could use some updating. They are working on that as they put new Sony alarm clocks in the rooms this month, yes, I know it's a small upgrade. Parking is expensive at $26.18 per night if they aren't sold out. Street parking can be hard to find. If you use street parking read the signs, as we saw many cars being towed Monday morning. I wasn't able to get any of the business center computers to go online. Our room was clean and comfortable. I wish the beds were bigger, though. I found the staff friendly.There is a $20 convenience fee that is added to your bill per night, BUT that was included in the price I got from a third party website (booking.com).

I've stayed in pretty terrible hotels before but this place takes the cake.I should've known it wasn't going to be a pleasant experience when I walked in to the lobby and the staff were talking loudly with each other and ignoring me and two other ladies who were trying to check in. When I finally got the attention of the woman (who spoke terrible Japanese) she was nothing short of rude and dismissive, almost throwing my credit card back at me.Also, there is a hidden $20 "resort fee" per night per guest. This would be fine if it gave you access to things that mattered, but instead you get to use their game room (pointless), rent a bike for 2 hours (pointless), etc. Also if you want wifi access in your room you need to pay this. The Wifi is a joke though because it only allows one device to connect at a time so I couldn't connect with my laptop and phone which was a bit ridiculous if I'm paying $20 extra.There was also another woman at some desk over in the corner who was Japanese and would yell Japanese phrases at anyone Asian who walked in, even if they were clearly speaking English. The woman also spoke extremely casual Japanese to Japanese guests which shocked me and some others.Anyway I ignored these warning signs and went to my room. My room was in this dark corridor which freaked me out. But it was only later that I realized that this place was a disaster when I noticed the paint peeling everywhere, the dirty walls and handles on the cabinets, and the clearly unvacuumed floor.I tried to iron a shirt, only to find the iron was attached to the board, I had to drag the whole thing into the bathroom to fill it up with water. Also it was next to impossible to use due to the approximately 1-foot cord that it was held in place by.The bathroom itself was disgusting -- hair all over the place and scum on the walls.The lanai has no furniture so it's utterly pointless.The cherry on the cake was that I found at least 5 or 6 cockroaches during a two-day stay. Awful.Location is pretty good but it's at the beginning of the Waikiki strip, so you have to walk a ways to get where you're going usually. Conversely it makes walking to Ala Moana doable. I hope the staff cuts the useless stuff like ghetto game rooms and bikes with time limits that inhibit anyone from actually using them and use that extra $20 to get someone who can clean properly.

My son and I chose Oahu, Hawaii for our family vacation this year. After a failed reservation at another hotel , we opted to go to stay at the Ambassador Hotel in Waikiki. Upon our arrival , we were greeted by a very friendly set of front desk staff members that were gracious enough to allow us to check in a full hour early. Checking in was rather quick and easy and took no more than 5 to 10 minutes total. We were given an overview of the amenities at the hotel, which include a pool, a laundry room, a gym, a business center and a game room. Once in our room, I was a little surprised at the size of it. There were two full size beds in our room and we were staying on the second floor. From our balcony, we could see the entrance to the lobby into the parking lot below.The hotel is conveniently located about a two and a half to three block walk from Waikiki Beach and many shops and restaurants. Downstairs, outside of the lobby is a convenience store that came in handy plenty of times when we did not feel like going out for breakfast. On our first day there , we rented bikes from the front desk which is a courtesy service provided by the hotel. We rented the bikes for two hours and were not charged a late fee when we brought them back 6 minutes late which I appreciated. They also offer free Wi-Fi for each guest room.This place was great as it was just my 11 year old son and I but I would definitely recommend it for families with several members in their party. The beds were comfortable and the tv offers basic cable which provided some evening entertainment for my son and I after a long day out in the sun and at the beach. We didn't do any cooking but the kitchenette they have definitely would come in handy for anyone who plans to. We did use the refrigerator to store things. There is also a microwave available for use. It was rather cool that they also provide a set of dishes for anyone who may need to use them.All in all, I think that the Ambassador Hotel is a great hotel especially for the price and I would definitely stay there again and most likely will when I return to Waikiki.Aloha!

Stayed for our 25 wedding anniversary. Room had everything, frig, stove, oven, etc. Clean and comfortable room, pretty quiet too. There was even coin operated washers and dryers. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. Very reasonable too. Thanks Ambassador..

Spent 2 weeks in Oahu on a family holiday in August, we'd only been to Hawaii once before, so knew we wanted to be near to Waikiki Beach. We found the hotel on Booking.com, and paid a rather extortionate price for 2 rooms (we were a party of 6 so needed 2 rooms to accommodate us all) which seemed to be really nice when looking at the pictures online. However, upon arriving at the hotel, we were faced with even more charges ($20 per night per room just to use the wifi and swimming pool!!!!, and $25 a night to park your car!!!!). Then we went to drop our luggage off in our rooms before doing some sightseeing - what we were faced with were extremely dated looking rooms, tiles falling off the shower and grim looking walls and corridors. Safe to say they looked nothing like the photos on booking.com and the price definitely didn't reflect the quality and standard of the rooms. The positive side to our visit was the lovely, welcoming and friendly staff at reception. They were more than happy to help us and recommend places to visit and restaurants to eat at. So overall, the staff were wonderful at this hotel, but the price of the rooms was extortionate for what was actually provided.

One of the plus factors of our room was the spaciousness, it felt like twice the space as our cabin on the cruise. The pillows were good quality too. Some aspects of our room that were not so great, were, no vanity in the bathroom, i.e nowhere to put your toilet bag, and poor drainage of the shower, and very limited crockery and cooking utensils. The air conditioning unit had a very loud droning noise that can't be turned off but it did work. The room is enough to 'get by on' if you don't want to spend a lot for a 5 star hotel. The location is very good and close to the beach, like, 5 minutes walk and is close to the bus routes out to Pearl Harbour and Ala Moana, also Diamond Head.  Reception processed efficiently, and can cope with all hours. We went in the pool, it was fine, take the towels from your room. The cleaning of the room every day was very good. We were on level 10 so no noise at all. Also there is a big sign Ambassador running vertical on the side of the building, so if you get a little bit disorientated on your way home at night, you can find your hotel, which is quite a good thing.

I stayed in a few hotels in my lifetime. This hotel's rooms are run down. Remember to bring your own plunger and gum boots to shower. Our shower drained very slow and you are anckle deep in your own shower soup by the time you finish showering. Complained to the desk. Has send up somebody with a plunger but no improvement. Asked to change room but refused. Hotel was by far not full.As for security. The safe in your room is not even bolted down. Anybody can walk in and walk out with the whole safe. It is not that heavy.No chairs or any thing on the balcony where you can hang your wet swim gear. Had to pack it wet in my suitcase.Found a big cockcroach running over our bed when we arrived but after killing it did not see anymore. Maybe they can fly, don't know.Good location, but you will have to be satisfied with about nothing inside and not that cheap.

review_body: The hotel is one of the older ones in Honolulu, but the rooms are renovated and the staff is the best on the island. The rooms are large and have complete kitchens which is a big convenience and money saver. The staff treats you like family and will bend over backwards to make sure that your stay is a good one.

The price on Expedia was $109. The ultimate price was $171, and included $25 for parking and $20 for what was labled "amenities" though I never saw any amenities, unless you count a work out room. There was certainly no coffee maker. The wifi worked well, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the shower head was a decent height. The Ambassador is on the edge of Waikiki, and it's a long walk to the beach, though closer to shopping.

But if you need an affordable option that has 3 beds, this is your choice. The staff is super friendly-- they provide water bottles/bags for you at check-in, there are old bikes you can rent for free to cruise around, and the location is excellent.The elevators didn't work properly-- sometimes, if you wanted to get down to the lobby, it would take you all the way to the top floor, not open the doors, and then back down. Or weird stuff like that.Internet is slow, but mostly reliable.$20 daily amenity fee is not quite justified, since they're not a full resort, like the Hilton. But this is a common tactic by hotels to make their prices look better.

review_body: The Ambassador is an older hotel i the heart of Honolulu. It doesn't have a bar or restaurant but has full kitchen and large rooms. Rooms are serviced daily by lovely ladies and all staff very friendly and helpful and are very clean.

My partner and I travelled here in late August for 10 days. Getting a king bed room with a kitchenette.We flew in at 6am with our rooms not even ready yet and were told to come back at 1pmThen we got the keys to our rooms after 1pm and they sprung us with a "Amenity Fee" of $20 per person, per night! Finally get in our rooms and it smells damp (the hole time we stay), & if you plan on sleeping in, forget it! Everyday 2nd day at about 6/6:30am youl be woken up by rubbish trucks that sound like army tanks are having a war outside (not even exaggerating)

Do you think that if you search this hotel and it is one of the cheapeast you would say:... "nope ... it is not an option" ... On the contrary ... take a chance and enjoy it ... Clean facilities , espacious room for two and counts with kitchenette and all that things that you may need to cook in . Also has a balcony and if you are in the top floors you can get very good photos .The staff is very very friendly and helps you in almost everything . Near to shops and beach . Great and inexpensive option !!!!

This hotel wasn't amazing but it was good, nothing to over the top. Staff was friendly, and helpful with my bags. The pool was small but it is close to the beach and other things to do. Room service can't come to your room, you have to meet them in the lobby but there are lots of options.

Loved the place it was easy to get around town. Very central and not too far to walk to most places. One thing I was not happy with was the unexpected $20 per night amenities fee I was not prepared for as I had pre paid for all my booked hotels while in the US and no other has charged additionally for this. It was an enjoyable stay other wise Thank You

Finding accommodation in Waikiki in August for a family of four can be eye-wateringly expensive, especially if the exchange rate is working against you. The Ambassador provided us with a good solution. We shared two rooms next to each other, with partial views of the sea, and the kitchenette meant we could save money by preparing our own food. The reception staff are friendly, there is a pool at the hotel, and they provide reusable water containers and purified water fountains. It's a short walk to the beach or to the round town trolleybus tours. For UK visitors it is unusual not to get tea and coffee facilities in your room, and breakfast included in the price, but that seems to be the norm in the US, so I'm not complaining. The air conditioning is super loud, but it does the job.

We stayed for 3 nights initially and were in a room on the 15th floor which was very clean, comfortable bed but the noisiest air-conditioner I have ever encountered. The hotel needs a good upgrade, painting and other general improvements. The staff were great and very obliging and there was a good tour desk. We stayed for another night on our return from Kauai and were in the second tower on 7th floor where there had been renovations. Much quieter and more satisfactory. Would stay again if I could be in that room. Good budget level hotel. Great coffee place just outside reception and easy access to dining options.

Perfect location right before going into Waikiki. Has a great view where I stayed. The room was perfect for 3 of us. We had 3 twin beds, very spacious, had a small balcony. There a coffee shop down by the lobby & ABC store just around the corner. Walking distance to Waikiki and the beach.

The bed was poor quality and too small for two to sleep comfortably on; one of the ranchsliders in the living room couldn't be opened properly; the decor was tardy; and despite costing around $250 NZ dollars for the one night we spent there (with all the extra fees) they don't provide coffee or teabags. This hotel felt like a rip-off - there's a much better one for less money a few blocks down (Nohonani St).

We are currently staying in the ambassador hotel. Room negatives: -no tea or coffee provided in rooms which is much needed after a 22 hour flight from the UK - shabby kitchen units need updating - in need of modernising - no outdoor seating on balcony - lack of double glazing means we're getting very little sleep due to noise on the street which is compounded by very noisy fridge and air con unit- you are only provided with two of everything ( glasses, knifes ect)- small shower with not very high pressure water - lighting system is temperamental-beds get made but sheets are not changed daily ( we did not have a problem with this but thought it was fit to say) Room positives : -room is efficiently serviced each day- comfy big beds- although noisy, air con is effective - safe is useful. General hotel positives: - REALLY friendly staff on reception who are helpful and informative - water filling station- wifi ( see below also) - reasonably close to beach - close to good shopping area - easy access to busses- pool is good temperature and decent size - letter box in reception- hotel is generally clean General hotel negatives: - we were charged $125.64 for 'resort amenity fees' for 6 nights, with the exception of 2 hours free bike hire and self service laundry all the other 8 listed facilities covered by this fee are what you would expect free of extra charge in any decent hotel.- in need of modernisation ( management acknowledge this in other reviews) - sometimes wifi is slow and unpredictable when you're by the pool therefore not 'cutting edge' as stated in the resort amenity list. Overall staying here is poor value for money however, if it was MUCH cheaper and without an amenity fee(and if guests simply paid for amenities they wanted to use rather than having to pay for all facilities) this would be a good place to stay due to location and friendly staff and if it is modernised in the near future it will be a great destination to come and stay whilst on holiday

After reading several reviews before our trip to Honolulu, i wasn't very sure if we would like our stay here, HOWEVER, my family and I have been loving our stay here. We received a renovated room on the 2nd floor w/ a nice balcony and a niece city view. Not at all how I read on other reviews. The staff if nice and friendly and always say Aloha every time we pass by the front desk. Overall, really happy about our stay here, I would deff book here again no doubt about it.

We loved our studio room at the Ambassador Hotel, it was equipped with a kitchen and living area, big balcony and very comfortable king size bed. It was our home away from home when we were filming for our cooking show, The Culinary Edge TV. We featured the Waikiki Parade. We loved it especially because everything was within walking distance to anything & everything on Waikiki. Also a major plus: they have a filtered water refill station on the ground - very much appreciated! Parking was outrageous - $27 a day. So we found some free parking on the street nearby. They let us have a late check out of 1PM which was a big help. We used the laundry facilities - all worked well!

Hotel had all the basic necessities. It could use some upgrades but overall for the price the hotel was good. Customer service is overall good. We had to call twice for a broken remote because no one came down the first time we called. You get what you pay for.

We spent two nights at the Ambassador. I guess Hawaii allows anyone in Waikiki to call their hotel a resort. The hotel did not have parking for us the two nights we stayed there, and sent us to a parking garage. WE believe they charged our bill for the parking garage until the next morning when we got into a contentious moment with the parking garage operator who said they had no affiliation with the Ambassador, When we asked early the next morning for hotel parking, it again was sold out. It's not really a resort. They may lend you a bicycle, they may give you a water bottle that looks like an IV bag. It is no frills. It is somewhat clean except for the grouting on the shower floor. The staff is pleasant. It's just an old hotel that should never claim it is a resort.

Since I read the reviews here and there about this hotel, I didn't expect anything good from this place. However, this hotel is not bad at all for me. The location is great, the staff are helpful, and you have a comfortable and clean room with nice view. I don't understand why some guests are were that harsh on this. I liked the hotel overall.

My husband and I have travelled to Hawaii quite a few times over the past 30 odd years and have stayed in both apartment and hotel rooms. The past three visits we have stayed at the Ambassador Hotel in a hotel room with kitchenette available. By using this facility, we are able to have some breakfast in our room before venturing out to explore Oahu. The rooms are very comfortable with 2 good size queens beds seperate from the living area. The rooms were serviced daily by very friendly maids and nothing was too much trouble if you had any needs.The front desk were very helpful with tips on how to get around and were were able to book some tours from the Tour Operator in the lobby.It might surprise you that after visiting the island so many times, we still find places we had not discovered before or we re-visited some places from our previous times that we thought deserved another look.Our next trip will certainly see us booking into The Ambassador as we find its location just right for us. It's situation is not right in the middle of the main strip but a few extra minutes walk but worth the trouble for a decent nights sleep.Mahola to all the staff and we hope it won't be too long till we say Aloha.

Recently flew up to Honolulu for my family reunion. We had 5 people in our group and wanted a inexpensive but clean suite to stay in the Honolulu area, the Ambassador fit the bill. The one bedroom suite we got was very dated but was very clean. It had a small kitchen with a full side fridge, sink and stove. Air conditioner was a bit noisy but it was cold. There is ice on the second floor and a free water station with filtered water to fill your water bottles. Location was great if you want to zoom in and out of waikiki and not have to fight the traffic, but not much selection for restaurants nearby.

The hotel is at a good location. Only few minutes away from the Waikiki beach. The rooms are pretty big,spacious, the bathroom as well. However, we did have problems with bugs. We kept finding bugs inside of the bathroom and shelfs inside of the room. It was kind of gross. My mom also woke up one night because there was a bug that bit her back. Other than that, hotel staff and the room itself was pretty good. Other issue we had was how loud it was in the morning. Housekeeping ladies for some reason kept skipping our room which was kind of weird. However, with all of those issues our experience was positive.

We traveled with a u12 baseball team. The staff at the hotel were very friendly. We had 4 rooms and Jeff Aquino accommodated our requests of placing us all on the same floor or as close as possible.The washers were broken for most of our stay but there are a number of laundromats close by.

I was here for work so I didn't have any say about where to stay, if I had, it would not have been here. Property is in desperate need of renovation, small tv in room and no in room coffee. It did have a kitchenette which for some people might be a plus but I had no use for it.

I am not that fussy but this was one the worst places I've ever been to. The bathroom we didn't want to use how discusting it was. Lucky we only stayed there 2 nights. I'm not even sure if the sheets were clean. Too run down with a very noisy aircon. Stay away.

This hotel is practically a block of flats, poorly equipped, with aircon that is noisier than a tractor, with continuous street noise. The shower has limited water flow rate; watching TV is regularly interrupted by the TV switching to an unrequested pay er view movie channel. The staff is helpful but the hotel need to be demolished.

This hotel is like something out of a movie. Some of our party members had to stay here for one night. Questionable personalities walking around, dirty and dated facility. Unfortunately, cannot recommend this property to anyone unless there is nothing else there.Some clean up, paint, and regular maintenance could really help the owners of this hotel.

Trip Advisor you owe me a refund! You advertised this as a partner hotel with a discount. What a dump!!!! Every wall and door was marked up. Paint peeling everywhere. Curtains falling off. Rusted lamps and vents. Cupboard knobs fell off when opening them. Filth on everything that had been touched. Mold on base boards. Sliding closet doors broken off of their tracks. The dresser's veneer was peeling off and made it difficult to open the drawers! No coffee pot, had to ask, when used, I almost choked because of some chemical taste it had in it. Maid forgot to clean my bathroom one day...forgot. I could go on, but I think you get the picture. This place should be shut down due to unsanitary conditions! I think homeless shelters are cleaner and in better condition than this place. DO NOT STAY HERE unless you are used to living in these kinds of conditions! Even the Shuttle Bus driver made a negative comment about the place when taking me there! OMG! Once I saw the condition of this place, I looked for another hotel, but could not find anything last minute. I almost cried.

Dirty, outdated and for all this, expensive. I was afraid to sit down orTouch anything it looked so gross. We were charged $260 plus the resort fee for this hotel for one night. We left as soon as we saw the rooms and got ourselves a room at Sheraton Waikiki for less than what Ambassador charged.Look at the pictures of the reviews, DO NOT GO BY THE HOTEL'S pictures. Stay away.

Good location, nice service, friendly staff. Especially perfect for family who wish to cook because there is a lovely kitchen in it. The only problem is the refrigerator, a little bit noisy at night, but that's not big issue for me.

It looks like an old hotel but there are a lot of plus factors. Location-wise it's right smack in Waikiki, close to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants. There is a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf kiosk next to the hotel so the much needed caffeine fix and light breakfast in the morning is just an elevator ride away. There is also a Whalers Grocery Store next to the kiosk which comes in handy for little snacks and things. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating and the house keeping staff did an excellent job at keeping my room clean and tidy for the entire duration I was there. Rooms are very spacious and have balconies. Wifi is free, has a strong signal and it's fast. I would stay here again the next time I'm in Honolulu.

While the location of the Ambassador hotel is convenient, 10 mins walk to the beach, Luxury Row for branded shopping etc, the front desk service and amenities were sub standard. Staying in the hotel over five days, the reception staff were dismissive, unfriendly, and offered incorrect advice on the hotel facilities. A daily package of US$20 for wi-fi and use of pool facilities - outrageous. The rooms were clean and spacious, however lacking in care, and in need of refurbishment. The self-contained kitchen provided only minimal facilities. The bathroom was very basic. The air conditioning was outdated and too noisy to have operating during the night.

review_body: A good price and the room was okay. Nothing fancy but it was nice. It's a little walk to the beach and restaurants but still close. The things that I didn't like was the beds witch gave me some back pain. Also that they didn't have any chairs on the balcony.

The hotel is in desperate need of remodelling. The rooms look nothing like the pictures which is a bit deceiving and very disappointing. Paint chipping off the walls, the carpet was dirty, we have an 11 month old who is crawling and his feet and knees were constantly dirty, there's no vent/fan in the bathroom. Although there's a balcony there's no furniture to sit out there and enjoy the view and weather. The beds we uncomfortable but I had read this already so had no expectations. They give you basic cooking utensils which is good, but nothing else (no coffee, washing detergent, salt, pepper etc) so if staying in a kitchen room expect to go out and buy your basics. Theres no clothes airer in the room so you have no choice but to use the hotel dryer. Parking for guests is cheap at US$25 a night which was good. And the baby cot was for free where most hotels charge per night.The staff are friendly, always giving a smile when passing you. Maintenance are prompt when called, our microwave stopped working in the second day and it was replaced immediately, our tv also stopped working and they came straight away to fix it. During our stay 2 out of 3 washing machines were out of order which was frustrating but by the next day they were fixed.Based on the above I would of given the hotel a 2.5. If I could, I would of given a 0, reason being is on our 3rd day our 11 month old found a pill under the bed near the leg. This is unacceptable! We went straight to reception who told us the room would be cleaned from top to bottom that day, (they also waived 3 days of the amenities fee). It wasn't it was given a basic vac like every other day. This is very concerning as the rooms are obviously not cleaned very well in between guests. We spoke to reception again and was told they would speak to housekeeping to get the room cleaned properly. It wasn't. When housekeeping come they leave dirty sheets on the bed, or just turn the sheet around.I was really disappointed with the ambassador hotel and wouldn't return, nor would I recommend it to anyone.

This hotel is more like a motel. The locks on the sliding doors don't work. The resort fee is a joke considering that the hotel is not a resort. I wouldn't recommend this place for any family traveling.

While attending a convention in Honolulu, I had to book a last minute hotel in Waikiki. The ambassador staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. My room on the 14th floor had a kitchenette; stove, ' fridge, microwave...which was convenient. It was a very short walk to all the trendy shops in Waikiki...and to the convention.It's an older hotel that has had a recent make over. Clean. Convenient. Close to the action. It made my convention stay very easy.
