review_body: Let's start with the staff is super nice but sadly the hotel itself needs a lot of remodeling. Sadly! I had a inconvenience where I tried to wash laundry and my coins got stuck. I was so tired and In need of washing clothes that I rushed to go wash clothes somewhere else. I couldn't use another because they all were having the same problem. Only one was working! House keeping is super hands on I loved that I was there for a week and I loved that everyday they came to check the room and clean! My room wasn't what it looked like on pictures so that was a bummer. I didn't use the room much but to sleep and shower! The staff was helpful in various occasions! It would be perfect if they would just remodel the hotel just because it looks very old.

Short walk to waikiki beach and shopping and restaurants. Needs an up grade though, our room was not very nice, e.g paint coming off. A/C very noisy,not poss ble to choose degrees. No furniture on the balcony. Ok pool.

We stayed for five days at the end of April. The facilities were basic but good value for money. Off the expensive strip with easy access to transport. The staff were friendly and helped us. The vacation desk helped us to book three trips on the island all good.

We stayed with the family again, and I must say that staying at this hotel gave peace of mind! Check-in was very easy, and the agents were very friendly when accommodating our requests. During our stay, housekeeping was always around, asking if everything was okay. The room size was perfect for our family size. It gave a beautiful panoramic view of the ocean and surrounding area. The a/c kept us cool when it was a little humid. The amenities of the hotel were great too! We did our laundry and while waiting for it, we used the exercise facilities next door. During the day, we took advantage of the swimming pool. It also included wifi! Parking was ample - very fair price for Waikiki, considering it was central to shopping, dining, attractions and the beach! One thing that made our stay memorable was the staff - they were friendly, always smiling and conversing with us. Service was very personalized. Would definitely stay here again!

In Oahu once again for business and stayed at this property due to is location close to the Hawaii Convention Center.The room was clean and basic but served my purpose well since I was only there mostly to sleep. Convenient laundry facilities and the staff were very friendly and helpful.Most important it was clean and I would recommend this hotel if your on a budget. Convenient walking distance to food and shopping and just a short walk to the Convention Center. Parking was fairly easy and convenient on property.

The room was very old and smelly. we couldn't keep the window of the balcony opened because the air conditioning of the room beside was too loud. same for the fridge..we had to turn it off to be able to sleep.on the other side, we could walk in few minutes to the beach and to the restaurants street.

This hotel was a great price. We had a king size bed with a view of the ocean. While this isn't a luxury hotel, you shouldn't be spending a lot of time there in HNL anyway. Our room was clean, as was the bathroom. Very basic amenities and the furniture was dated, but the bed was comfortable and served our needs. The water bottles they give you are a nice touch and come in handy. If we had stayed longer, the kitchen would have come in handy and would help save money. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Yes, it needed a lick of paint here and there but it was clean and well presented. The staff could not do enough to make your stay enjoyable. The beds were comfy and the location was excellent. It was only a 10 minute walk into the heart of Waikiki. I would definitely go back.

Very average hotel room, noisy with traffic noise outside and people noise inside on the second floor. May have been better on higher floors. They also charged a $20.00 entertainment fee for use of swimming pool, FREE internet, use of coin operated laundry, etc.

We stayed at the Ambassador Hotel in Waikiki while visiting family. It's an older hotel. No frills. But on a budget this place can't be beat. The rooms were old but fine. I haven't seen a microwave with s dial in 25 years but our room had one. And it worked just fine. The staff we're awesome. The pool was great for what it was. It was clean and the chairs comfortable. It's within walking distance to many things in Waikiki including the Royal Hawaiian shopping mall, Tony Roma's and Cheeseburger Waikiki among others. If you're on a buffet, this place is awesome. Just ask the front fest got a coffee maker. Most rooms only come with an electric tea pot cause many of the guests are Japanese. Our coffee maker was delivered to our room in under 10 minutes.

I turned up late after a delayed flight and the front desk team checked me in quickly and efficiently.I even got a handy refillable water bottle to use during my stay with access to chilled filtered water in the foyer. The room was a little noisy (from 5am), facing out on to the street but the evening were quiet.Walking distance to local shops, restaurants and amenities.

We stayed here for 6 nights, and for the price I thought it was great.We wanted something cheap but obviously clean etc. The location is good only 5/10 min walk from the beach and all bars/ restaurants etc. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and big enough for us 2. We had a fridge and a kettle and free toiletries in the bathroom.House keeping came round every day and it was always clean.If you are looking for cheap and decent this is the place for you!

Staff are very helpful and friendly - hotel is good value but is aging - OK for a short stay or quick stopover. If you get one of the rooms with a sitting room and kitchen would be OK. Needs a makeover.

We stayed here for 12 nights. For the price per night the room we had was just ok. Nice view and the room cleaned well every morning. Kitchen wasnt over flowing with additional extras. 4 knifes 4 forks 4 cups etc. We did have little bugs constantly over the bench and walls of the kitchen too. Our biggest issue is that we really struggled to open the slider doors to the balcony and the walk in wardrobes. To the point where we left the doors open the whole time, because we didnt want to break them trying to reopen them.Quiet loud in the mornings with traffic and rubbish dump collection. Pool and gym was nice. Staff and hotel concierge very friendly. We never used the car parking facility as the price per night was very expensive. We just hired a different car evey day as this was cheaper. Nice location, 10min walk to beach passing lots of shops on the way.

I stayed here for 4 days. I had seen bugs since first day in my room at the hotel. Even bugs were crawling up to the bed. The condition of room is not bad compared to the price, but bugs...were awful.

After a few problems at the beginning got sorted the holiday was more enjoyable rooms cleaned every day spotless ,local to everything . one problem I arrived around 7am and no room available to me until 3pm when I booked a single there was none so luckily I was up graded to a kitchenette room was lovely found staff helpful and manager helpful at all times.

Hotel Staff is Nice! But i Do Not recommend this hotel! Pros: Good LocationCons:-AC took hours to cool down the room.-Beds are Old & Hard! So is the room very dated!-No chairs on Balcony-Fire drill took place & the lady checking me in failed to let me know, but luckily the guy checking in my coworker let her know.-Hot water took 10 mins to get Warm, not even hot, i've had hotter ramen! I called front desk, they sent someone up to check & he told me to run the water til it got hot, i told him i didnt want to waste water but i had no choice.-My Room door wasn't flush with the wall, so you could see the light coming through which made for plenty air flow into the room.-Parking $26.18 a day Cmon! Resorts charge that price with Valet.Pay A Little Extra & Stay at a Better Hotel/Resort

We stayed at this property and I just didn't like it, I wanna to check in at around 1:00 pm and the girl at the front desk literally throw my driver license and credit card back to me saying your guarantee check in time is at three that's the first thing, I came back at almost four and we were able to check in the girl that help us she was ok she explained all the policies including her telling me that she need it the description of the car I was driving, I mean really? Parking is $27 dlls resort fee is $21 dlls, so that was my experience at the front desk, the room, It just didn't felt clean, walking in the carpet without shoes was not a pleasant experience, the view from the room was ok, checking out was pretty quick except if you driving you have to go pull your car out of the garage and come back to the hotel to return the parking card otherwise they will charge you for the card if is not return, this property is scratch off from my list if I go back to Oahu.MUY MALO!!!

Stayed here for a week while in town for a hockey tournament. They hotel is located in a great part of town close to everything. Got a 4 bed suite that fit 4 guys comfortably with a full kitchen and large ocean view with 3 balconies. So that was great. The reason I gave it 3 out of 5 is because of the cleanliness. The vents had a ton of mold on them and the carpet was a little old. If your not freaked out by mold caked on the vents then this is a great hotel.

Booked through Expedia as we were coming for a holiday from Australia and definitely not value for money. The hotel needs to be modernised! Room was terrible very noisy air con, disgusting kitchen, outdated furniture and deco, bathroom was disgusting as well. Overall terrible room and is a bit of a walk from Waikiki beach and main strip. Although big balcony however had a bad view and couldn't see anything. The hotel room was that terrible that we couldn't wait to leave. Although staff member were friendly!

OK to sleep and shower, but not much else. Interesting that there were three twin beds in our room???? Obviously not for a married couple???? Room was clean but badly in need of refurbishing. To have to pay a resort fee is outrageous...NOT a resort. Front desk individuals were helpful and checked our luggage after check out for no charge. Did enjoy the reusable water bottles during our day excursions.

Hidden rates be prepared! Beds are stiff and blankets where thin! Rooms don't look like pictures and are Hella dirty. The shower kept leaking!still can't believe I had to pay hidden fees. Hawaiian airline owe's me on this one!

The room was extremely outdated. Stains on the walls curtains floor and furniture. Scary moldy old shower. Apparently the tap water is not safe to drink because they give you a bag when you check-in and direct you to a room to fill it with purified water. The beds were hard and felt like they were is old is the hotel . In a nutshell the hotel rooms lobby the entire property is in desperate need of remodeling. The worst hotel I've ever been in, hands-down. Definitely not a three+-star, as was advertised. The good news is Tripadvisor assisted us in resolving the matter and we checked into a different hotel. Photos are attached.

Was just over to Oahu for a dinner & meeting the next day and in high season to boot. The Ambassador was within a 10 minute walk fo the host hotel and $150 less expensive. Granted the host hotel is right on Waikiki Beach but I wasn't there for beach time. The Ambassador doesn't appear to have been updated in a while and the rooms show it but it was a clean place to sleep & shower, so it worked for me.

I have been to this hotel several times in the past 10 years; sadly the infrastructure has deteriorated immensely as management has deferred necessary maintenance. The only saving grace is its cheap rate and central location. The showers do not drain; there is no bath tub. There is not even an extra chair for a visitor. There are no cooking utensils in rooms advertised with kitchen. Use of computer requires payment of $20 daily amenity fee in addition to daily parking fee. Coffee is not provided in rooms. You should rent here only if you plan only to sleep.

We were in town for one night with a medical procedure. With low energy because of an illness we wanted to lay low at the hotel the next day before catching an evening flight. We asked for a very late check out, and the mangers were very kind to accommodate us. We were able to take a nap and lay low, rather than have to find a place to hang for 3 or more hours. We also weren't expecting a nice size kitchen with big frig. Room was spacious and beds were comfortable. Pool area is quiet and was relaxing across from park. Easy to walk to take-out place for food and groceries. Good value and would recommend to others.

We stayed here for 8 nights. We booked a room with a kitchen as we had our young family with us. It was clean and bright, with all the amenities needed to help make a holiday for a family stress free. The décor is a little outdated, but we weren't in Waikiki for the hotel room décor. The only negative I would say is that it would have been nice to have a small outdoor setting on the balcony to be able to better enjoy the beautiful views that surrounded us. The staff were friendly and the housekeeping more than willing to accommodate our holiday needs. It is about 15 mins walk from the main beach of Waikiki, but we liked that as it allowed us to explore all the little cafes and streets that we would have otherwise have missed if we had paid more to stay right in the heart of things. We found it to be good value for money and would definitely consider staying here again on our next visit to Waikiki.

The game room offered didnt really have anything the doll machine was empty. Our bathroom had black mold on the floor, the shower could barely fit one person. Did not have any hot water literally. The faucet in the shower was leaky and the pipes was coming out of the wall. While at the pool with my kids people were throwing things off the balcony yelling swear wordsParking they had NO parking how can a hotel not have enough parking

First of all, I'm one to not say anything bad about anything if I can help it, and with that said, I will continue with that tenet. This hotel is not the worst I have stayed in by far. In the end, I look at all hotels as a place to sleep. It is outdated and could use a little polishing up. It wasn't dirty, but had an "old" smell to it. One of the beds looked as though the sheets/covers weren't changed out (or washed properly), but that was minor. The staff was very friendly and responded quickly when we asked for another pillow. The beds were comfortable to me and my family. The AC window unit was working properly and kept the room as cool as we needed it, albeit the last 2 nights of our stay the temperature was actually in the 60's. I am not a fan of the seemingly popular daily fees (WiFi, gym, etc.) that hotels are pushing onto everybody these days, and of course parking is a premium on this island, thus a daily parking fee was charged. So adding $45/day (plus tax) is something to consider when budgeting your lodging expenses. It is within walking distance of many stores and restaurants, so that is indeed a plus. Overall not a bad place to stay, and if asked if I would recommend to a friend or if I would stay there again, I would definitely say "Yes, but....." So as with all hotels, consider your expectations and if they are not "sky high" and you are not expecting high end luxury, then consider the Ambassador.

I could spend comfortable days at ur hotel! Front staff are so kind ,location is good cos it's near Waikiki beach and alamoana beach so I could go both beach everyday during my stay .I want to stay ur hotel next time

Probably the best thing about the Ambassador was the free water bottle and there was a great Thai Restaurant about 5min walk down the road. Other than that it was rather disappointing. The rooms have fridge / stove etc so you can take food there and make your own - however there was not even a dishwashing brush or liquid to wash your dishes and there seem to be a constant stream of brown ants in the kitchen. The shower/ bathroom was rather dated and the shower was quite undesirable. The friendliest staff members were the men at the activities / tours desk, whilst we didnt book any tours through them they were both super helpful. Overall an average experience. The free bikes that guest can use was cool but not a hotel I would recommend to friends.

There was a few glitches because of our travel agency and management was so great about the situation. the manager Chue not only fixed everything but made us feel like friends and was so kind to us every time we saw him. I really appreciate how they improved our stay there.

We stayed at this hot for 7 nights and i must say it was more than what i expected as it was only booked thru expedia. aside from the 20$ amenity fee which i noticed most hotels charge. every thing was to my satisfaction our room was very large, has kitchen so saved me for my bfast as i can cook. staffs were very friendly specially amber who was always there with a smile and is always happy to help! if you are looking for a decent place to stay at a decent price ambassador hotel is the way to go. close to buses and close to the beach and walking distance to a lot of convenience stores and restaurants!

This hotel is old, outdated, dirty and run down. There are abolutely no facities such as coffee in the rooms, a restaurant or anything. The rooms are sparse with just a bed and a few pieces of furniture. When we arrived they informed us that there was a 20.00 amenity fee that we had to pay. Strange that there were no amenities to speak of. Very disappointed, and flabergasted that when we got home they had charged our card 120.00 not 20.00. Hope we get our money back.

Located between Kuhio and the canal just at the beginning of Waikiki. View of ocean from your lanai. Resort fees are 48.00 per night .Coffee shop at entrance to lobby .Easy to get to from airport.Close to the famous Ala Moana Shopping .Found on Priceline to be cheaper .More like a last minute type of place if you can't find anything else.

The hotel is located in a great location and within walking distance of Waikiki - the rooms are large and have great views. The front desk are always courteous and helpful and the Concierge is very friendly and attentive.The rooms and pool area do need to be update but I believe they are doing this.

Me and some friends stayed here in June 2014. It was a reasonably priced hotel in a great location. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room but it was fine no complaints we had a high up room so good view of the city. Pool is nothing special but you have the beach in walking distance. Great location with shops in walking distance lots of restaurants in walking distance. We hired a car from next door for further travel and was able to park it at the hotel the staff were friendly and all in all we had a great experience here.

When you're traveling on a budget, and just looking for a place to lay your head, and keep your belongings safe, this is the place. Not a four star, it's a older hotel, do yes, you'll see its age but what you'll get. Safe and secure! Most secure property for the low end cost hotels. Lots of parking. Courteous staff. Convience store in property. Easy to get to and from. I always choose this hotel when traveling with my wife and teen daughter because they also offer 3 bed rooms. You get what you pay for, but for the price range, this is the best!

Stayed here many years before as a part of tour package on my second visit to Honolulu. Just write the review now in order to add the hotel into my hotel list. The room on the higher floor offered a great city view. There was a kitchenette in room and the room itself was specious. I saw a tiny and unattractive pool from the elevators lobby so I didn't bother to go to the pool. The hotel is located at one end of Kuhio Ave. which means some walks to the beach and all activities. There is a bus stop nearby so it is easy to travel by bus.

We used Hawaiian airlines to book us a travel package and this is the hotel they gave us UGH! Even after upgrading to a suite and changing rooms 2x it still was totally unacceptable but there was nuthing we could do. Peeling paint, holes in walls, stained furniture and curtains and generally unclean! Do yourself a favor and find something above this 1 star hotel. Please don't use Hawaiian Airlines as your travel agent as once they get your money they will not do anything to help you!

Hotel was very modest in appointments, but very clean and had everything we needed in a room. The bed was a little past its prime, but comfortable for us. Small kitchenette, large closet with plenty of hangers, safe for valuables, TV, and Wi-Fi. Also located near the heart of Waikiki so easy walk to the beach and Kalakaua Drive. The room could have used some colorful wall pictures/paintings as all was pretty much beige...but a clean beige. Staff also was very friendly and helpful.

We booked a package deal thru Hawaiian airlines and they claimed it was a 3 star hotel and it barely would pass for a 1 star. Holes in the wall, peeling paint, stained furniture and curtains and basically unclean. Pool is only open from 10 to 7....not heated of course. We upgraded to a suite after seeing how bad our first room was and it wasn't any better. Hawaiian airlines would not help us at all since they already had our money. Will never work with them again! Avoid this hotel at all costs.

We had reservations for a different hotel, but after seeing the accommodations we left in a hurry. Fortunately for us, the Ambassador had vacancy that fit our needs. We traveled as a group of three, needing two doubles. The front desk was very helpful, the room was clean enough and comfortable, and the location was prime. HOWEVER, the tally of fees left and right is enough to make you dizzy. First quoted a price of $175/night that quickly escalated to $215/night with the addition of all these ludicrous fees. I had no problem paying the $215/night, but let that be it. Don't initially quote me one price and then tack on all these additional extras. I suspect that is the case for most of the hotels on Waikiki beach. Overall, it was clean place to sleep after long days out exploring.

I booked a "750 square foot suite" "suitable for 4 people" and discovered it was not even suitable for 3. Half the advertised space was the balcony which is concrete and useless. Interior had not been up kept for decades it seemed. Bathroom was moldy. Paint was like graffiti in the bedroom and places places. The bed was like a stack of corrugated boxes. It felt like I slept at a warehouse.

This was an excellent place to stay--conviently located just off Waikiki, with a small kitchen to boot! A good deal for the price, but I have one complaint: They tacked on a "resort fee of $15.00, which I feel is underhanded and manipulative. They should have just raised the price of the rooms $15.00 instead of adding a vague and obscure fee for god knows what. I'm sure the manager was told by some marketing executive that this was a good idea, but it just angers intelligent people who see through this sleazy marketing scheme.

I'm so frustrated with this place. It has horrible ventilation which has now led to me being sick for the rest of my holiday. There's an extra $20 amenities fee pp no matter how many nights you're staying. Which is ridiculous as if covers Internet use, room cleaning and pool toys (they're crap) all of which are covered at most hotels in the price. We were woken by the smell of someone smoking coming through the air conditioning, which was turned off but still blew out horrible cold air. Also the taxes are really high, unnecessarily we paid $66 just in taxes for two nights. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Great hotel, not too bad on location although just a little further away from Waikiki beach than I would like. However, great rooms. Very clean, lovely pool area, friendly staff.Not bad prices. The only let down in Waikiki is the food places. There isn't alot of reasonably priced choices..

Our room was very large and the bed was very comfortable. The room is very dated because of the old kitchen - but at least the facilities are there. As we only stayed a night in transit to Maui, tea and coffee facilities would have been welcomed. Great location to take a look at the marina and Ala Moana shops. Great water initiative the save plastic bottle disposal - congrats!

This hotel is a great place to go when you want to have a "small" get together and split a room for the night. You can make as much noise as you want and security almost never shows up at your door. Absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

The ambassador is always a go to for a hotel in Waikiki if you aren't looking for a hotel on the beach. The rooms are always spacious and clean so a group or family can get a 1 bedroom suite comfortably!

I saw many criticisms before arrival but I generally liked the accommodation. So I even thought that I'd like to make a good comments on several web sites like here, but I changed my mind because of KERRI, just after I have checked out with her. KERRI, asian women at the front desk was unaccommodating, rude and just plain unfriendly. The day after morning I had to wait about 20 minutes because the elevators working not very good, and there is so many people use it at the morning time. I was at 5th floors, I went out by emergency stairs and she spoke to me very loudly at the lobby, "use the elevator, you just wait more!" hahaha.When I checked out, I asked to KERRI about the amenity fees on the invoices and she told me "DON'T YOU HAVE EYES?"She told me even about the day before, the emergency exit, she is rude because I use the emergency exit. I was really shocked. Their loss If the hotel keep Kerri work at the frond desk.P.S Please e-mail me if one of the ambassador hotel's staff read my comments, I'd like to know why I had to pay the amenity fees. I didn't informed about this by booking.com when I booked.

Rooms are a good size, have balconies and are clean. They're fairly average rooms over all but have cooking facilities if you want to save some money and eat in.The hotel charges a services fee which includes the wifi, pool, etc but is in addition to the room charge - first time I've come across this and leaves you left feeling like they are ripping you off just to get wifi (I did not use their pool).

My daughter was relocating to Waikiki so I went down for 4 nights to help her find an apartment and get to know the area and also hope to enjoy Hawaii a bit in a very short time. I knew going in that the hotel was older and I was not staying at a new Marriott or such...but saw mixed reviews prior to leaving to go there. Glad I didn't let any negative reviews bother me...as the hotel was perfect.. The room was dated and I saw scuff marks on the walls, etc., but the room was immaculate. Housekeeping was exceptional. I saw previous reviews in regards to bugs...never saw any...and believe me I looked. We had a double with a kitchenette (#502) which allowed us to have some meals in our room and plenty of space in a generous sized fridge. Their purified water station was awesome...no need to keep buying bottled water. Their business center was great as we needed to print out documents and I could print my boarding passes as well. Had no problem with the WIFI at all. They give you codes for up to 3 devices per room. The 2 concierge we met were extremely helpful and helped us to get to know our way around. VERY centrally located...walking distance to almost everywhere...and right on the bus lines. convenience store adjacent as well as an ABC convenience store one block up. I saved the best for last...the staff. They were so totally customer service oriented...made you feel like you were home and helped with any and everything with a smile. I needed to leave before my daughter was able to move in to an apartment and they helped me to arrange a last minute 2 day extension ensuring my daughter would not need to leave our current room. I have NEVER took the time to do a review on a hotel on-line...but we had such a great experience I felt the need to share as some of the negative reviews we NEVER experienced and wanted to share. Hope to go back again this year, once my daughter is settled and do a REAL Hawaii vacation...2 weeks....and will look to book at the ambassador.

This 0 star goes to the front mgr Ron or Ray not sure by his name older cold Asian man.. Believe me his cold,no emotion ,no smile ,not welcoming ,simply don't ask me question attitude!!!! The other employees a pretty nice!try to avoid him he will ruin your day

I booked via agoda :) The room we got is enough for 4 when it was only 2 of us. hehehe. and the kitchen equipment is complete! So far everything is really good except for the noise but itsokays. I am a heavy sleeper. The only problem I have with the hotel is the Amenities fee :x Sorry but I didn't get to use any of the facilities provided due to hecticness.Overall, it is a good hotel and I would love to stay here again :) Near to Waikiki Beach, Royal Hawaiian Centre and Ala Moana Mall :)

Average accommodation. Needs an overhaul as it is pretty old and tired. Needed a bucket on the balcony to catch the heavy flow of water from the air conditioning. Only 2 lifts and sometime the wait was lengthy. Cleanliness was average. Location ok.

The hotel is abit dated like most Waikiki hotels but includes a few extras to give you value. There's a nice pool area, gym with free weights and the usual cardio suspects, great wifi that you don't need to continually log in and I had a fully equipped kitchen. The location isn't bad so great for those wanting to save abit of $ if they don't mind walking each day. I could see the lower levels being noisy but I was fine on the 10th

I took my family on a trip to Hawaii, this could be a once in a lifetime visit.I called a month before to confirm our reservations for 4, and the kind lady I spoke to said the room was sufficient for 4 people.there was no mention on extra cost.When we departed on 30th I called hotel to say the 4 of us would arrive late, and reconfirmed room reservation.When we arrived at 11pm January 30,15 the lady at front desk said only 2 people were confirmed for room. I explained I called in more than once, the lady at front began to imply I was lying. After being aggressively rude and condescending she said she would wave a $30/person/night fee (420 USD= $665 CAD) and let us stay in the room. We didn't get checked in for 45 minutes. I was so upset I just cried while completing our checkin. I couldn't help but let the boys see.We were given water bottles that came in handy, and could be filled on main floor with purified water.The room 1809 looked old, but clean and we had a great view on the small deck.The room was kept clean and all other service workers were very good and efficient.If we do return to Hawaii, we will stay by north beach.Rough start for us

I stood in the Ambassador hotel and the room was in poor condition, bathroom had broken walls, shower stall needed better attention in cleanliness and what was disturbing when the lights were put on roaches all over the bathroom running around, very disturbing, bad mattress to sleep.

My husband and I recently stayed at The Ambassador in Waikiki for a 9-day stay. This is a good basic hotel. Yes, it is dated; yes, the decor and furnishings are older, but we found this hotel to be clean, there was not one bug in sight - which is amazing given you are staying in Hawaii! I've stayed at luxury hotels in Hawaii that cost 4X this and had daily battles with bugs - NOT here, it was older and a few things are chipped and peeling, but it was DEFINITELY CLEAN! We stayed in Room 629 which overlooks the side street off Kuhio and the hotel's back parking lot; from the balcony's vantage point you can see the sunset and fireworks down by the Rainbow Hilton next to Fort DeRussy. We found there was some street noise but it is minimal; the room had 2 twin beds & 1 double bed. The room was a corner unit with a wrap-around balcony. There is an in-room safe. We moved the table and chairs onto the patio to dine outside then moved them back inside when we were finished. The trade winds really blow strong here which is presumably why they have no patio furniture. The room is across the street from the Waikiki Baptist Church; birds singing in plumeria trees, and overlooks Fort DeRussy. There is a lovely pool on the 3rd floor which is a good size and clean; there are lots of chaise loungers and table/chair units with beach umbrellas. Beach/pool towels are available on the 2nd floor; complimentary filtered water available is the lobby and they provide a complimentary reusable water containers for each person. As our unit had a kitchen we brought our French press for morning coffee (no coffee maker, but there is a kettle, toaster, microwave, stove, fridge and basic utensils, frying pan and 2 pots). There is a wide-screen TV and clock radio. There is no tub but the shower was great - good water pressure and clean. We used the business centre for access to a computer as we left all technology at home. Parking is available but we never had a car and had no need of it (there is a fee); the hotel is at the beginning of Waikiki and we walked everywhere. It's about an 8-minute walk through Fort DeRussy to the beach and about a 30 minute walk down Kuhio to The Zoo. We walked all over Waikiki and had a great time! We took the city Bus ($2.50 each way pp) to Hanauma Bay for snorkeling; the staff at The Ambassador are wonderful, very helpful and informative. There is a Food Pantry a few blocks away for purchasing groceries and if you need a car there is a rental agency (with lovely sports cars!) 1/2 a block away. The beds in this unit were comfortable. If you are looking for a basic hotel this is a good place to stay; its not fancy but we found it to be clean. The housekeeping staff were efficient and such lovely people - our beds were made-up daily, and clean unlimited towels stocked - one day I left a few dishes rinsed in the sink only to return a few hours later and to find them washed! We made breakfast in our unit, and several other meals as well, so we could splurge on a few special nights out. You can get around Waikiki easily either by walking or taking the bus - we walked because its good exercise and very do-able. We walked from one end to the other, as far as the Aquarium down towards Diamond Head, and the other direction to Honolulu's Ward Center past the Ala Moana Shopping Center. We're both in our mid to late 50s and enjoyed our stay. If we came back to Waikiki we would stay at The Ambassador Hotel again. There is a little coffee shop open in the day-time just outside the hotel lobby; they make great ice blended coffee drinks there for a treat and a General store next to it, and an ABC store 1 block in either direction of the hotel (but for groceries go a few more blocks (10 min walk) to Food Pantry on Hobron). Concerning the $20.00 per night amenities charge, just know that it exists, and every hotel in Waikiki charges it, so don't feel like it's different anywhere else.

The hotel is older, but I wanted a cheaper hotel for 2 nights. The bathroom really needed to be updated and the shower didn't drain. It was full of mold. We were just there to sleep, so it was ok for that. The staff was very nice.

Don't expect much for an older place. Staff was very friendly. But rooms and facilities are old. Will have to pay for parking and wifi. Location is central to most parts of waikiki. Expect to walk to most attractions in wakiki.

Small cockroachs came and moved almost everywhere. They always irritated me. A bathroom looks very old. What I like is bed quality. it is good. The room is wide enough to stay long. I will stay longer if It should have been cheap. A hotel lobby is really small, and you find a couple of chairs.

The hotel was comfortable for a short stay. It is centrally located near the main action in Waikiki with many shops and restaurants within short walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful. Be careful when booking with respect to the "amenities package" - $20.00 per night to get access to wi-fi and other hotel amenities.

The staff were friendly and helpful, especially in navigating The Bus routes. Everything was Great! The room was clean and having a kitchen was a bonus when we wanted to stay in and cook local fish for ourselves.

Staff was very nice But place was a little run down and expensive. In a good area for walking shopping an restaurants on busy street. Weather was decent for that time of year. Didnt use the pool but enjoyed the trip for my 50th birthday :)

The hotel staff is amazing, very friendly and eager to help.Upon our arrival we asked if we could check in and for a room upgrade. Since they were not busy the night prior they had no issues letting us check in early. The upgrade was awesome, from 3 twins city view, to 2 doubles partial ocean view.

This is probably the best value in Waikiki. Yes, the hotel is old and in need of some serious updating, and if you are looking for a resort environment this is not it. The guest pictures showing peeling paint are real. However, the staff goes to great lengths to keep the place clean and the service is exemplar. At a time when hotels in Waikiki were charging over $800 (yes, PER NIGHT), the Ambassador was at slightly over $200, after taxes and fees. One irritating thing that most hotels seem to be doing these days is their "resort fees" Why oh why if I cannot opt out of these fees they are charged separately? It is nothing but a silly backhanded ploy to make the price seem cheaper when compared side-by-side. The good thing is that since everybody seems to be doing it, the price comparison is back to reality. Still, this practice smacks of dishonesty.All in all, I recommend the hotel. I got a HUGE room with a separate living room and a small, if fully functional kitchen. If you are looking to spend some time in Waikiki away from your hotel by all means go here...

When I initially booked this property, I was a bit leery because of the great price! I am so glad that I pushed aside my doubt - the property was absolutely perfect and better than I expected. I only expected a single room but instead I got a suite - all to myself. The full kitchen was a pleasant surprise, along with the sitting area that led to the balcony. I was so unbelievably relaxed every evening watching the sunset and ultimately watching the city go to sleep! The staff, the location, and the price made my first trip to Hawaii most memorable and I will definitely be returning to this property in the very near future!!!

All in all, well worth it. If you know the area, you can save $200 if you stay a week by parking along Ala Wai only a block away. Clean, quiet and a great location. A five minute walk to Waikiki. Good kitchenette. Elevators work fine, Wi Fi works well enough in the rooms and a small business center is off the lobby.Free bottled water (you fill it yourself) and a knowledgeable concierge. As all hotels, the "resort fee" is just a rip off and $27 a night for parking is a little high IF THEY HAVE SPACES, which they usually don't. You can park the car for twenty minutes in front and it's okay.

If your looking for a place thats good for your budget and is spacey this is it! They have the best customer service ask for Emelyn. Our first trip, we had so much info that we felt like experts. Reccomend it to anyone.

Great location and a good price. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a corner room with views of the mountains, city and ocean. This room also had a long balcony. The property was kept very clean. We enjoyed our stay here.

We use this hotel every time. There is enough room for our trip plan and It was good that we can put surfboards. All staffs help us(Japanese traveler) kindly, we saw I couldn't connect to Wi-fi sometimes. we'd like to use Ambassador Hotel again!

It was a comfortable stay, older establishment, reasonably Central (Comfortable 15 minute walk to Waikiki Beach).Staff very cooperative and helpful.Plenty of eating places close by. Transport easy to useShopping close by, plenty of variety

Our stay was good for what he had planned. Absolutely nothing just enjoyed the area as it was central to most thingsThe staff (loved Kenton) were lovely from concierge to the maid service Only other real mention would be the lifts..1 outta 4 did not have issues..we dubbed 2 of the lifts as the fun ride and and mystery ride.The tourist desk guy (Richard) was also fantastic - he knew his staff and gave giod advice.Overall loved the stay the convenience and the coffee bean next door..best coffee!! (Thanks AJ and co)Would stay againMahaloMiranda

The location and price of the Ambassador Hotel cannot be beat, especially not with it's impressive list of amenities including free use of their bicycles (there's a time limit, but I can't recall what it is off hand), water bottles to use at their filtered water fountain, a game room, fitness room, etc. If you're traveling on a budget with a family, this is the hotel for you. We have been staying at this hotel during our visits to O'ahu since my daughter was about one and a half years old (they provided us a crib at no charge), and she's five now. The front desk staff is great but the shining star among all of them is Bob, who is possibly the greatest person ever. He's always friendly and helpful, and does whatever he can to make your stay the best he can.

Since we have been to Hawaii, we knew we weren’t going to spend much time in our hotel room and didn’t need an elaborate, expensive room, so we choose the Ambassador. We kicked off our stay here with an immediate $400+ increase to our bill at check-in even though we had pre-paid for everything before our arrival. The entire check-in process reminded me of a shady used-car salesman who had an additional fee tacked on after each signature we signed. They had given us a terrible experience to start our stay and no concern on how their customers are treated. The room was nothing special and the air conditional was ridiculously loud, but as I said we weren’t there for the hotel. However, by the end, an additional $100+ was tacked on with no logical explanation of the charges. The staff had no concern for the scandalous billing strategies and resembled zombies when we were disgusted by these tactics. This is not the way to treat your customers and we regret booking here. We wish we had just spent the additional money at another hotel that was upfront and honest about their pricing structure. I recommend that to anyone looking for a place to stay in Oahu.

My two daughters and myself stayed at this Hotel for 9 nights. Great location and the Staff were amazing.The Hotel is a little tired but the Reception and the Cleaning staff made up for it.Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed six nights a good hotel for price had a kitchen and laundry. Small double beds (2) which were hard. As a married couple we like to sleep in same bed but a small double made it a little uncomfortable.One of the reception staff was not helpful. When checking out and arranging travel to the airport asked one of the staff (a women) if I could call the shuttle company they said they could not call an outside local line.

Good location n friendly staffs. Worth the money.bus stop right at front door, shopping centre just a step away , Waikiki beach is a 10 minutes walk. Hotel is clean n the room is very bright with lots of windows.

We stayed two nights at the Ambassador, having chosen this hotel for its location and what seemed to be its reasonable price. The friendly front desk manager gave us a warm welcome but that is basically where the perks ended. The room we stayed in was really run down with old furnishings and worn out beds. The Air con is a necessity as the balcony door couldn't be open due to noisy traffic even during night time. The AC itself was also really noisy and we had to sleep with earplugs. This is in no way an enjoyable hotel, nor is it cheap.

It's hard to know where to start with this one. The photos and "blurb" on the hotel's website, indicate something somewhat different from reality. True, the accommodation cost is less than many of the other properties in Waikiki, so if a tight budget is the issue you could consider this hotel. On first impressions the building itself is quite bland - all a dark beige and no other colours. The hotel lobby is quite ordinary, but the front office staff are very pleasant and welcoming. I'd booked a "partial ocean view room" and after receiving an email offering a "higher floor" upgrade for an extra $US10, opted for that. Getting off on the 16th floor, I was quite looking forward to the view as I walked along the walkway - but opening the door to my room, I found NO ocean view at all - just the blocks of apartments and hotels across the road. I went out on the balcony - which had no outdoor furniture on it ( except a leaking air conditioner) and leant over. Yes, THERE was the water, but leaning out over a balcony 16 floors up isn't all that relaxing.....or healthy.The room was big enough, but bland. The bathroom too was big enough, but a bit shabby, with paint peeling off the wall near the sink. I found out later that the shower drain wasn't all that good either - as the water level rose over my feet ! There was a kitchenette in the room, the TV was fine and the internet wi-fi quite good. As indicated by other reviewers, there is no on-site restaurant or café, so you have to go out for any meals, including breakfast. The hotel is not too far away from places to go, so no big deal.I suppose the most irksome thing is that the hotel calls itself a "resort". You get handed a letter at check-in telling you that you will be paying US$20 per room, per night, as a "Resort Fee". This hotel is, by NO stretch of the imagination, a "resort". For your extra money, amongst other things you can actually have a swim in the pool, hire a push-bike, get given a 5c plastic water bladder and use your in-room safe. What a joke.Rather than hit people up for this ludicrous "resort fee", just put it on the room cost in the first place. It may save some annoyance on the part of the guest - who gets hit with the original room rate, plus the alleged "higher floor" fee, then the transient accommodation fee and a general excise tax !! Oh yes, before I forget, if you are going to offer rooms with an ocean view ( partial or otherwise) it would be nice to actually deliver on the advertising.

Stayed in October 2015. Pretty close to the beach, surrounded by pretty much any type of store you could need. Staff were great. Easy check in and check out. I was aware from Travelocity of the daily parking fee and resort fee so no issue there, unlike some of the bad reviews I saw where people weren't aware. Don't fall for any bad reviews and judge it off of that. Is it a brand new hotel? No, but who is spending their time in Hawaii in the room? The time I did spend in the room was pretty comfortable. In my opinion it was Excellent as the review I'm giving it! I stayed on the 18th floor and had no problems at all. Deamon DawsonSummerville, SC

There's really nothing wrong with this hotel, except that it has all the charm and ambience of an Albanian airport. If you are just looking for a stable base in Waikiki, at a reasonable rate, the Ambassador will do fine. Everything works, including the cable and the wifi. The rooms are spacious, if a bit bland. The staff were, without exception, friendly and helpful. The location is good for shopping, business and exploring the island. Wouldn't recommend it so much for a beach vacation though. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but plenty of coffee shops and restaurants nearby.The biggest minus, apart from the general blandness, is the $20 daily "Resort Fee" which will be charged on top of the room rate, upon check out. I find it rather disingenuous to be forced to pay for the pool and other standard amenities, whether you use them or not. My friends tell me though that this little gimmick is not unique to the Ambassador.Just don't expect any tropical paradise atmosphere.

We were extremely dismayed and upset about the $20 (plus tax) daily surcharge that was not disclosed to us when we paid our initial deposit back in December 2014 via Booking.comOn check in very late at night, a staff member gave us the $20 Resort Amenity Fee sheet and when we questioned him about this he said it was already included in our initial room rate and not to worry about it. The fee did include Wi-Fi - which makes it expensive when MacDonald's is just down the road and you can get Wi-Fi via akaNet for $24.95 per monthWhilst staying in the hotel we took this issue up with front office staff numerous times, who finally agreed to refund one lot of $20. They say they do not have the authority to refund the balance of $20.We paid the fee to finalize and clear our account (and to do the right thing) however we are extremely upset about the lack of transparency in this fee. We had been traveling for 7 weeks now in many different hotels and not one hotel tried to hoodwink surcharges without prior signed authorization by us.We feel this undisclosed, hidden surcharge fee is designed to keep their room rates down in order to capture internet bookings and is not fair and transparent.We have since sent an email to the GM with no response - surprise surprise!

The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located within a 10 minutes walking distance to the beach and shops. Room are a little outdated and the actual shower (at least in the room I stayed in, was in need of serious remodeling). Room rates varied every night I was there between $90-$135 which may sound like it's on the cheaper side, but that doesn't include the $25 parking fee or $20.94 amenity fee. I would say the hotel is very clean regardless of remodels needed and the staff is VERY responsive!

Good location, 10 minute walk from the main street blocks, stores and the beach.Comfortable room but tiny towels, small shower and small beds.The big disappointment are the extra costs - parking & resort fees (our wi-fi was included through Expedia). If your rate does not include that prepare to pay at least U$ 45/day for parking & resort. You can get better deals than that elsewhere if those are not included.

Had a great stay in Waikiki, it's a great location, with stunning beaches.The Ambassador has a great location, really helpful staff but the rooms are really run down. We had a room with a kitchen and it was function but that was about it.Given we were in such a great location we didn't really spend a lot of time there but just don't expect great rooms.Other positives were filtered water and a free drink bottle, bikes (2hrs free), games room and the gym was good with modern equipment.

The rooms are quite dated and the airconditioning can be noisy, having said that the accommodation is very good for the low cost that I got it for. The Ambassador would have to keep the low price in order to jutify the problems. There is only the small old fashioned airconditioning in each room which is very effective but can be noisy even coming from other rooms at night. However these usually get turned off at a reasonable hour. The rooms are kept very clean and tidy each day, the staff are very friendly and helpful and the amenities are very good. It is very close walking distance to Waikiki beach and shopping. Highly recommended.

These guys ding ya for everything. They will say only 120 a night till ya get here. Then it's 20 bucks a person for the am amenities which is the wifi and the pool. Then it's 25 more bucks for the parking. So now it's 205 a night. After paying all that you arrive in your room which you find out is a complete dump. So I would not stay here there are way better places for this price. Bunch of crooks here and there customer service is terrible.

I recently stayed at this hotel. I must say my experience was excellent. The General manager Roy Yamamoto is awesome he is the best.His problem solving techniques are exceptional. I must also give a shout out to managers Adrian and Rovell these guys was awesome they made my stay the most enjoyable ever. The rooms were clean the housekeeping staff was great. All I can say it was worth every penny and I would recommend this hotel anytime. Hopefully this quality stay the same. All the best guys.Philip Michael Whyte

September 4-6. Staff was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Helped us re local dining and where to go re buses. Located on Kuhio and very affordable as nothing fancy, just what we wanted . For money paid a great value. Nice pool. Clean and neat.Staff told us at check-in of the $20 per day cost for great filtered water machine and portable refillable collapsable water bottle and usage of bikes, etc covered Not reflected in cost per day usually quoted. Would recommend to anyone.

on the 5th floor of our hotel , Beautiful scenery of Waikiki , the mountains n high rise buildings , during nite's , our view from our balcony , Awesome !!, we even watched a fireworks display from the Hawaiian Village Hotel ( on Friday night's only )We also had a full kitchen , stocked with dishes , pot's n pan's , kitchen utensils , the entire kitchen appliances , great hotel !!

The Ambassador hotel is a few blocks away from the famous Waikiki beach which makes it easy access by walking, however, the hotel itself is showing its age and needs some care. The hallways and elevator reeked of a foul odor and inside our room there were areas of rust and paint pealing off the walls. The bed was not very comfortable for me but I made it work. The kitchen area was okay. Daily maid service is available and they did an great job cleaning up. Each and every hotel staff I talked to was attentive, polite and helpful.

It was our first time staying there and we were disappointed by both the service and facilities. It was like a motel to the fullest extent. When I was checking in the receptionist tried to charge me "amenity fee" for the swimming pool, games room etc which were already closed when we got there. I told her we would not be able to use the facilities any way and I wasn't informed of this upon booking, and she gave me attitude of "pay the money or get the hell out". Our room was less than desirable. It wasn't designed very well. I don't know what kind of designer would think it's good idea to put the closet inside the bathroom, no one can get to it when someone is using the bathroom. The air conditioner was as loud as a lawn mower. The elevator was a scary nightmare, the one in the middle won't move without vibrating so violently, hopefully they have got this fixed. I understand that this hotel is in an old building and it is not very expensive for its location, and I can tolerate the infrastructure, what made me upset was really the service.
Good hotel for the price. Nothing fancy and basic facilities but clean and just enough. Great location for buses, Waikiki beach, shops, restaurants etc.Staffs and cleaners were helpful all friendly:)

I spent 9 days at the Ambassador as I was getting my daughter moved in to HPU. My room was on the 9th floor; It looked just like the pictures on the website. The water bottle service was very nice. Along with the wifi and the borrow a bike was easy to use. The staff was wonderful when I had a question about how to get someplace. The bus stop was right in front and you can walk to many of the shops and beaches. On the days we rented a car it was easy to use the parking area. The pool was clean as were the weight room. The housekeeping staff when above and beyond to keep our room clean ( even while we were buying and staging in the room new item each day to furnish my daughters loft Apt) Washing clothes was convenient and cost under $5. To wash and dry. I was impressed with the downstairs lobby and outside courtyard areas always being clean with how many people were walking in and out of the place. When ever I plan to visit my daughter this will be my 1st hotel of choice.

beware of leaving this place early, poor property, decent location, bewarecrummy bathrooms, boring furniture, mold on a'c vents, depressing lobby, cost me 1000 usd for two nights because we left early which the front desk said 2 days before it was no problem. one of top bad hotel shaft jobs i ever got. and i travel alot!

The hotel was centrally located and within walking distance of the Waikiki beach. The staff were pleasant and was good value for money. The room was clean and spacious and had a kitchenette attached as well.

Clean and very reasonably priced for Waikiki, but you get what you pay for. If you're just looking for a place to sleep that is clean and doesn't cost much, this is perfect. We had a City View room with Kitchenette, which was fine. However, if you're thinking "Hawaii Resort Vacation", this is NOT for you. This is on par with a Motel 6. Although WiFI is available, I found it very unreliable (wait. wait. disconnect. wait. reset). I'd recommend this for someone looking for a room that doesn't cost an arm and leg -- knowing it's just a room, nothing special. Mattress was so-so. On the one PLUS side, the water refill station in the lobby was great (all hotels in Waikiki need one!!). Finally -- if you are afraid of heights, this is NOT the hotel for you--one of our party was NOT happy about the outdoor hallways (open to the sun, wind, air... and many, many, many stories down!!).

The hotel was reasonable. Only a problem I had was the elevator. It was so slow and it sometime took me minutes to get on it. Otherwise I did not have problems. People at the front desk were very helpful.

This motel was extremely clean, and the daily cleans were fabulous!It wasn't flash but it was comfortable.Pool hours were a little on the lean side 10am - 7pmWalking distance to shops, restaurants, beach, buses etc

It's totally different view what web page offer. It's very noisy because parking lot located just by lanai. We can't open the lanai, there're smoking smell, noisy.. terrible view.. Front desk, it's not kind. They do not listen you. They just speak hotel policy like recorder. though you're local and show local ID, you need pay $25 parking fee if you don't reserve the room under the special(Kamaaina; hawaii local residents) rate. Very bad experience. I will never go and sleep there.

We could not make it to Waikiki because of a flight conflict. Cancelation was honoured without any problem but refund took over a week to be received. Communication about delays was fierce. I will try this hotel again in the future.

One of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at. Rooms could use some upgrades, such as new cabinets in the kitchenettes, but the cleanliness of the hotel and room made up for it. I would stay here again!

The hotel is walking distance to the beach and almost every restaurant and if not, the bus stops right outside. The hotel itself is shabby and in dire need of upgrades and repairs. If you're looking for a no frills basic bed, TV and shower, this is it. The staff was EXCELLENT and knowledgeable and most of friendly. Karla at the front desk is a complete ROCK STAR.

review_body: We were travelling as a family of five and had two rooms - one with a full kitchenette, which was handy. We stayed on the sixth floor, which could've been why it was really noisy, I'd expect any hotel in Waikiki to be noisy. Great location though, close to the freeway and the main strip in Waikiki, about a 15 minute walk from the beach. Great to have The Coffee Bean and a Whaler's General Store right next door! Also loved having filtered water + ice machine + laundry. They also had bikes which we could have borrowed, but sadly we didn't have enough time and ended up driving around. We had two separate stays, one at the start and one at the end of our holiday and they did run out of parking entry cards during our second stay so make sure you check in early so you don't miss out. Hotel staff were very accommodating though and made sure that our rooms were at least on the same floor and that we got a parking card as soon as they had a spare one.Great for just a few nights!

Don't expect a 4 or 5 star hotel. I'm being generous by saying it was a 3 star to be honest. But the fitness area and game room was nice. The furniture and decor was very outdated. And it looks better in the pictures. Much better. It has more of a motel feel to it. Maybe even a place you'd take a hooker. The shower is small. If you're trying to save money, this is for you. But it's not a place to try and be romantic or anything like that. I had the 2 bed suite with the kitchen and city view. Convenient location. Parking is $25 a night. Oh and there's is a $20 per day resort fee. I wouldn't stay there again.

Hotel was in need of a bit of updating but plenty of room and a good location. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Location was great for many attractions, shops and cafes. Very useful having filtered water at hotel to use all the time.

stayed here recently and more than happy. good value ,spacious rooms,good location.. only a short walk and buses out front. staff on front desk were excellent ... friendly and helpful. coffee shop just out front.If we had to have a negative it would be the bed ... husband found it uncomfortable for him.. but other than that would recommend it for a good value base in Waikiki

The staff as friendly and helpful. They provide water bottles and clean drinking water in the lobby. There are beach bikes to borrow/rent. And that's all of the nice things I can say. They change you $20+ for the "activities fee". This is a daily fee tacked on to your bill at the end. Regardless if used or not. We had no idea. It's not mentioned anywhere. Just be aware. The rooms are sad and less than basic. We were just sleeping there so I thought it would be alright. It was depressing to wake up there every morning. The rooms do not have a"partial ocean" view as advertised unless you hang off of the balcony. The street is extremely noisy starting at about 4:30 am. I'm sure you could find a better inexpensive hotel. I would never stay here again.

Easy access to the beach via the beautiful park across the road. Easy walk to shops and all Waikiki has to offer. Cathy at the front desk was fabulous. Check in and out painless. We arrived early and she arranged to have our room ready early and minded our luggage while we went for a walk.Rooms are a good size but fairly dated and not very flash. We found it was clean and tidy. We chose the Ambassador as we wanted to be able to cook for ourselves as it is very difficult to eat out in Waikiki when you have dietary issues. ABC shop downstairs where we could get all we needed.We were able to walk to everything from the Ambassador which was great.

Good value hotel in Waikiki. Good service. Big rooms with kitchenettes. Firm beds. Hot water. Short walk across a park to beach. Balcony has a five foot concrete wall so views are from standing only. Concierge in lobby very helpful.

review_body: Four of us stayed at the Ambassador Hotel during the Lions International Convention in Waikiki from Jun 22nd - Jul 1st, 2015. The front desk staff were very welcoming and friendly on our arrival. The Ambassador saved us when the 4 person Condo we booked at the Ilikaii lost our reservation and we had two weeks to find somewhere else to stay. We paid $2500 for the Ilikaii Condo in Sept 2014 through the FlipKey and the owner Gail Chin who confirmed our reservation. When looking for another place to stay the Ilikaii still showed available for our dates but the price had gone up to over $5,000. I think she the owner heard there was a Convention coming to town. I tried to send a bad review on the Ilikaii condo but as we never actually got to stay there I was unable to submit one. Anyway the Ambassador saved our bacon as everywhere else I tried to book was sold out. After hearing of our problem with the Ilikai they also upgraded us to a room with a kitchen which was nice of them. The only complaint I have is the street noise and the garbage trucks picking up early in the morning. The pool was also nice and I did spend some time there. I recommend the Ambassador Hotel.

For a kind of blah looking hotel, the staff was great and it was spot on with what we needed. Their filtered water station and complimentary water bottles were wonderful and saved us a bundle.Our room had a broken microwave and the maintenance man was extremely quick and efficient and replaced it with a new one. My only regret was they didn't have coffee pots included in their kitchens

First their standard suite/room had chipped walls & doors, stained walls, a stale smell & cracked shower tile. After complaining & showing them pictures, they gave us an "upgraded" room. It was also stained & chipped walls with paint chipping, ripped curtains, mildew on the shower tiles, rust and a mildew smell in the refrigerator & believe it or not a bikini lining suck on the wall in the bedroom. we booked it out of there fast. Also they're parking lot was full so we had to pay in cash to park our car in the next hotel lot who ripped us off and charged us $20 plus $2 everything we entered their lot. We still had to pay even though we didn't stay the night. I had the heebee jeebies all night.

My sister and I had to fly back to Honolulu for my mother's passing, we stayed at the Ambassador hotel, the staff were wonderful and treated us well, I loved the purified water fountain and filled my water bottle everyday. The hotel had a full kitchen so we were able to cook our own meals and our stay was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again.

Although not flashy at all, we loved staying here. Felt very comfortable and staff were excellent. Location was good, being close to everything. It could do we total refurbishment - a facelift if you like - then it would be fab!

I read all the reviews before booking a room here and was prepared for some issues but none of them really materialized. This is not a brand new property by any means built in the 1960's I would guess, there was some wear and tear evident in our room, a fresh coat of paint would have helped and perhaps some newer furnishings. However, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, we got a little kitchenette which was very handy and the A/C unit appeared new and worked well which was a good thing as it was in the 90's with 90% humidity when we were there. Parking was $25 a night which I guess is pretty standard for the area. There was also a $20 a night "amenity" fee which we knew about up front. The only "amenity" we really used was the internet so it would be nice if they had some variable fee depending on the "amenities" used but perhaps this is being nitpicky. The staff was very nice and housekeeping did an excellent job. While several blocks away from the beach it was pretty close to all the action in Waikiki from a shopping and dining standpoint. It is not the Waldorf but you are not paying for the Waldorf either. If you are looking for elegant accommodations with rooms designed and appointed by Martha Stewart this ain't the place for you. If you want clean comfortable, reasonably priced accommodations then go for it.

We stayed one night and whilst it was clean ...it is a pretty old hotel.Good sized rooms but sparsely furnished.The girl on help desk is awesome... she was really helpful.As hotels go , this is convenient and cheap and cheerful.

Our initial plans didn't include air conditioning, cleanliness, bug repellant, enclosed indoor shower, or a toilet with the ability to flush used toilet papers down it. No soap anywhere and one towel each for the whole week. Apparently my son and I are just not hippie enough to vacation that way. That wasn't even the half of it actually. So after NOT sleeping barely at all due to the worry that the second bug crawling on me will be bigger than the last or the anxiety due to the fact that I have to climb up and down the loft with a lantern to get to the restroom outside with even bigger surprises - at 5am, I kid you not, the sprinklers came on and yes it was very loud and splashed against our wall with a thorough slapping. Anyway, at that moment I grabbed my phone to the rescue and Trip Advisor gave me excellent options to abandon this hell I was supposedly calling my first night of relaxation. It was a toss up but thankfully I chose well this time and my son and I enjoyed our stay at the Ambassador Hotel Waikiki. When we first got there we were told that we can't check in till noon and I understand protocol but Kerri the other registration desk representative heard my story of my previous night and offered a suite since it was available for no additional charge. Either I looked like the night I had just had or she sincerely wanted to make what was wrong so far right. I appreciate Kerri's efforts and want her to be recognized as a definite gem among all of the other dazzling people who we were able to meet during our stay. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and the Coffee Bean and Tea leaf right outside of the hotel was icing on the cake.

First time to Hawaii with my family. We arrive there and our rooms are on different floors. So they switched them to 3 small twin size beds in each room terrible. Tv audio kept going in and out. Showers are sooo small i have never seen this before. Beware everything cost: 25 for parking 25 for amenities.Will never return here.

Traveled for a one week vacation and stayed at the Ambassador. It is the sister hotel to the Pacific Beach Hotel in Waikiki Beach. The Ambassador Hotel building is slightly on the older side, but very reasonably priced and very conveniently located. It is within walking distance of Waikiki Beach (within 15-20 minutes). It is also just one to two blocks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There are a lot of good restaurants close to the hotel if you do not want to go down to Waikiki Beach for dinner every night. I thought that the Ambassador hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel has free internet service, a swimming pool, a free business center for hotel guest use. It also gives each guest a free water bottle to use on their daily excursions around Honolulu. For anyone who wants a simple, conveniently located, and relatively inexpensive place to stay near Waikiki, I would recommend the Ambassador.

New furniture but old and poorly maintained and underlit bathroom.Very noisy building, I could hear doors slam all the time as well as the cleaners knock the walls, even on the upper and lower floors. Better sleep heavily and not be jet-lagged!WiFi ok, no p2p downloading or you'll get blocked. Business center gives free internet access, pc and printer. Tiny pool, only open between 10am and 7pm (therefore full of kids).Elevators not in great condition, I got stuck in one of them with Japanese tourists for 5mn.Conclusion: you get what you pay for.

It was alright, nothing Im use too next time I will book my own room instead of throught Expedia who doesnt have updated pictures. The rooms had 3 twin hard beds that felt like jail beds. The location is great but the rooms are not so great, they charge for everything including parking at 25 a night.

The Ambassador-hotel-waikiki is nicely located near the split of Kalakaua and Kuhio Avenues. Easy walk to back but my "city view" room on the fourth floor had very little view. Why is it that in order to have a non-smoking floor it was so low? The in and out front desk activity seemed to be on going throughout the day - obviously a popular destination. The room was adequate but then again I had to walk the entire length of the building to get to mine, but of course somebody has to. The staff was very friendly. So if you want an average hotel stay, which I did, this is the place. There is a small general store that seems to be well -stocked on the corner, but a candy bar, bottle of tea, and small cup of ice cream will cost over $8!. Nothing is cheap in Waikiki, so parking is an additional $25 per day. I tried repeatedly to get connected to wifi and the front desk acknowledged that there were problems.
