review_body: The rooms are very clean, the hotelpeople are very nice, free towels for beach or swimmingpool, plastic bottles to full your water. If you need something, they can always help you. We had a great 13 nights in the hotel. Maybe I forget something. (fitness and wasmachines) Good hotel for everybody!!!!!!!

Older hotel with clean rooms and wonderful, courteous staff!! Great location! Close to beach, restaurants, shopping and bus Extras include: swimming pool, laundry, exercise room, computers, purified water (includes reusable water bottles) and game room.

This hotel is clean, cool and friendly! The staff are so so lovely and kind. My best friend and I stayed in a room with a kitchen it was great to be able to chill your drinks. The air con was great and room services very helpful when necessary. The thing I loved about this hotel apart from the staff was the great security. You cannot use the lifts unless you tap your key card against the reader; this is also the case with the swimming pool. This is a great reassurance.I live in London UK and if I get a chance to go back to Honolulu - I will be looking to stay here Mahalo! X

Staff was super friendly. I stayed at the Hotel for over two weeks in Room 801.Pro:-Conveniently located for me. I stayed for conference and tour so it was a short 10 minutes walk from both the beach and the conference center.-Great price for long term stay over two weeks-Service staff very professional.-Convenient parking location-Onsite laundry, business printing center, game room and pool. Onsite concierge was helpful. Con:-Shower drain was somewhat blocked-Shower only-Internet was slow and unstable. Not sure if just my room or anything else.-Did see two cockroaches during my two weeks stay there.

the hotel is really dated. i have stayed in much nicer hotels/resorts for a similar cost to what we paid for this.. the quality was not much different to the hostel down the road that we stayed in for a couple of nights except that that only cost $30 a night!when we arrived our shower head was broken and our safe wouldn't turn on. didn't like being hit with an additional $80 fee at the end of our stay for 'amenities' either.

Nice hotel, but I was surprised when I was charged a $20 per night resort fee. Not sure if this was the fault of Ambassador or the company I booked through not informing of the fee. For that price increase I probably would have stayed at different hotel closer to the beach and nicer.
Really nice rooms, the staff very very friendly and helpful. Everything right around U.Shops Mall Beach But beds uncomfortable After 2nd day got uncomfortable. But who goes to Hawaii to sleep

I liked this motel because we didn't spend much time indoors and this provided clean convenient lodging. The staff was very friendly, in fact they acted like 5 star resort employees but the building and rooms are dated and a bit stark. A kitchenette was helpful until the maid threw a couple hundred dollars of newly purchased food out because she thought we were leaving that day. While apologetic I was not reimbursed by the motel. The parking is too expensive but mandatory because parking is a bit limited in the neighborhood. It is very close to the beach however and half or a third the price of the newer motels right on the beach. All in all for Hawaii this is a budget minded motel that does what it advertises quite well. With the money we saved in nightly fares we were able to eat out more. No one should go expecting top notch accomodations but the staff are top notch and the location is as well.

I have been a guest here and will return. The staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are roomy, clean and comfortable. I did not use the kitchenette but it was well supplied with dishes, utensils, etc. The tv was not working but was very quickly repaired. Good location and good value!

The AC in my room had a bucket to trap the water... :( Also, the minimum amount of characters is too much here. Please look into shortning this questionnaire, or develop more questions. Thank you very much!

Everything was great. Very clean, staff friendly & helpful. View was nice, had city and ocean combined. Close walk to ocean. Close walk to anywhere in downtown you would like to go to. Free water, Room very clean!

This is NOT a resort that one would use for a "fabulous" vacation. My family and I have stayed at this hotel a few times, literally to only sleep. We visit friends/family and they live in a small condo, so we need room to sleep. In the past, we found this hotel to be good value for what we are using it for, however, this year was the first year that they added the resort fee of $20/day. After staying for a long stay, this made the bill outrageous for the value of the room. The hotel needs maintenance, we had to move rooms at 11 at night for a wet wall and floor from the AC inaccurately installed. Although they upgraded us to the condo room, it wasn't much better in appearance, nor amenities. The doors barely shut, the floor tiles were all cracked and coming up (my kid cut his toe on one). Our family just kept reminding each other, this is just to sleep, and we are visiting family/friends staying mostly with them. WE will look for another place to stay for our next visit. The price doesn't justify our value now. The resort fee makes the rate the same as the nicer hotels in the area.

We stayed at the Ambassador for two nights in June. We chose this hotel for its (for Waikiki standards) low rate.The staff was generally very friendly and helpful, even when it was obviously hectic. Our room with kitchen on the sixth floor was very spacious and clean. But, much like the rest of the hotel, offered little frills. The a/c can get noisy so we didn't use it much while we're in the room. Nonetheless a pleasant room, with a huge bed! The pool looked nice (didn't use), and the complementary water-bags are a nice bonus. We requested a late checkout twice, which was not possible or at least 'problematic'. But the alternative luggage hold was sufficient in hindsight :)All things considered we'd very much recommend the Ambassador for its staff, location, room and overall value.

No Restaurant, or food is available. The parking charge is separate which should be part of the extra resort fee.the rest is fine & average , the front desk helps & concierge offers good tours for your trip

Im trying to do if different, I want to review our first day and Last day stay here at hotel. Well it was a great first day experience... Yes it is a old hotel but it will do if You planning on spending your money on activities. The only thing downside is you have to pay parking each day and the amenities is not included in what you paid for the first time you book your hotel. I will understand if its a Parking fee but to use there Pool and fitness center is $20 a day which on top of what i paid for the hotel is additional $200 something which it puts me us on a tight budget and we are supposed to be spending our Money on Gifts and OUR wedding anniversary Dinner, now we have to make some changes. The staff are great. Very accommodating. Overall for first day is great just the additional fees r the downside.From the Carbonell Family!

I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and the price. I wasn't disapointed. Yes, the rooms are a little old and dated, but for the price, they are a decent size and clean.We arrived at 8.30am due to an early flight and the excellent reception staff were able to check us in (with an upgrade) to a partial ocean view room on the 17th floor. The balconies are not much, but they do mean you can have fresh air and look out to the ocean. The two double beds were pretty comfortable and having a full kitchen helped save money on buying food. The bathroom is definitely only 3 star, with a tiny shower recess and single sink (no vanity or bench top). On the up side, the water pressure was good (girls with long/thick hair will love it for washing out conditioner) and the room itself is large enough to dress in, with the full length mirrored double closet located in the bathroom. There are only three lifts in the entire complex, so give yourself extra time to get down to the lobby. You are not allowed to use the stairs.The wi-fi is good and free. They give you access codes for up to 3 devices when you check in, but were happy to provide an extra cope when requested. I was a bit disapointed that for the daily 'resort fee', the pool (that is tiny) was only open from 10am to 6pm daily and there is no spa. They do, however, provide free beach towels and bike rentals.There are only three machines in the guest laundry, and being a budget friendly hotel, they are in constant use.I have to say the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is very good for the price and if you are not up for a short walk to most locations, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. If going to the beach, I'd suggest walking through Fort Derussy park. The beach there is excellent and not as packed as closer to the big resorts. Overall, very good for the price, but it is not a high end hotel. The money we saved on accomodation meant we could splurge on nice dinners and shopping!

Even though this hotel is in downtown Waikiki and very close to the beach, it isnt very noisy. It can be a little difficult to get to the first couple of times. The rooms were clean and comfortable and secure parking on the premises. What I liked about this is that with the parking card that you get, you are guaranteed a parking spot which is great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Most of my business was on the western side of the island, so it was kind of inconvenient to keep bouncing back and forth each day, but that was my own fault. This will be a comfortable stay for anyone that reserves a room here.

This was our 3rd stay at The Ambassador!We were a little disappointed to be located on the 2nd level on this last visit.We believe that had we requested to be relocated to a higher level (depending on availability) we probably would have been!We like staying here, value for money, great location & facilities, friendly & helpful staff.Good pool & area, free 2 hour bike ride each day, good wifi.Good sized room including a full kitchen! Furniture a little dated but that's not a big deal!It suits us well & we'll stay again!!

It a 10!!! Everything was wonderful for us at the Hotel..it was comfortable very clean and enjoyable we had a nice view and no noise..we got to ride bikes for FREE every day for two hours..xbox free..Down stairs is a coffeebean and store a lake across the street.you are in a great location here close to the the buses and taxis pass by every minute the main drag is walking distance. To restaurants and Hotels beaches we will go back to stay here again..can't. Wait.✈

The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. But you should go expecting "motel-like" conditions with regard to general appearance of the rooms and condition of the furnishings. Keep in mind that partial ocean view should be described as "you can see the ocean if you are standing on the balcony and you turn your head and lean a little". We paid extra for the partial ocean view but when we realized you could not actually see the ocean from the windows while inside the room we changed to a room with no view. The change was smooth and the staff were happy to help accommodate.We had our two children with us and they were very pleased with the pool. Proximity to shops, restaurants and so forth was very good. even when walking with the kids. It was reasonably close the beach.Overall, good for the price (when considering how expensive Waikiki can be).

great location, great price, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms what more could you want. Easy access to the $2 trolley busses and short walk to beach. Nice kitchen if you want to use it. Walk to everything from Ross dress for less to Gucci or Armani. Great restaurants everywhere. Can't wait until I get back to the Ambassador.

Excellent Emelyn at the front desk is great! We were on the 17th floor corner room and the views were fantastic. Everything about our stay was great. Thete is alot of activity on this corner so exciting as well.

Never again!! The $20 a day resort fee was a total rip-off. All we got for $100 were two plastic bags for filtered water. If you followed the instructions on the bag, they were useless. The hotel was poorly maintained, disintegrating wall board in the bathroom, rusty metal door frames, very noisy fluorescent light. If I knew when I booked, what I know now, I would have not taken the package and booked the flight and hotel separately.

This hotel is over priced and you do not get anything. You pay a extra $20 per night for a yellow canteen. Stay at your own riskThe cleaners are pretty good, they continued to clean our room on a daily basis. Think of this, it's like staying at a motel but paying Hilton hotel prices.

Booked my trip a week in advance, got upgraded to a kitchen. The hotel is about 3 streets over from Waikiki beach. There are several restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff was outstanding!

Last week my husband and i stayed there and I couldn't believe how bad the room was. We requested a queen bedroom and when we got there they gave us a room with 3 twin beds. When we ask they said they did not had any rooms with queen beds. The staff was nice but when it came to cleaning the room they never would put the iron board in the closet. Were i left it i would always find it there. The bathroom had a lot of water damage and no repairs. If you're are looking for great vacation I would not recommend this hotel.

Extremlly pleasent and helpful staff ,from the front desk to housekeeping .Short walk to the beach and the night life of Waikiki .In the process of upgrading the rooms with new bedspreads etc still a little way to go with some rooms .But overall a pleasent experience .Home away from Home .

the friendliest staff in the world...and I mean that, knew all our names ,were very attentive, our suite was spacious and very clean, perfectly located, the pool was very clean as well, all around experience EXCELENT !

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a couple of days last week, and to say that you get what you pay for with their accommodation would be an accurate summary of our stay. I give them two stars for the strategic location, comfortable bed, and courteous staff--but that's about it. We got a room with a 'partial ocean view' with kitchen and king bed; the view leaves much to be desired, the kitchen we didn't really use, but the king-sized bed as I said is rather comfy. However, I didn't realize the bathroom doesn't come with a tub, and while I can do without a tub, the standalone shower drain does not drain at all. By the time I finish showering (15 minutes tops), the water is already up my ankles! How icky is that?All in all, I say spend your hard-earned money on accommodations elsewhere. That's what we plan to do the next time we visit the island, that's for sure.

It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel for my first time. Received an upgrade of the room. Staff is friendly, knowledgable and available. Very convenient for walking distance to places all around Waikiki!See you all again in the near future!

Good size could use a couple of upgrades In the beds more comfortable blankets . Better working ac . Inform the guest of the pool and better dryers that do nt take 2 hours to dry . Show what the actual room looks like . Needs to get upgraded ASAP . The carpets old . The cabinets need to be cleaned .

I stayed here for one night after arriving back from another island at a late flight. The check in counter staff was very friendly. I was given a reusable water bottle bag to refill since they wanted to save bottles and suggested that I refill my bottle each day. Which was a pretty good idea. I was travelling by myself but the room I booked had three beds. So I had a big room to myself. There was also a balcony. The view wasn't much but it was still a nice idea. I was on the 3rd floor but I couldn't really hear the traffic from outside.The air conditioner was inside the room and kind of noisy but I just left it on because I didn't want it to be stuffy. The room was clean and there is wifi offered. The bed was comfortable but the pillow is a bit too soft for my liking but it's ok.There is a $20 amenities fee, but it seemed like there were a lot of things included that I did not use. Check out is 12pm. I read that people felt that the hotel was a bit dated but for me, I found it alright. The elevator at the lobby can only be used if the card key is pressed against it. That seems pretty high tech.The hotel is probably a 20 minute walk to the beach. It is also pretty north west of the Waikiki shopping area, so it is a bit of a walk.

I actually had a reservation booked at an Aqua hotel for the Memorial Weekend but 2 weeks later the Ambassadors rates beat the prices! This time i took a double room as compared to the triple last time. The room is great with the kitchen and large bathroom. Amenities are ok tho I didnt realize many hotels charge for them now. Other than that the stay there was great!

We stayed for six days at a very reasonable price. The beach was just a five minute walk away. The 1bd suite was very comfortable for four of us. We each had our own bed. The view was great. We had a partial ocean view and city view. I recommend this hotel for parties of four. The beds weren't super comfortable, but they served their purpose. The hotel in general needs an update, but we enjoyed our stay.

A good place to stay. Accessible to tourist spots. Close to waikiki beach and has a bus stop at the front that goes directly to Ala Moana Center. We got a room complete with kitchen and fridge. Would highly recommend this hotel for families or 2-3 pax.

Very affordable for Waikiki. Nice area. Bus stop nearby. Trolley stop nearby. Restaurants short walk. Could hear morning trash dumpster trucks from 11th floor in early AM. Nice views from outside corridors.

Nothing fancy, ver low-key. If you're coming to Hawaii to see the sights, be at the beach all day and not stay in your hotel other than to sleep then this is the place. It's conveniently located. You can walk to the strip, beach, stores and there's a busline close by. This place is reasonable. I would recommend here if you're not looking for anything fancy.

review_body: The hotel staff very friendly and helpful, anything we needed they were very attentive! It's just the room that was disappointing, the size was great and it was clean, I actually got and paid for an upgraded room partial ocean view, with a one bedroom, kitchenette. Maybe just a nicer color, the sitting area just bland, the room was nice and clean you just wanted a little more of something kind of felt like a hospital, you knew it was clean but you didn't want to hang out if that makes sense! For having a wrap around balcony yes even the view was pretty killer! It's all in the details.

I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a nice, clean & almost like home atmosphere, so accessible to amenities, walking distance to shopping areas, eateries & such! The staff were very helpful & accommodating!

The hotel is a great place to stay if you're trying to save a couple dollars. You are close to everything you need while in Waikiki, and there are even kitchenettes if you would rather cook something than go out and spend another $100. First of all, yes it's a little dated. However, the rooms ARE clean, and they are cleaned every day. Secondly, there are silverware/pots/pans/plates for two. There is a Whaler's grocery right outside the door where you can pick up some things and just a couple of blocks from restaurants if you dot want to cook. Thirdly, there is a small fitness room with up-to-date equipment and a pool to lounge by. There is a game room with 2 X-boxes on those rainy days you don't want to walk outside. For the price they charge, and the location it's in, this place is totally worth it. Live Aloha! Mahalo

A frequent visitor to Honolulu, we have stayed at a lot of hotels. This was our first ever visit to The Ambassador Hotel. We always thought because of it's age, it would be subpar, but we were wrong. Here's my breakdown:Reservation: Excellent on-line reservation system. Most websites pictures makes the hotel rooms look better then they really are. This website was not as bad. 5 StarsCheck-in: You have to park in loading zone stalls (I think there were 5) which are occassionally blocked by tour mini-busses or taxi cabs, You walk in, check in, then use the gate card they provide to go into hotel's parking. Remember to take in you car information- Make/Model and license number. When checking in there is no clear place to stand in line, and check in stations are spread out, so stay alert for when you are next. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. 4 starsElevator/security: you need your room key to get into elevator. semi-secured, although anyone waiting for elevator door to open can still walk in and go to any room in hotel. 4 starsRoom: The room we had included a full kitchen. The bathroom was very roomy, lighting good, a/c good. When you turn off the a/c you can hear the traffic outside. tv service good, but screen kind of small. wifi enabled rooms were a plus. The rooms show their age, but they did an excellent job in keeping it clean, and kind of updated. 4 starsAmmenities: Room service consist of a paid vendor who will pick up and deliver food to you from various restaurants in Honolulu. delivery price is fair, but menu book looks dated, so am not sure on prices of food, and establishments. Hotel gym is great, be sure to wear your shoes. They give you a very inexpensive water bottle to fill up in lobby, around the corner.outside of lobby, Whalers General store-overpriced but when you want/need it, you'll pay. They also have a coffee shop right outside door.Check-out: Before checking out, remove car from parking lot, and park in loading zone, then go and check out. You have to return parking gate pass so you will get locked in if you don't do this. Check out process was simple and easy.Location: located right in the beginning of Waikiki, so very easy to get in and out. I rate it better then the hotel across the street, but very slightly higher in price.

I feel we were given the worst room of the hotel because book online with Expedia. Our room was moldy smelled disgusting. Rusted appliances and dirty shower and bathroom. Sheet and blankets were snagged and looked old. We asked if there were any better rooms and were moved to a different room did smell a bit better but otherwise was not really any better. The money we spent on this hotel was not worth it at all. Terrible experience would never stay here ever again.

My husband and I ended up booking this hotel last minute because we were supposed to stay at his friends house but because of my deathly allergy to their cat we couldnt stay there. Im a wee bit high maintenance when it comes to cleanliness of hotel rooms, so I depend on the pictures they provide. The pictures are a lie!! We were upgraded to a suite and on the surface it seemed clean but it didnt feel clean. The room hasnt been updated since the 60s, there were weird stains on the bathroom walls, the balcony was filthy, the air conditioner sounded like a 747 jet, the carpet was disgusting, the beds were the springy and unconfortable, you have to go outside to go get to your room like a cheap motel, its dark and dingy and to top it all off. They charge AN AMENITY FEE and $25 for parking. The sheer audacity of this is unbelievable to me. The girl at the front desk wasnt the most pleasant, the front lobby was tacky. I really could go on. My point is, this place is a rip off. we paid over 200 bucks a night, just stay at a 4 star and have a pleasant trip. This two day nonsense was the lone dark spot of our trip.

It\s a pretty basic hotel, but clean and the service is good. The location is handy to shopping and restaurants and the full kitchen is nice if you don't want to eat out all the time. The elevators are a bit slow at times.

It is convieniently located property in waikiki.It is very clean ,with very friendly and helpful staff members.All appwaer to be very responsible.PLiberalsupply of clean disposible water bottles amd abumdant suppl7 of filtered water..Local tour desk is also very helpful in tour booking.The property id good value for money.i would recomend it for stay.

Amenities fee, Ridiculous! Smallest t.v ever, shower suck's, elevator suck's even more, be prepared to wait for at least 10min or more if the elevator is not already packed with other guest. I would definitely not stay here again

I am always nervous about choosing a hotel when travelling to a new place. We chose the Ambassador because of its low cost but were pleasantly surprised by its convenience and location. The small kitchen had the bare nessesities but was perfect for a quick breakfast and light snack.The only issue was the cost of parking $25/day, seemed a little to much.

I stayed 5 night in April,2015. I always use this hotel,when I come to waikiki.Flat & CardAccess parking is easy to me.Connection is simple from airport.Free WIFI is good to me.l come back again.maybe soon.

I was in Honolulu in March, as my fourth trip. Once in 2008, In 2012 with my son, 2013 where I surrendered my appendix to Hawaii, and most recent March 2015. I am 65. Could someone adopt me. I was made for Hawaii. Perfect climate, friendly people, palm trees, gentle breezes, sand, beach, sun, kayak, snorkel and love the atmosphere.

We had the unfortunate experience of seeing a staff member bullying another. A man by the name of Jeff was being extremely rude and unprofessional to a lady he was working with (she seemed new). He was belittling her and almost had her in tears! And infront of customers! We felt extremely sorry for her as she was lovely.The amentity fee is ridiculous, cost us $250 AUD and is what I see as a trick to seem cheaper online.For people thinking of staying, everything asside from this was ok, basic and as expected for the price. Location is good.

While this hotel is old, it's location and price are good for travelers. 5 minute walk to the beach. Kitchens available to assist in overall vacation cost reduction (cook your own food). Easy access to highways for travel around island.Beds are not too comfortable and the paint is peeling in places.Overall, while not a 4 star hotel, our stay was comfortable, enjoyable, and not as expensive as the big name hotels in Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again"

Stayed at this hotel for a week in Honolulu. I'm sure there's more modern looking hotel rooms in Waikiki but the staff was very friendly and the rooms stayed clean. They even give you a water bottle and access to clean water through out your stay. I'd stay again!

I have not stayed at this hotel, but I just have to say that the resort fee is becoming quite standard in Hawaii...just as it already is in Vegas. You cannot be upset with a hotel for your own inability to read the fine print when booking your own travel online. People need to stop acting as if they have been duped. If you are choosing to book your own travel online, and you choose something which has a certain bed, or a resort fee and fail to notice this cost or detail..that is not the hotels fault..geeze people, take some responsibilty

Expedia gave me false information about my room accommadations but the manager in reservations did everything possible to make things right without any extra chage. My 9 night stay was great. It is a wonderful value for the budget conscious guest.

descent location close enough to the beach and a Kuhio shops, Clean hotel, sufficient facilities, overpriced parking, timely house keeping No bells or whistles come with your room. A simple window unit AC, a bed, tiny television, and an older shower.over all i would recommend and i would stay there again,

review_body: $96 + $22 resort later from hotels.com, I could have booked a higher class hotel than this Motel 6 with a ridiculous resort amenity fee that states the following as perks:- Free local and toll free calls- A water bottle to fill because there's no free water - In room safe- Cutting edge Internet- Laundry facility The hotel looks nothing like the pictures and requires you to go outside to the rooms. Like someone else mentioned it's a very high motel and is only 2 stars at most.The best part is for a 3 star they didn't have toothbrushes or even a way for you to buy a toothbrush. I will write another negative review on Hotels.com. Stay away from this place and either stay at a hostel or a 4 star.

Writing this review in the hotel, I'm so annoyed. My brother and I hardly slept last night. We could hear the ding of the elevator every time someone cane up or down. Seriously its a quiet bell, but every time.. Ding! And every word spoken in the hall was clearly audible. Sirens all night! The air conditioner is louder than most planes (did cool off the room) but you'd rather have it on to drown out the other noises. We heard last night that the hotel was fully booked, so we don't have a hope of swapping rooms. But I doubt it would be any different on any other floor. The staff were very friendly(good aloha spirit), that's the only plus. Considering eating the cost and switching hotels. Never staying here again.

My friend and I stayed here in March 2015 for 10 nights. We were on the 8th floor. Got upgraded to the part ocean 2 x double bed full kitchen room - was great!!We arrived at 6am so well before our room was ready but the staff were so kind we stored our bags for a few hours n came back before 1pm and could check in. Hotel just like waikiki is partly old but comfortable, beds were comfy, bathroom big, room was clean, big and spacious, room was cleaned daily. Air con was a little loud but didn't bother me. Hotel is PRIME location!!! Perfect spot in waikiki close to bus stops that take u to pearl harbour, ala moana shopping mall, walking distance to shops, beach, Hilton lagoon, pubs, restaurants! (everything about 10min) Right downstairs is a delicious coffee shop and grocery store- great if u r on a budget! Tommy, travel agent in the lobby was fantastic did us great deals and had great ideas on day trips etc would highly recommend. We booked everything when we got there n didn't miss out on anything being booked out. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is old, dated and not very clean. Our 12 year old who is a seasoned traveller said 'its a little sketchy' here and that about sums it up. The walls are dinged up and have been spot painted with a different color. The bedding and towels could not be considered white. The air conditioner never really cooled the room down but it did sound like a 747 airplane above your head. The bathroom was marginally clean when we arrived and to be honest the whole hotel needs major renovations. The only good thing we could say about the hotel was our view as we stayed on the 17th floor and could see the ocean a few blocks away. Don't get fooled by the pictures on the hotel website, they clearly have been edited to make it look nicer. Do yourself a favour, spend a little more for a nicer hotel.

Let's start by saying the staff are really friendly, and helpful. But that is really where it ends. Our one bedroom suite on the 11 floor had a reasonable view with only three or four high-rise blocking the view back to the beach. If you could get the sliding door open you could use the balcony - managed to cut my finger in the process. The kitchen had a new fridge, microwave and toaster but the entire apartment hadn't seen a paint brush in several decades. We had to take showers at intervals as the shower recess blocked up with water and took an hour or so to drain. Our five night stay cost over $1700 Aussie dollars plus we were slapped with an additional $20 US per day hotel facility when we arrived, a charge for use of the pool (only open from 10am - 7.pm) and a games room that had no games... Xbox had the ring of death as my son called it, but if you are into darts - two dart boards, two darts... no bullseye for this hotel

Had an overnight lay over in Honolulu on my way to Australia. The hotels near the airport are very expense and are of questionable quality and are not close to any restaurants, so I opted to take a taxi into Waikiki to spend the night. Round trip taxi is close to $100 so be prepared. I have been to Waikiki many times in the past, so I really wasn't there to see things for the first time. The hotel was quiet and acceptable. It is a much older hotel and the decor was a bit dated. It did have a kitchenette with refrigerator and dishes. Good place to spend an overnight layover. Be aware that the price quoted does not include a $20 resort fee.

We have our trip coming up and I called the reservation department and they kind enough to change my room reservation to have a kitchen incase we will need to cook or whatever, also this is our one year wedding anniversary and my sister recommend this hotel, reading all reviews is really making me worry and scared, I told Kim from the Reservation department that I didn't want to have the same experience as other people did. I want excellent experience from having a great room and making sure we will have a great time. I am looking forward to our JUNE trip and I will come back to do another review of our actual Experience. Tune in! :)

The Front Desk staff, especially Shandell, was very welcoming and friendly - the epitome of Aloha Spirit. I had requested a specific room, and they made sure that I got it even though I was paying a lower rate. The housekeeping staff (for example Virgie, Cora, and Henry) were always helpful and friendly and the room was always cleaned properly. They all took very good care of me and work very hard. I plan to stay here every time I go to Hawaii.The only downside is that the rooms are a bit dated. One suggestion is that they add sheer curtains. I had a beautiful view, but sometimes the sun shined too brightly and made the room too hot so I had to close the heavy curtains to keep the room cool.

review_body: This hotel is not a hotel. It's an oversize motel. Dirty carpets inside the room and outside getting to your room. You have to go outside to get to your room just like a motel. Inside the room dirty walls, there was actually someone elses hair on the walls of the bathroom. Dirty carpet, closet doors were barely functional. The door jam to my room appeared to have been broken into a few times. Everything is out dated and old. The hotel is in some serious need of updating.

Booked this as a hotel/airfare package for two on Expedia. The package was very good for the price. Hotel has a little kitchenette. Our bathroom/closet combo is a good size, but shower is a little too tight, though that didn't bother me. Hotel is very convenient to world class shopping, and good bars and restaurants on Kalakaua Avenue. Our room lanai had good view of the ocean and Ala wai River and mountains beyond. About a good 7-10 minutes to the beach, and about 15-20 minutes to Honolulu Zoo. There was a little convenient stores and coffee shop downstairs, which I found very nice. Our return flight didn't leave till late at night, and they kept our luggage till it was time to go. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Overall, it was a good hotel, in a good location. I would stay here again when I come back.

I read some reviews before our trip and was nervous but to my surprise it was the complete opposite of the bad reviews! We would go back in a second! Staff was amazing! The rooms were spacious, clean and the location was perfect!The only complaint was the shower took a long time to drain...... I highly recommend this hotel.If you stay here take advantage of the concierge ( tommy) super helpful!!!!

This hotel's location is perfect - it's at the beginning of Waikiki, making it an easy walk to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and the beach. With bus stops right at its doorstep, it's easy to get to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Service was very friendly and seamless, from check-in to check-out, including housekeeping who delivered towels we requested within minutes! The agents at the front desk were quick to suggest us good places to eat. Sure enough, we were satisfied with their suggestion! The room, which was very large, was very clean and had a very nice view of the Pacific Ocean, making it easy to watch the Hawaiian sunset from our balcony. It was easy to gather my family in the large living room area. With the kitchen fully stocked with cooking and dining utensils, we were able to cook a meal in the middle of the night without having to walk and a find a place that was open. Whenever we left the room, a friendly housekeeper would great us, which made the Ambassador very personable for us. Parking was very ample. With Waikiki having limited parking, this place was perfect. Would definitely stay here again!!

The Ambassador is an older property but very well maintained and clean. The location is good, close to the beach, shopping and The Bus stops. Very good and reasonable restaurant right across the street (Vits) and a stop for most tour and activity shuttles - which suggests you have a room on one of the higher floors to avoid some street noise. Rooms are clean, roomy and comfortable although very plain. Housekeeping is excellent. Lobby is without design but usually so busy you don't notice the lack of style. Guests come from everywhere - spoke with Australian, Chinese and guests from Japan. For Waikiki, rates are reasonable and facilities are nice. Pool area is large and comfortable and internet is included in the required resort fee. Would definitely stay there again,

Stayed at this hotel late Jan 2015, picked because it was the cheapest place we could find and we got what we paid for. Do not expect much front his hotel, it isn't awful but you should be aware that it is nothing fancy. If you aren't planning to spend much time in your room, which we weren't, it is fine. The hotel staff were friendly and happy for us to leave our bags when we arrived early. The room was relatively clean, beds fine (although you only get 2 thin pillows so ask for more if you prefer more to rest on). The local is good, it is within a 2-3 min walk of bus stops that get you pretty much anywhere on the shout shore. Air conditioning unit was VERY loud but worked quickly and well to cool room enough so you could turn it off at night right before going to sleep. Room had a kitchen was was great however the power points were a bit iffy.Overall this hotel is fine for a short stay in which you only intend to sleep in the room.

What a joke! We booked a room through booking.com, which advertises free cancellation. A member of our party fell ill and we weren't going to make the trip, so we cancelled the reservation. Two days after the date we would have stayed at the Ambassador, a charge for $150 shows up on my credit card. I contacted them to have it removed, and they told me that because I cancelled, I owed them money for 1 night's stay. I explained to them that there was a cancellation guarantee on booking.com. They didn't care, and weren't willing to do anything about it but tell me to contact booking.com. So I did, and they said that I was charged a cancellation fee. A fee? Fine. A fee would be $25, not the amount of a hotel stay. They also refused to refund me. I will never again use booking.com or stay at the Ambassador Hotel Waikiki. Based on these reviews though, I'm not the only one.

If there ever was a discrepancy in your reservation, ask for Kurt, Assistant General Manager immediately! He was concerned, kind, and most of all, knowledgeable. This hotel really does there due diligence in regard to customer needs and expectations. I would definitely stay here again.
