review_body: ....and I guess you get what you pay for. I think it would be attractive to college kid tourists in Waikiki because it is affordable. And if you have no other standards, then it is ok. I remember those days....but I digress. The location is smack in the middle of shopping and just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach, so if that is what you are there for, that could be considered a plus. Tommy the concierge was very nice and very helpful. Those were the good points. Let me describe the room in 4 words: green cinder block walls. The ac window unit was completely outclassed by the island humidity, and the room was musty to the point of stinkiness, and just plain unpleasant. So, if you are a college kid looking for a reasonably safe, cheap place to crash, go for it. Luckily, I was only over-nighting before catching a plane to the Big Island.

No Refunds or cancellations allowed. You cannot see the room before you give them money. The lobby is nice, they give you water bottles, only fill-able in lobby for drinking water - don't drink the tap water I was warned. Should have been my first clue but since I booked on Priceline, there were no refunds anyway. The pictures on the net, which I showed to the rude clerk, are not of that hotel, she doesn't know what hotel they are of. Cinderblock construction, exposed wiring, chipped oil based prison taupe, dirty carpets,AND WHEN IS THE LAST TIME YOU SAW AN ASHTRAY INSTALLED IN THE HALLWAY???!!! This place hasn't been re-done since perhaps 1960! .... Here! Just look at the pictures! No, that's not a illusion, the lamp is standing tilted.

For your money, is no good enough any more. This hotel is expensive enough for what you get. No table and or chairs on balcony. Scuff marks all over walls and doors, plaster on walls peeling, bathrooms grungy. They over charged my stay by charging me for an extra night and blame Booking.com for the error. When I call the booking company, they blame the hotel. Location is acceptable. You know everything is relative, so some of the more positive comments from other's staying at this hotel, may not have travelled as much as I have. I have traveled extensively and know for a fact you can get better for your dollar. I would not recommend this place.

Stayed here last week as I got in early for my conference and needed a place to stay for 1 night. The hotel is exactly what I expected. Clean and tidy with good value for money but you would be disappointed if you spent your whole holiday here. Rooms are clean and everything in my room worked however rooms are very out dated and really need a makeover. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a good location that we could walk to the main strip in a couple of minutes. It would appear that most of the hotels in this area are of similar age so if you just need a place to stay for a night or two or you plan on being out partying and just need a bed then this place is perfect for you. If you plan on sitting around the pool and enjoying hotel amenities then you may want to spend a bit more cash and stay closer to the beach.All in all it was good value for money but a classic example of you get what you pay for.

We three girls stayed at the Ambassador for 7 nights. It is in a great location on Kuhio Ave and is in walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and in the other direction on Kalakaua Ave shops and arcades plus Dukes Lane where the markets are on. The hotel as constantly stated is old however it is very clean and the staff both cleaners and reception staff are very friendly and go out of their way to assist wherever possible. The room had 3 single beds, a TV, a dining table & chairs, an air conditioner, a fridge, an in-room safe, a kettle (no tea, coffee or milk provided) it was clean and tidy. Down off the lobby area is a filtered water station where you can fill your complimentary water bottles up. Just outside the hotel is a Coffee station and next to it is an ABC store (like our Night Owl) sells everything you may need. We only slept and showered in the hotel anyway as there was too much to see in Waikiki to be stuck in a room. Lastly a resort fee of $20US per night covers free wifi access (worked in our room) the in room safe, free local & toll free phone calls, complimentary water bottles and filtered water station, swimming pool.

The hotel is in a good location, not far from the main action of Waikiki and a short walk to the beach. The staff on check on were great, friendly and accommodating.The rooms however are ordinary. Don't be fooled by the flashy photos, the building itself and the rooms are in massive need of a complete overhaul.Our three bed ocean view suite had a view of the ocean...barely. The third bed doubled as the couch, not a sofa bed but an actual mattress with couch cushions on it. There are very few power points available so bring a power board and the "state of the art WiFi" is temperamental in some areas of the hotel.The air conditioning and kitchen lights were loud and the bathroom and kitchen need to be ripped out and rebuilt.The morning of our departure we didn't even have hot water. Luckily it was a nice warm morning so it didn't bother us too much.The pool area is simple but nice, it never seemed to be overly popular but is a great spot for a quick dip. Probably for me one of the more modern and cleaner areas of the hotel.As far as value though the hotel is probably one of the cheapest in the area. If you're stopping over for one or two night it's great. I definitely would not recommend this for a romantic getaway or a long stay.

My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of our friend who lives on Oahu. He thought the location in Waikiki would be good since some of the area can be a bit doggy and the price was right. I, however, would not recommend this to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki. The hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade. The elevators are scary, they rattle and bounce when they stop at each floor. Two of them went out of service at various times during our stay. The room had a full kitchen, but it looked like it hadn't been used in 30 years. The furniture was chipped and faded and the tv looked to be the size of a 20" computer monitor. Our room did have a nice city and partial ocean view, however enjoying the balcony was often met with cigarette smoke from other tenants close to our room. Parking is also very expensive - $25/day. The only thing holding this place together is the staff. They were wonderful to speak with and made our check in/out easy. We received free water bottles upon check-in, which was a nice gesture (even if the bottles did leak a great deal). Overall, we chose this place based on it's location and price. It is a fairly cheap hotel for the area, however be warned that you are getting less than what you pay for in my opinion.

My friends and I stayed two nights after an NCL cruise. The hotel isn't fancy but the room we stayed in was very clean. It had an in-room safe, refrigerator and electric teapot. We had breakfast both mornings at the little coffee and tea shop just outside the lobby door. I highly recommend the oatmeal! There is also a convenience store with everything you can imagine. Public transportation and shopping are nearby and you can walk to a beach if you want. I recommend Henry's for ice cream - especially the coconut. Also I lost a necklace somewhere along the way and the manager responded to me twice when I asked that they look for it. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for fancy, this isn't it - but who wants to stay in your room in Hawaii!

This hotel is located in the the main Street in Honolulu and is not more than 700 meters from the international convention center. It's also near from Royal Hawaiian mall where you can find almost all what you need. Rooms are clean, roomy and well equipped with small kitchenette.

Your hotel does not stand up to the previews you present on your website. The room are dated, had rotten wood and holes that been patch incorrect and ants. I found hair in my bathroom and the room was half clean. I understand how hard it can be while taken care of so many guests but the 15 minutes I had to wait for a bag carrier on my bags was disappointing.

Very basic equipment which was totally ok considering the price. What was not ok that the bathroom was in a very bad condition (mold and ants). better to spend some more Money and stay somewhere else.

***Looks really were deceiving**** The pictures on the internet look nothing like the rooms shown. The Elevator to the rooms were very nasty and it made us wonder what the rooms was going to look like. When we got off the Elevator to our floor the walls were very dirty and the doors to the rooms. This lead us to believe the rooms were probably not in the best condition. The rooms are worn and outdated and had a very bad odor. There was a couch in our room that was made of vinyl and the cushions were torn and it was not attractive and we didn't even want to sit on it. We had rust on the side of the tub and there was some type of mold growing up under the sink. If we had not already pre paid for the nights we would have found a much nicer place to stay. The sink in the bathroom barley drained. When you would take a shower you would have to stand in ankle deep water because it drained so slow. The room does not even provide a coffee pot for those who like to drink coffee. The Hotel staff have I to say was very pleasant so that was the only nice experience. We will pay the extra money and stay a much nice Hotel that will offer more amenities.

Choosing to stay at this hotel totally depends on your what's most important to you. If you are looking for an ooohhhh-la-la, romantic place for your honeymoon with room service from a 5 star chef, this is not the place for you. For everyone else, this place is great. The rooms are clean. They look a bit outdated but so what. I had internet access plugged right into my laptop. The view from either side of the hotel is nice - ocean, canal or mountains. There's a pool if you want that and some other simple amenities. The location is key. Right in the heart of Waikiki - you can walk everywhere. The reality is, who spends all their time in the hotel anyway? I was only there to sleep and shower. The desk staff was helpful when I needed information. The price was just right. The only bad thing about this hotel is lack of access to the stairwell. I HATE elevators and was forced to endure it everyday. They keep the stairwell locked. I understand the safety concerns but there should be some way that someone who doesn't want to take the elevator can access the stairs.

I have stayed before at the Ambassador hotel, and while it is in need of some upgrading, it was an ok stay and a perfect price. The last stay was a bit different, and that was probably the last time. What I like about the hotel is the location, at the eastern part of Waikiki that is near everything, to include parking at FT Derussy, and a centralized location that allows for easy access into and out of Waikiki. The 2d part is the hotel front desk staff, which really are as good as some as some of the reviews mention. When you have a great staff, you can overcome many of the smaller problems and make for a great stay when folks are so super friendly. The outside walkways give great views of the sunset and also of the rainbows towards the mountains.The downside of my stay was I had a room was sharing with bugs and did not start seeing them till part way through the stay. I had no food in the place, so why they arrived I do not know. I identified the problem to the reception desk, had it checked out, and the room was supposed to have gotten sprayed. Because it was the next to last day, did not see need to change rooms, but should have, since problem was still there the last night. I misunderstood the compensation that was offered, which had thought to be different than what was given. If you decide to stay on the strengths of what the hotel offers - just make sure you request a room change if the same problem occurs.

Strengths and weaknesses about this hotel. Travelled to Oahu with 2 male friends and I needed a separate room for myself. Checked into room 1111 and was comfortable. Moved to friends' room #629 for one night stay and found their room In need of maintenance - believe theirs was in old wing. Small cockroaches came at night in toilet. Good configuration as 1 of the bed was blocked and I had some privacy. Corridors were not well-lighted and felt eerie walking along it at night. But since it was exposed to outside view, felt ok.Hotel is close to Waikiki beach, walking time of about 10-15 min. Also a few public buses ply there and brings you to Polynesian Cultural Centre, Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay and Pearl Harbour. Must say the only good thing about this place is the location.

Definitely not worth the money!!! The images do not match with reality! The room was large and the staff very nice but the kitchen and the bathroom was from the ' 50s, and when we walked in the corridors, it felt as if we were in an open prison. Book anything else!!!

This was our first stay at the Ambassador. The staff there are great, helpful and really friendly. The hotel itself is looking a bit tired and needs refresh. However, saying that it was good value for money. The rooms have everything you need, the internet service was excellent, and the bed was really comfortable. Our only challenge was the noise. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the road outside, and there was a lot of noise from the cars and people out on the street. Also the tour buses come early in the morning and around 5.00 AM each day we heard the beep beep beep as they reversed and parked outside the hotel. Unfortunately we had the misfortune of having a very noisy neighbor who was somewhat nocturnal and enjoyed staying up to 4.00 AM in the morning - which disrupted our sleep a lot. We are a family, and I would have expected the hotel to book young party goers together, and family groups together as each type of customer is looking for a different experience while in Hawaii.The Ambassador was a good value Hotel, but I probably won't be back.

We stayed one night before a week at our timeshare. W e had a very large room that was extremely clean and in a great location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool was a wonderful morning stop. Hotel was older but very well kept and clean. People should not complain and expect a 5 star hotel at a 3 star price. We were also upgraded to a complimentary full size kitchen. Complimentary water bottles at check-in were also a nice feature with filtered water for guests.We would return. Baggage handling and storage was exceptional especially an employee named Denton.

I tried to make a reservation through the website of the Hotel and my request was not complete due to a problem with the website. I did not receive any e-mail confirmation and could not check the reservation in the website. However, for my surprise, I was charged in my credit card for this reservation that I didn't complete.I had already made a new reservation in another Hotel in Waikiki when realized about this and tried to contact the hotel to say that I was not going there as I didn't complete my reservation at the Ambassador Hotel.For my sadness and disappointment they didn't cancel the charge in my credit card and even tried to fix this problem that they caused.I already opened a process with my credit card company to not pay for this but I would like to make sure that everybody knows that this Hotel don't deserve to receive good guests from all around the world.Thank You!

If you are looking for luxury look elsewhere. If you just want a decent place to sleep add Ambassador to your comparison list.The rooms are old and most are two double, or twin beds. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, though. The air-conditioner was rather loud but the evenings were cool enough that we could just leave the large patio door open for ventilation. We were on the 15th floor and had a nice view of both ocean and city. The kitchenette enabled us to save money on meals, and there was plenty of room in the full-size refrigerator.The wi-fi worked adequately although it seemed to bog-down occasionally. A business center, restrooms, and water stations are also available on the mezzanine between the two towers.The pool area was very nice, as well. The location was very good, with the beach and many attractions within walking distance. If you don't need a car you could save money by opting-out of the parking package. The staff were very friendly and helpful. All-in-all we enjoyed our stay.

I wish I had read the reviews before booking so quickly. I thought I was getting a deal for a one night stay, but $80 soon turned into $150. The low nightly rate is a scam since you are charged a "resort" fee once you arrive. Even if you booked DIRECTLY with the hotel online. The sheets are paper thin along with the walls. Everything smells musty because the wall mounted AC unit works 10% of the time (don't worry there are instructions on the wall on how to repeatedly reset your unit.) bring tools you'll need them and the front desk has no time to help. Spend a few extra dollars and book at a reputable hotel and save yourself the nightmares that you'll no doubtably have after sleeping on a squeaky bed and showering in a bathroom with flickering lights.

This hotel had a great location, however it is very old and when we booked we were supposed to have 2 queen beds, and did not get it. Then when we walked in the room it looked like we were walking into the 1980's. Rooms were old, dirty, and just ugh. Thankfully we were not there for the hotel, but I really expected better.

We enjoyed our stay! The staff was fantastic. Everyone we saw was extremely friendly and helpful. The kitchen was nice with a large refrigerator allowing plenty of storage. Great location and the rooms were good. Great coffee place out the front door and I liked the water provided.

All the apartments have kitchens but you would not store food in the seldom used cupboards. Full size fridge/freezers which means you can buy some ice cream for those hot nights. The gym is excellent with new equipment whilst not being too big. I like they have filtered water taps for all guests. The rooms can book out and then get over priced. If you book early enough you can get some great value for money. The reception people were awesome. The hire bikes are great for cruising or adding in some exercise. A burger bar nearby has a $3 3pm cocktail happy hour. It was awesome.

Great hotel -- outstanding staffArrived at hotel, cheerfully greeted by front desk staff, and was promptly assigned a room. Great location: church around the corner; within walking distance to Waikiki beach; walking distance to restaurants; walking distance to great shopping. Outstanding coffee shop right outside the door (not a coffee drinker, but they also served great pastries, smoothies, and milkshakes at reasonable (cheap )prices. Next door to the coffee shop is a "general store" where you can purchase EVERYTHING you might have forgotten. And, if you want a quick lunch to take to the beach, they have loads of options: sandwiches/salads/etc. Back to the OUTSTANDING customer service. We were given a room with a kitchenette (versus a room with a microwave/small fridge). I am diabetic, and it was past due my normal snack/meal time when we arrived (13hr trip from east coast). Had packed food to eat on the plane/cook as soon as arrival in HI, but was drained Mentioned this to the front desk staff (Shantell (sp), who told me about ordering from our room- even gave meal/restaurant suggestions (a restaurant/menu book is located in the room - I ordered meals, and flopped on the bed). She brought up the food almost as soon as I got in bed. She was with the restaurant driver, and she set up the food for me. She always checked to see how I was feeling, and wanted to know if I needed anything -- And, she was sincerely concerned about my and my husband's heath and welfare/enjoyment of the island. (as were others at the hotel front desk). On last day, hubs dropped his wallet while on the elevator -- she brought it to us (someone found it and turned into the front-desk staff). Room was cleaned daily; beds were comfortable; pillows left a bit to be desired (too firm for my taste): great water pressure in shower; nice fluffy bath towels; safe in room; lots of hangers. All in all a great hotel/great location/and outstanding service by front-desk staff. Loving the complimentary water bags while traveling at home. Did not use the pool/gym.

Hotel was within walking distance to Waikiki and plenty of shops. Hotel staff were friendly. Beds were a bit on the hard side, but the pillows were nice. Water bags were given to us to fill whenever we wanted clean drinking water which was a bonus. Also, they provided free surfboard storage. There is a coffee shop right outside the main lobby which was very handy, and there was a Whaler's store right next to that (late at night their sushi rolls are discounted). Although we were on the 9th floor of the hotel, we could hear all the traffic noise on the street below.

I really don't know what you people are complaining about. Our night at Ambassador was only $99 US dollars from Agoda (what a bargain for Waikiki). The check in area was busy and the Manager kept apologising for the hold up, which impressed me right of the bat. We checked in and got given 2 free water bottles for the free water fountain and 2 access codes for free Wi-Fi. The manager was more than happy to give us a map and point out the areas we wanted to see. The room was clean and no I did not see chipping paint or cracked furniture. The carpets were clean, the bathrooms were clean and if I wasn't going on cruise the next day, easy could of stayed a week. The only thing that took the time to wait is the lift, cause its an older hotel than most and to be expected. But we were so high up, I just watched the waves on the beach, so it was no hassle for me. Yes the trucks in the morning are loud and busy, but Waikiki is early to bed, early to rise. I was already awake by 6am so I wasn't affected. It was very quiet at night in our room, so I was happy. The only issue I would point out is the air conditioner can be a little noisy and that's cause again, older hotel so no ducted air conditioning, I can forgive that, but it did keep our room nice and cool.The only grip I would say is the balcony could do with some furniture for sitting as its a great view of the city at night, but this is the only tiny grip I have. The man who hailed us a cab and helped us with directions in the lobby was so nice and friendly that we ended up tipping him $20 for his great service. He deserved it, he didn't act friendly and nice for a tip and we had some great laughs with him. The pool area was so nice and had no issues using hotel towels. I don't know why so many complaints about this hotel. The staff were friendly and accommodating, yes it's a little older hotel but its not a dump and I've been to a lot of hotels in my travels. I hate people picking on stuff that's not true. Don't listen to others and book this hotel with no doubts. It has some great views of city, sea and mountains. I cannot speak highly enough of my visit to Ambassador. I will be back one day that's for sure. Thanks guys for a great night spent with an awesome hotel. A++++

Husband and I, plus our daughter and teenage granddaughter came for a nine day visit from Australia. We booked online and hoped for the best. Value was good and layout of the room suited us very well. Unfortunately, the room was plain daggy with peeling paint, shabby furniture and awful, uncomfortable beds with linen that didn't look too clean. We had great balconies with fabulous views but no outdoor furniture so had to keep dragging the kitchen chairs out. But, despite all that we had a wonderful time and saw a lot in the short time we were there - our "kids" especially loved being amongst all the action of Halloween!! Most of the staff were lovely with beautiful smiles which is a big plus for this hotel.

We have stayed in Ambassador hotel twice now and so far we've got no complains. It's an older style hotel, which could use new updo here and there. Nevertheless, the room is very clean and good value for its ideal location. It's less than 5 mins walking to the main road where shops and restaurants are location. Customer service is fantastic...when the lady who helped us heard that it was our second time there, she gave us an upgrade to ocean view room - very kind and thoughtful! Everytime we asked a question at front desk, the staff was always helpful and quick to response, never waited longer than 1 minute in line. Wifi is avalaible throughout the hotel and room, which is great - don't need to go to the lobby each time just to check emails.Our room came with a kitchennette and a large fridge. It was good to be able to store bit of food / drinks and save a bit on eating out.They also provide filtered water and a plastic bottle for each person, refill station is near the lobby and is available anytime. Bikes are also provided as a part of resort fee of $20 amongst other amenities - pool, game room, etcAll in all, another pleasant stay at Ambassador hotel.

We've had the misfortune to stay at this hotel, but it was a last resort. The room needs a major redo (painting of the walls, cleaning the carpets, replace the damage dresser, replace the noisy air con, kitchenette cabinets need paint and maybe some shelf paper would help,and replace the tiles in the shower (the outside road is cleaner), just to name a few. The only good of this hotel was the front desk (Kari and Amber) was very helpful and housekeeping did there best, for what they had to work with. The price was reasonable, until you found out of all the additional fee's (i.e. Parking fees ($25.00 a day) and Resort Amenity Fees ($20.00 a day and Wi-Fi is included in this package). We could go on, but I think you get the idea.

My family came visiting to Oahu and booked three rooms at the Ambassador Waikiki.I have to start off by saying the staff and service are second to none! Karla the Guest Services manager checked us in super cheerfully and had already pre-assigned rooms on the same floor. We were able to get in a couple hours early too, which was much appreciated with two tired parents, two crazy kids, and two very tired grandparents. Everyone we encountered. including housekeeping, was very friendly. The activities concierge is ultra-helpful for information and trip planning. Definitely stop by to chat. They can also recommend and book tours and shuttles --most pick up right at the doorstep of the hotel. At checkout we discovered the kids (or maybe grandma and grandpa) had accidentally purchased some pay movies (childrens' movies, thank god) The front desk was great and removed the charges for the ones under a minute or so long...but there was a show they watched for 15+ minutes so of course we ponied up. Dang kids.My family booked a kitchenette category which includes mini-fridge, microwave, stovetop, toaster, all kitchen utensils and dishware. There may be other small appliances available by request (rice cooker). Keep in mind that Waikiki is incredibly limited for kitchenette/full kitchen types. You'll be hard pressed to even find an in-room microwave.Bathroom is spacious, with walk-in shower only. I don't think any of the units have bathtubs. Self parking is $25, on the cheaper side for Waikiki.We never visited the pool!The location is good-- for anyone that can walk reasonably. Waikiki is only 1.5 miles long so its very easy to get to beach, food, shopping, groceries. However, this place is on the outer fringes: since Grandma and Grandpa can't go more than a half mile without resting, even the quarter mile walk to Ihop was rough. The half-mile to the beach? They said forget it! Downstairs is a well stocked convenience store, and a Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf kiosk. The nearest eatery would be right across the street: Vit's Hawaiian Steakhouse which has good breakfast and reasonably priced dinner. There is also Protea Café at the Luana hotel for fantastic breakfasts/coffee/smoothies-- lunch is just OK. All other shopping and dining will begin 5-10 minutes walking. The nearest full service grocery store, Food Pantry is a mile away.The rooms are clean, linens are fresh. However the furniture, paint, cabinetry, flooring, are old and chipped, scratched, rusty, out of alignment. Completely functional but run-down! Sorry Ambassador, needs some work! I'll have to be honest: for kitchenettes or full kitchen accommodations, I'd have to recommend the Luana Waikiki across the street. Its clean, semi-modern Hawaiian style with wood flooring and granite countertops, nice amenities. Price may be a bit more per night depending on the season, but worth the cost. They're a solid four dot hotel. Alternatively, the Ohana West and Ohana Malia are good choices if Luana is too expensive: They have some kitchenette rooms, and facilities are slightly more updated than the Ambassador. They are also more convenient to shops and dining, but in turn have limited options for view category rooms. Keep in mind that noise is a hot issue as you get closer to city center.Bottom line: the Ambassador is a great place for super budget travelers. Families who book a kitchenette and are willing to prepare meals will definitely find the best value here. You get good service and a clean, functional room. This place will be quieter than almost all other hotels, even in the lower category. If the Ambassador ever goes through a renovation and remains reasonably priced, I'd definitely be back to check it out. A helpful tip: ALWAYS book directly with the hotel and check for specials, or if you book through a third party make extra-sure of all your options! My family booked a package through JTB which forced the group of four adults and two kids to purchase three partial ocean view kitchenette rooms. They didn't need a third room to begin with, and definitely didn't need all three to be kitchenette types.

Stayed here for a business trip. From day one this woman at the front desk named Kerry was unaccommodating, rude and just plain unfriendly with a smile (those are the worst) she exuded the worst form of customer service it was actually funny!! Maybe it was the fact that I was Asian and so was she and she was on the other side of the counter NOT "a tourist"... I just don't know why else she would have had such a bad attitude being the 1st person you see entering their establishment..Their loss, glad it was a business trip ~ cause I don't want to have anything to do with paying her salary .. with MY money!

Our family has just spent 9 nights at the Ambassador Hotel and it was a great place to stay. Although the kitchenette could do with updating and the air conditioners were noisy it was a great room, spacious enough to fit a family of four. The lifts could be a little slow during the day but there were always people coming and going. It has its own carpark out the back, the Business Centre was great, it also had a laundry and games room for kids. Our stove had one hotplate not working and the iron didn't work but before my husband could get back up to the 14th floor after reporting it to reception the maintenance man had already arrived and had it fixed. The pool and pool area were clean and inviting and there were convenient locations for smokers.The hotel is around three blocks to the shopping area and restaurants in the main section of town and about the same to the beach. It is also close to the trolley stops for shopping and tours. There is a great little coffee shop attached to the lobby and a general store right next door to that. It was in a good section of town where we felt safe walking around night and day.The staff were friendly and helpful and always greeted you. Shandell and Jeff were absolutely the best, always friendly and interested in how your day was and willing to chat and offer advice and information if they weren't busy.Would have no hesitation in staying there again or recommending it to others.

This property is well located in a quiet spot a short walk from the beach and restaurants the staff are very friendly and polite , the hotel itself is clean but very shabby and old fashioned I tore the shoulder of a brand new shirt on a small piece of sharp metal on the edge of a door when bringing our suitcases into the room fortunately I'm tall anyone shorter would have cut their face or worse their eye -NOT GOOD the only consolation is that the hotel is apparently cheap for Waikiki apart from the exorbitant parking fees and very unfair resort charges for services most of us will never use .We would have preferred to pay more and get better accommodation all in all if you're young or on a serious budget this hotel will be good for you otherwise keep searching .

Our room was clean and towels fresh and fluffy. Daily maid service never missed a beat. The front desk was very helpful and there was not a day that passed that we were not greeted by the front desk management with a good morning or recognition. The business center was helpful. The pool area was fresh and clean. We were very happy with our stay and look forward in staying again. We would like the all the staff to know how happy we were.Michael & Todd

I should admit that the Ambassador hotel is the best hotel ever you are going to live in. It is cheap and worthy, they provide you all what you need from transportation to entertainment with the lowest & acceptable price. Thank you Shandell for making my presence in Honolulu is the best vacation ever, she is friendly to the extreme limits & patient to drive to the costumers the best quality which they deserve.

I went through orbitz and booked this hotel. Messed up on the dates and was not able to change it due to their cancellation policy. Which is horrible...you still pay full price to change/cancel your reservation. So basically I had to add on another day so I wouldn't lose out on $. There is a $25/day parking fee & $20 wifi (amenities) fee. Which the lady didn't even tell me about and just asked if we needed wifi. The room is liveable but not pleasant looking. Had a kitchenette with a rusty looking fridge. Shower was gross, didn't even drain well. Patches on the walls, TV is so small and reception for it was garbage. I've been in hotels that were the same price as this and had way better accommodations. They don't even have towels by the pool and they claim the pool has toys for use..all they had was broken noodles floating around. The front door is super loud and hard to open same as the balcony door..it screeches!! Apparently this was a 3 1/2 star hotel, but I think people were just being nice. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone....

This hotel is close to everything, restaurants, bars, beaches, nightlife and public transport. There is no need to hire a car if you are staying here. $2.50 on a bus or trolley gets you anywhere on Oahu that you want and stops right out the front of the hotel. The staff were lovely... nothing was too much trouble for them, WIFI was free, the air con was great, the pool lovely, the rooms were well maintained and the view from the higher floors was beautiful.I will definitely stay here when I visit Oahu again.Mahalo for your wonderful service!

I stayed at this hotel in early Sept for 2 nights.For the rates I paid, this is a great deal given the location right on Kuhio.It is basic, yet clean and the bedroom & bathroom are large and adequate.Plus there is free Wi-Fi.The staff is friendly and helpful.I've paid way more for hotels in the Waikiki area in the past so this hotel is a great deal.

I booked this hotel on september 21 for October 6 thru 15.On 26 of september i got really sick went to doctor and i find out i got Vertigo,really bad medical condition.I cancel the flight(they return me they money back)but the hotel they don t wanna refund me nothing.I try to talk to the manager which is very hard to get in touch with.I have my medical condition from doctor,and i told them about everything,but still nothing.The worst experience ever.I will not recommend this hotel to nobody.

Stayed here for the second time for three nights. I was in the wing behind the main hotel. The room was run down and with the walls all cinder block, looked like a prison. But the cinder block walls are soundproof so the room was very quiet. This is an older hotel that caters to tour groups of Japanese tourists. It is very basic-BUT it is less expensive than other Waikiki hotels which is why I stayed there. The room had a lanai but no chairs which I remedied by moving a chair outside from the room. The bed was clean and comfortable and the wifi worked great. Please note that there is wi fi in each room which was not the case a year ago so ignore what you read in older posts. Unlike most hotels which allow only one device on their wifi , this hotel allowed at least two so I could access with both my Ipad and Iphone.Parking is $25 a night but I booked a room where parking was included for $20 a night. Parking spaces seemed sufficient. Note there is a parking garage across the street attached to a hotel that had a sign advertising parking for $7 a day. However, I have no idea if that included overnight or in and out privileges but if you have time is worth checking out.There is a coffee hut right outside the front door. Also, right around the corner is a Whalers General Store with all kinds of drinks, yogurt as well as a good variety of fresh sandwiches. There is a Tony Romas a block away and numerous other places to eat walking south on Kuhio.So if you want to save money but don't expect more than a very basic, older hotel, stay here.

The best things of the hotel are the location, the personnel and the value for the money. It is located a block away from the beach and the city parade pass right by it. The staff provides good quality of service and are well inform of the surroundings. The hotel price is good and even with the amenities and parking fees, the total price is better than what other hotel in the area offer. It is not update but it is very clean.

I booked 3 different hotels for my trip last week to Oahu Hawaii, and the Ambassador was the third hotel we stayed in. unfortunately it was a sad way to end a very nice vacation on the island. First off, the booking was prepaid on Expedia and we only expected to pay $20 addition resort fee when we checked in as specified at time of booking. Little did we know that they would attempt to extort $30 more dollars for us having our 13 year old boy with us. Even though we had booked the reservation for two adults and one child prepaid to Expedia. They then told us that parking anywhere else would result in our car being towed so we have to pay $25 more for parking. A street just blocks away was free for the weekend and across the street the parking was $18. The staff was rude and difficult and when I showed the confirmed reservation receipt printed out, they didn't want to look at it and insisted their policy was their policy. The property itself was dark and dreary and felt more like low income housing over a resort...still not sure what the fees were for. All exits were locked shut and there was no way out except the front door...not safe in the event of an emergency. I would not stay at this hotel again if it were free. Gives Waikiki a bad name if you ask me. If you choose to stay here, just remember I told you so.

The hotel was OK, of course, it was looking definitely much better on the pictures on hotels.com, location was great, in the heart of Waikiki, value for the money. Cons were hotel did not have restaurant, pool and the bathroom was quite outdated.

Hotel was old and dated, however, very clean. Employees were fabulous!!! Could not have been more accommodating and friendly. The employees more than made up for the outdated rooms. All in all, not so bad if your looking for an affordable room in Waikiki. Conveniently located to everything you need.

Reasonable value for Waikiki, this budget hotel has lots of extra charges (resort fee, parking, early check in, late check out etc.) that can soon add up.Room was clean if basic (don't let website pictures fool you, you will NOT get a room like that unless you pay for it), staff were consistently polite and friendly. Pool area is good, if prone to getting crowded and a little rowdy on our visit.Overall a fair option in an expensive town.

Livable.....air conditioning in wall blows on your head all the time when in bed. No furniture on porch. Very old outdated with very small all flat screen. Nice staff. So outdated and boring you must be desperate to book here like I was.

Thank you (Mahalo) to every staff person who naturally shared their obvious love of each customer with kindness and a beautiful smile. I could not sneak by the desk without a glance up (when busy with customers) and how are you doing and a smile! Beautiful smiles - true caring for everything I needed! The area is fabulous and it is a close walk to Waikiki Beach, shopping, parking and the sweetest little coffee and tea shop in Hawaii! I took awesome photos from my balcony.

We stayed for week the first week of September. We were kindly greeted upon arrival. After that....forget it....you were basically non exisitent. Staff do not look or talk to you unless you talk first. Kerry is the rudest of the bunch. The rest are "just there to do their job". She would not give me a bandage. She told me they had none. Previous day....other desk clerk asked me how many I needed. I must have taken the last one...huh!Security is non existent. Police cars out front hotel most nights. Desk clerks see non registered guests waiting for elevator ....are well aware that they are not guests, because they ask them straight up while standing behind the counter. The desk guy asked them to leave id...the non guests said ok as they entered the elevator and doors closed and but let them proceed. No after action. Rooms smell but are clean. They met are needs. Housekeeping do an amazing job. We were supplied with sufficient towels and toiletries for our crew.

My first bad review.... This place was horrible. The female attendant behind the front desk was rude for starters. Maybe she was having a bad day... But she had a nasty attitude all week. It was so bad here that we double booked into another hotel (Aulani), because coming back was a drag on our aloha spirits. It appears the remodeling was last done in the 70s. With it's popcorn ceiling to its fixtures. Even the elevator was out of date. Sometimes it's just better to pay more to go to a hotel that's going to fit your needs.

Thank you to the staff that went above & beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I didn't know that I was going to be on the 18th floor and normally I always special request for the lowest floor possible because my fear of heights. But they did not hesitate to accommodate me to the 2nd flr with even a better & spacious room. Thank you to Shaundell & Sean Gabriel for making this possible words can't explain how comfortable and relaxed you made my stay. Thank you to housekeeping as well, my housekeeper that came everyday fit my needs without question. This hotel gets 5 star for me without question. We will be back!

It wasn't looking good when our reservation thru Groupon was mixed up and Groupon was closed for the weekend. But the staff stepped up and solved the problem and took good care of our large family. Our stay was 2 weeks long and we found the staff to be friendly and extremely helpful. Room was kept clean and enough extra towels supplied without continually asking. Carpet was new. Hotel provides reusable water bottles and filtered water in the lobby. Close to shopping and quick breakfast/coffee. Room had full kitchen with smaller oven and 4 burner stove and full fridge which helped us save a lot of dining expense. Suggest to hotel to update the kitchen by replacing countertop and cabinetry, and look at replacing stove burners. Add a little color by painting in bathroom, similar to the new paint scheme in the hallways. All cosmetic but will improve the "feel." Already while there, the staff was repainting the facility and we learned that was due to new ownership. Kids really enjoyed the new game room, especially during the threat of hurricane. Easy walk to Waikiki Beach thru the park across the street.

I booked this hotel originally for 2 nights but I had to cancel the 2nd night as my experience was so bad and had to book a room at another hotel. Right at check in, the customer service and vibe coming from the employees were bad. The female who checked me in (Cathy) was very rude to my daughter and I. Being a single mother travelling with my teenage daughter, Cathy gave me one of the more old and "sketchy" rooms of the hotel. The room was old and nothing compared to the pictures shown on their website. The linen was dirty and the AC did not work and we had to wait for an hour to get the technician in to fix it. For the price I paid, it was definitely not worth it compared to the other boatload of hotels available in Waikiki. And that says a lot since I was in Hawaii for a week and I was very satisfied with the other hotel I stayed at down the street. The hotel is a bit worn out, as the floors leading to hotel rooms were carpet and it was open walled, so when it rained (which it did), the rain would get on the carpet and it would be soggy and disgusting. The check in experience was very uncomfortable for my daughter and I, and I will never stay at this hotel again. I filed a complaint to their assistant manager Randy, and they never even emailed me back with a response to which they said they would. In Waikiki, there are so much more hotels that are undoubtedly better than Ambassador and was definitely not worth my money nor the time they wasted during my trip.

I think this hotel is in a good location, but tired looking for the price. The staff are very helpful and cheerful, except one of the concierge (female) was less friendly.Something that Concerned me was the popcorn ceiling in our room was flaking off, and it had fallen on my son's face, and bed during the night. The hotel was built in 1968 when some popcorn ceiling still contained asbestos and this worried me. I wish I could have taken a sample to have it tested. Has anyone else noticed the popcorn ceiling debris?

the ambassador is old and our room smell like something die. I would not recommend this place to anybody. check out the place before you make a reservation. and check the company you make your reservation to see if there any extra fees.

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon through a groupon deal. It is a decent hotel, nothing to rave about, but the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are big and has decent views if you have a room higher up (we stayed on the 16th floor). It has a pool, close to shopping and all the restaurants. It is all a person needs - if you like the upgrades and fancy stuff I wouldn't recommend, But the location is good and has all the basics a person needs.

Staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. But hotel is very old; room and bathroom badly in need of updating. No counter space in bathroom at all. Overpriced for the condition of the rooms. Don't think it's that safe of a location to be walking at night either.

I would give this place 0 stars if I could or if it weren't for the nice manager Sean. This place is very old, out dated,  and dirty. It's worse than a motel 6, but they charge like a 4 star hotel. Spend an extra $25 bucks and stay at a nicer hotel (parkshore was only $17 more,  across the street from the beach and way nicer and cleaner!!) Seriously.   I booked 2 nights at the ambassador,  at $150 a night. .. Yea,  waikiki hotels are expensive.  But this isn't even walking distance to the beach.  I get there, they add $30 a night for an extra person (even though I booked a triple bed room) and then $20 resort fee and $25 for handicap parking.  So we're talking $225+ a night for a 1-2 star motel!  This was totally unacceptable to me.  Not to mention, the front desk service was so rude and unaccomodating. Kathy, the "lead" specifically. She would be so nice to other customers,  giving coupons, recommendations, asking if they need help with their luggage,  going over all the amenities,  perks, "let me know if there is anything I could do to help make your stay more comfortable" smiling the whole way through and then to me and my family - her attitude was like "what do you want?" She was rude, did not offer any of the services she offered the person in front of me. She interrupted me in themiddle of my question, was just mean and  unprofessional. The male staff were super friendly and helpful.  I decided to talk to the manager Sean about our situation, and he was real nice,  accommodating putting us in a lower floor (my mom can't walk very far and is afraid of heights), upgraded us to a room with a kitchen (the whole building in general is just really old and kinda gross), and waived some of the extra fees. If it weren't for him,  we probably would have went to a different hotel.  Seriously, don't waste your money here.  poor location,  poor service,  dirty (I didn't even want to take off my flip flops to shower)  really old building and amenities,  totally not worth the money.

This was our second stay at The Ambassador, Waikiki, and from the moment we arrived we felt like we were coming home. They front desk people were so friendly to jet lagged people from the southern hemisphere. They checked us in immediately so were able to have a shower and change before heading out to rediscover Waikiki. The room cleaners were there every day changing the linen and cleaning the apartment. If I had anything negative to say It would be that the free wi fi should be available in your room and not having to come down to the foyer to access is.

I stayed 1 night at this hotel due to a booking glitch on my part. The room seemed clean but there was a nasty smell on one of the pillows. The TV didn't work properly and the carpet could stand a cleaning. There were rust stains throughout the carpentry. If you're on a tight budget and don't mind below average accommodations, it's fine. If you have a few more $$ in the budget, spend it on a higher rated hotel.

The hotel has a good location at the Western end of Kuhio Avenue, you can walk from the hotel to every place in Waikiki. The rooms are very basic, not to say ugly - but clean and with a nice view. Regarding hotel prices in Waikiki, I can't complain about this place - but cosy is spelled differently.

My family stayed at the Ambassador Hotel Waikiki for a couple of days. This is the second time we have stayed at the Ambassador. It is acceptable for the price, but is dated. The location is good, in the center of all the action in Waikiki. The rooms are spacious, but again, older furnishings. There is a good view of the beach from the rooms, but it is several blocks from the beach. The service is fine, but not outstanding. The best part of this hotel is the price. It is very reasonably priced for Waikiki. Although the price is good, we probably will not be back. For a little more, we can go to another hotel and get more modern facilities. But if you are worried about price, this is a good option.

The Ambassador Hotel was well priced to suit my 'comfort level' whilst in Honolulu. The Hotel is clean, efficient, helpful and overall a good place to stay. I found the $20 fee extra per day - initially a little disconcerting but the Wi Fi, Pool & bike (2 hours only) made it a little more palatable..... Bottom line is I feel that Honolulu, for the average working person, is a little 'hard on the pocket' - you get what you pay for hence the Ambassador lived up to my expectations...and a little more!

We got stuck in Oahu due to our flight. Of course, in high season - if you need a room same day - you have not much choices, except you don't mind to pay 400+$ for one night. Therefore we was happy to get a room in the Ambassador Hotel. It would not have been our first choice for a family vacation and staying there for longer, however if you without kids and active all day long, so you only need a place to sleep it might a perfect budget solution. The location is perfect.

We stayed here the first week of June. The reception staff gave us a warm welcome. Our room was exactly as in the picture. Although not top end luxury it ticked all the boxes. Very spacious. It had a balcony with no furniture but with a table and 2 chairs in the room we just put these on the balcony when we needed them and enjoyed beer and wine bought from the ABC shop beside the hotel at very decent prices. The white zinfandel is cheap and lovely. The room has a fridge to keep your drinks cool and there is an ice machine on one of the floors. We had a kettle too but no mugs. The bathroom has a walk in shower. A bit dated but plenty of hot water and shampoo is provided but no body wash. The wardrobe is in the bathroom with plenty of storage space and a free safe and iron and ironing board. There's a decent hairdryer too. What more could we want. The air conditioning is noisy but at times we left it off. Oh and wifi extends to your room and it's free too. We had a brilliant signal. The TV had some decent channels. In reception there is a person at a desk that will book your trips. I booked ahead with Shaka tours, they were cheaper than other companies and used Roberts of Hawaii who were excellent. We did Pearl Harbor and Honolulu highlights, circle island tour and The Chief's Luau. The food wasn't up to much at the Luau but The Chief is such a genuine warm person he makes the show. The Hotel has a pool with loungers and umbrella's and was fine for a couple of afternoons rest. This hotel is ideal for anywhere you want to go to. Very near the beach, through Fort Derussey Park. 5 minutes to eating places. Try IHOP for breakfast. $8.95 for a breakfast and a stack of pancakes. Coffee is extra but cheap and they give you a flask on the table full of it. It's good for other meals too. Prices are not expensive compared to England. The same or less. We took too much spending money. Hard Rock Cafe has a happy hour after 10.00 at night. Cocktails $5 and A pint of beer $4 and a live band. Try Arnold's beach bar beside Eggs and Things. Cheap drinks all day. Mai Tai's are lovely and strong. It's down a side alley and looks a bit grim but locals seem to drink there. Honolulu zoo is within walking distance and really nice. Beware the bugs though it's the only place I got bitten. The Ambassador is a lovely place to stay when you'd rather stay down budget and keep the money you save on not having all the frills to spend on other things, Give it a try. I'm pleased we did.

While planning our 9 days vacation in Oahu, we searched for a decent, simple and affordable hotel which is located within the Waikki area. Since we booked several tours and we will be out most of the time, Ambassador a Hotel is very ideal. It is walking distance to Waikiki beach, Kalakaua Avenue, and Ala Moana Center. Several convenience stores (ABC and Whalers) and bus stops are a few steps away. Our room has two queen beds, kitchenette complete with ref, electric four burner stove with oven, microwave oven, bread toaster, percolator, pots, china and silver wares and other cooking utensils, hand towels but no pot holder. The bathroom is quite small but the toiletries were replenished daily. There is flat screen tv. There are no chairs in the veranda, most probably its purpose is a view deck since you can see the Waikiki beach from there. Drinking water is available in the ground floor and laundrynette is in the second floor. An average size pool is in the third floor. Our room was fixed and cleaned daily. Hotel staff were kind and courteous. For practical reasons, this hotel is very ideal for us, we only need a place to sleep, rest and have our personal needs done since our main purpose was to tour Oahu and make the most of our time going to scenic spots and to sample all the dining places and go shopping.

This is just my experience and point of view. For the average traveler who experienced hotels ranging from Motel 6 to the Windsor, this hotel is boarder line motel status. But if you are on spring break and all hell is breaking lose, you would not see anything wrong with this place. If you are with your family and have the time to observe detail you would be extremely disappointed.Pros:Price- sometimes but there is a certain price is not worth it.-location is pretty good-cleanliness decent -Pool-no complaintsCons: Attention to details-rusted refrigerator door-ROOMS OPEN TO WALKWAY LIKE APARTMENTS, soaked when raining-A/C is a bedroom style single unit: made noise and taped up at the bottom.-On the 9th floor you can hear the back up buzzer of the tour bus at 4AM. -Patio/Lanai area no furniture-strange-Outdated carpets-TV feels small like a 22-32 inch screen-Lobby first indicator of Weirdness-No bed skirt -Four guest, "4" pillows and only 2 towels. Simple Math!Overall it depends on if you have needs of getting a hotel or you have time to get a good hotel. I personally would not stay there again unless I have to.

We made a reservation last minute by calling the telephone number provided on the hotels website, when we arrived the staff claimed we hadn't got one and we arguing with us about the difference in the telephone numbers / call centres on their website - not the best concierge service I've received and not what you need after a 11 hour flight ! Eventually they found is a room which stunk of stale cigarettes masked by white paint. The room was old, tired noisy and bad value for money. The location is at the very end of the strip and better value can be found renting a private condo which is what we did after 1 night.

We recently stayed at the Amabassador with our 3 children. We stayed in the city view suite with 4 beds. There was a bedroom with a full size bed and one twin. The livingroom couches turned into 2 twin beds, as well. My husband and I opted to put the 3 children in the bedroom (there is no tv in there) and we just pushed the 2 twins together and slept in the living room. The kitchen was stocked with the utensils and pans that we needed to cook, however they did not have any hotpads/potholders. The room was very large with a lot of drawers for all of our belongings. We stayed in room 713 which had a wrap around private balcony that we LOVED! We've been to Waikiki 2 other times and stayed in other hotels. This was the first time we hardly heard sirens at night. The walk to Waikiki beach was a little long for my 6 year old but we made it. The hotel is close to a mile away from the Waikiki beach but is closer to the military beach (can't remember the name). Safe neigborhood. Parking is $25 a day but we researched all of Waikiki and that is the normal fare for parking. There is barely any street parking and it's always being used :( Staff was VERY friendly and remembered us each day even though the hotel was full. The pool was very nice, as well. We will definitely be staying here again.

Stayed here the second half of my second trip to Oahu. This hotel is maybe a 1-star. The staff are sort of friendly. One night I went for a run and asked the front desk to hold me key, they said no as I had no ID to pick it back up. I asked him if he was working all night he said yes. I asked him what would happen if I lost while on my run as I had no pockets. He replied with "well we couldn't let you into your room", so then I said okay Id have to sleep in the lobby then?? he huffed, sighed, rolled his eyes and then said he would do it ONLY once. The beach towels are located on the second floor. Which is fine except you get a sign out slip that your supposed to bring back with you when you return the towels (extra hassle for no reason). The elevators at the hotel have a mind of their own, I had to push the button 5 different times (light on, light off, no elevator, repeat) The beds are not very comfortable unless you like hard bed. The rooms are plain but I did have a mirror. If you like to swim at a pool this hotel does have that going for it. NO free local calls, they charge a dollar each! Other hotels with the same price point are nicer (Like the Aqua Aloha Surf- same price way better amenities). This hotel also only provides shampoo and soap (no lotion, conditioner or gel body wash)

We have just spent two nights at this hotel. My sister, brother in law, husband and myself shared a one bedroom unit. It was clean and comfortable. The beds were good as were the pillows. It is an old hotel but very handy to everything and I would stay here again if ever back in Waikiki.

Dale T
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: I stayed for a week here, in a room with a kitchen - which we wanted, but then didn't use! I agree with other reviewers about the décor being a little tired, and could be updated - maybe with more tropical colours.We were very close to the beach, and walked there (about 10 - 15 minutes to closest at Fort De Russy park) several times, and also used the pool most days.We were close to bus stops for getting into shops and Honolulu, which were nice and cheap ($2.50 each leg) and easy to find.Staff were really helpful for giving directions and very generous with local area maps - very appreciated. A room compendium with all information in one place would have been helpful - I had some messages on the phone, and did not have enough information in room to be able to retrieve without asking reception for help.It was handy to have the laundry room available - and not expensive either.We ate at the hotel across the road for breakfast a couple of times, which was convenient. Also walking distance to some good restaurants, including Tony Roma's and Red Lobster.I think I would stay again - for a decent sized room with kitchen, it was good value for money, and quite a central location.

If you want something basic and no frills then this is for you. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Rooms are not that well insulated compared to both the Hilton's we stayed in, you could hear outside noise easily, ie rubbish pickup, trucks etc. Though I would definitely recommend staying somewhere a bit more expensive if you can afford it, much quiter and better facilities. Kitchen was very useful and was clean and well house kept. Concierge was only available during the day and not at night when you need it most. WiFi worked well in the rooms, was fast and reliable.

This hotel is basic but functional. We had a kitchenette with full size fridge/freezer, stove and all basic utensils and dishes .It helped save money, we made most of the meals ourselves. It also has a washer and dryer at a reasonable cost. But most of all is its position on the Waikiki beach. The hotel has no other buildings in front of it and although is not directly on the beach it offered a view of the beach. From the hotel we could walk in both directions to explore the area. It is a good hotel for tourists who are interested in seeing and doing and coming home to sleep and shower. if you plan on spending time in the hotel, it may not be for you. Cleaning could be better. Higher floors offer better view of the Waikiki beach.

I stayed here from May 18-25, 2014.The staff are amazingly friendly and very accommodating. I appreciate the security that is involved in getting onto the elevator and into the parking lot. It makes it feel so much safer. It may be a bit inconvenient, but I challenge anyone to say that safer isn't better when travelling abroad.I enjoyed the convenience of most things surrounding the hotel and was a short distance from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. The kitchenettes are stocked well with utensils, pots and pans so if you want to cook in your room, you can make just about anything.I would most definitely recommend this hotel but ask for ocean views and higher up floors (I was on the 15th floor and saw tons).

It was my second time staying in this hotel. The room is very big, much better than the Aqua Waikiki pearl for the same room type. The cleaning lady is very good always making up the room very tidy. The middle age guy in the front desk is very help like two years ago. The location is little bit far from the DFS, around 10 to 15 mins walk, but if you do not mind walking along the street is a good hotel for the budegt, The old male receptionist is a little bit slow for check in and out and answering the questions, compared with him, the middle age receptionist who worked at the night shift on May 22 is very helpful.

I believe this hotel was amazing for the price I paid for it. It wasn't extravagant or anything and was nice in its own way. It is a short walking distance to the beach and lots of shopping areas including a mall that has all high end stores as well as affordable places. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and plan on being out of the hotel most of the time. The staff is very friendly and upgraded my room to a suite with a kitchen for no cost! There is no need to spend all of your money in really expensive hotels when you have places like this that are close to everything and you can still enjoy Waikiki all the same!!!!

Stayed here for a night at the end of a trip to Hawaii, so we could catch an early flight. We had a family room with kitchen, which we didn't use. The decor was very tired but clean enough. Towels were old, small and thin. Even though we were on the 14th floor there was a lot of traffic noise. I used the business centre to check in for my flight, and the pcs were ancient and slow, with out of date browser software. When I tried to print my boarding pass the printer didn't work. On the plus side, it was close to downtown Waikiki. And there was parking. Didn't have much interaction with staff, but they were pleasant enough. It did the job, but one night was enough.

This hotel is a little average for the price you pay, but does the trick if you are wanting to spend more of your time out on the mainland. It is in a good location, walking distance to most shops and bus stops.There is only wifi in the lobby, which was pretty annoying.Staff very friendly and helpful.

the location right in the heart of Waikiki beach is excellent, 5 min walk to the beaches, 10 minutes to the shopping centers, bus station in front,quiet surroundings at night, downstairs big convenience store and coffee shop, good pool 3rd fl, guest launderette check in/ check out fast and professional, very friendly staff the room was huge with 2 queens, balcony, iron and board, fully equipped kitchenette with big fridge, the in room safe is more than big enough for a 15' laptop, flatscreen tv, wired internet at the room, wifi in public area, it's not a new place but good maintained and absolutely clean, we will be back

It's a hotel in a good location and that's what we were looking for. Nothing fancy but for the price, we got what we expected. About a 15 minute walk from Duke's, etc. Bus stops all around to wherever you want to go. Used the "business center" to print boarding passes which was very handy. Must have been a fire station nearby as there were sirens much of the time. Our room was on the second floor and there were no stairs with one elevator out of service and two VERY slow elevators which really sucked.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. It's the best deal on the island. The room was a king bed with a balcony. It was very clean and housekeeping did a sensational job everyday. Within walking distance to everything. Staff is SUPER friendly and helpful with directions and things to do. Room is basic but if you're on Oahu to stay in the room, you're doing it wrong. Stay here! It's wonderful!

We booked this room for one night. We were vacationing in Maui but chose to see what Waikiki had to offer. The front desk receptionist were both amazing. They allowed us to check in a little early. Gave great suggestions on where to eat. We stayed in one of their Penthouse rooms. The room was clean but yet really didn't feel so clean. Not quit sure if it was the carpet or that the building in old. No wifi in the rooms only in the downstairs lobby. Although I booked for 6 I had to pay additional $30 for a rollaway due to not enough beds. The wrap around balcony was excellent we could see the ocean on onside and the mountains of the other. If you do book for a large party be prepared to share the ONE shower in one of the bedrooms. The restroom in hallway is only a two piece. I really think what made this an okay stay was that the staff was truly wonderful. The location is great it is in walking distance to everything. If you don't mind a 10 minute walk.

Do yourself a favor and stay here on your holiday.. Stayed 11 days and have no complaints.. Would recommend to everyone.. This is the best hotel deal around treat yourself... Staff was very nice and helped every time I needed them. Nice neat rooms no dust or mold.. Do it right and stay at this hotel..

I stayed at the Ambassador in Waikiki for 5 nights while I was in Hawaii for a wedding. I figured any hotel in Waikiki would be decent enough, but I was wrong. Everything in this hotel is old and outdated. I felt like I was staying at a hotel in Mad Men. Let me also state that I only travel a couple times a year and don't stay in that many hotels (besides Vegas). I have also worked in customer service for 10+ years, so I know good service when I get it. The bathroom and shower were terrible. There was only one free standing sink, which I didn't mind since I was traveling alone, but there was zero bathroom counter space. I'm a guy, so I'm low maintenance. I need somewhere to put my toothbrush, toothpaste, and my hair gel. That's it. But with the lack of counter space, I had to use the toilet tank to set my toothbrush and gel, and nearly had a close call dropping my toothbrush into the toilet. I have no idea what a girl would do with this space with makeup and other toiletries.The shower was even worse. It was a stand-up shower with no tub (didn't matter to me), and felt like the tile hadn't been upgraded since the place was built (my guess is 40-50 years ago). Needless to say, I wore my flip flops into the shower. The shower head also sprayed in 30 different directions, which was fun. The worst part of it all, was the front desk customer service. One day (the day of the wedding, of course), I did not have hot water!! WHAT?! I took a cold shower then ran off to the wedding since I was running late, waiting and hoping for hot water to turn on. When I told the front desk about this as I was checking out, she asked me if I called and told them. I had not (my mistake). She said no one else complained about it, so it must have just been my room and I should have called them about it. I told her I was running late and didn't have time to complain so I took a cold shower, then asked if she was going to do anything about it to make it up to me. She responded with "what do you want me to do about it?". She never once apologized or showed any empathy towards my situation. I had to ask her to waive a measly $20 parking fee, which she went behind the counter to get "supervisor approval". Oh, I almost forgot! The only place in this hotel with WiFi is the hotel lobby! So the lobby was always packed with people sitting and standing around using the WiFi, it was difficult to even walk through sometimes. I found an ethernet cable in my room and called the front desk to see if I could hook up my laptop to it for internet access. The front desk told me that cable is for a modem and not my laptop, so I needed to buy a modem. Stupid me, I didn't even try to hook up my laptop. So I went out and bought a modem and tried hooking it up. It didn't work, so I called the ever-informative front desk. Now, they told me I can hook up my laptop directly to the cable and I don't need a modem. I told her that the last person I spoke with told me I needed a modem, but she didn't care. Between the terrible shower, lack of hot water, poor customer service, and the rock-hard bed and tiny TV (both of which I didn't even mention), I would never stay at this hotel again. It felt like I was staying at a hostel. For the price they charge per night, this hotel is way overpriced for it's amenities, and they don't even attempt to make up for it through their customer service. The only thing decent about this hotel is the location, which earned them 1 star. That and I can't figure out how to give it zero stars.

We stayed at the Ambassador from April 5th to 12th, 2014. We loved it there; large room cleaned and supplies replaced every day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Good security; the elevator wouldn't work without your room card. Well equipped business center included in the price. Very central; 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and several very nice eating places. The only thing that could have been better would have been FREE parking, but overall, a great value!! We would return.

We stayed from April 1-10. I was traveling with 5 adults and two children ( 4 and 6 months). We had two rooms both with kitchens. This hotel was perfect for us. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions. The only way to get wifi in your room is with a laptop. Each room is hardwired so all you have to do is plug in the Cat five wire. The only draw back for this hotel was the pool. Pool hours are from 10am to 7pm. I will stay at this hotel again.If you are planing on renting a car I would contact Hawaiian Discount Rentals. We rented a minivan at a great price.

Great hotel that covers all the essentials. Perfect location for Waikiki beach and the main shopping areas. Tip for anyone looking at visiting Pearl Harbor from this hotel. Forget the tour sales person in reception. Catch the 42 bus from Saratoga Avenue round the corner. Costs 2.50 instead of 80 dollars the tour guides charge to get there.

I stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed it very much. Loved the location. Near enough to all the action but far enough away to get out if the busy noisy shopping area. Great sized room. Wonderful bathroom and kitchenette. Pool is a bit small but the beach is close enough, go swim with some turtles!!Only problem was the noise at night. We were in the second floor and could hear every bus that arrived and the rubbish removal all through the night. I would request a room on the other side of the hotel next time, away from Namahana St.

This hotel is fine for people on a budget.The location is excellent. Close to everything, Also only a block away from the beach. Excellent choice of places to eat.From the expensive to the very cheap. all within walking distance.If you are looking for a resanoble priced hotel then this is for you . the rooms are spacious and most have cooking facilities.The rooms need a make over but that is reflected in the price.As for the staff at reception,Nothing is a problem for them.They go out of there way to help you.and it is all done with a smile.Just a little tip,ask for a room above the 5th floor or you may be woken by noisy people in the car park.

When we got there they up graded us to kitchenette room. Very friendly, super clean and excellent location. We could walk every where that we wanted to go, take the trolley or rent a car. We had a marvelous stay at the Ambassador. Thinks ambassador see you in 2014.
